TechFlow, Inc. is seeking a talented UX designer to join our team and assist our customer in enhancing the public’s experience with their products and services. In this role, you will work closely with other CX/UX experts, including researchers, designers, and content writers, to create visually appealing and intuitive user interfaces that align with UX best practices. We are looking for individuals who are passionate about user-centered design and are eager to contribute to a variety of projects.

Responsibilities


Applies the User Experience methodology to process and software design to eliminate drag
Analyzes the information present, understands the rationale behind the requirements and proposes interface designs based on user needs
Research, conceptualize, design and make applications more usable and user friendly
Conduct user research and gather feedback to inform the design process
Implement usability best practices and ensure accessibility compliance in all design deliverables
Iterate on designs based on user feedback, stakeholder input, and business goals


Requirements


Bachelor’s Degree in a related field + 5 years of experience
Proficiency in design and prototyping tools such as Sketch, Adobe XD, or Figma
Strong understanding of user-centered design principles and methodologies
Knowledge of usability best practices and accessibility standards
Experience conducting user research and usability testing
Excellent communication and collaboration skills
Ability to obtain and maintain a Public Trust security clearance


About TechFlow

Founded in 1995, TechFlow is a leading provider of innovative engineering, technology, integration, and support services to the Federal Government. With a strong track record in delivering mission-critical solutions, we are committed to helping our clients achieve their goals while driving innovation and excellence.

At TechFlow, we foster a culture of collaboration, creativity, and continuous learning. We believe in empowering our employees and providing them with the opportunities and resources they need to succeed. As an employee-owned company, we are proud to have a team of dedicated professionals who are fully invested in our success.

#techflow

Benefits

TechFlow, Inc is 100% employee-owned. Come make a difference in a job that contributes to your future and helps us build an agile workplace!


Employee stock ownership plan (ESOP) – Pride in being an employee-owner and annual employer contribution (per plan guidelines)
401k plan with Roth option
Eligibility for an employer match
Immediate vesting
Paid time off
Holidays – 11 paid holidays per year
Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision plans
Company-paid Life & AD&D insurance plan
Employee Assistance Program
Wellness Resources
Company-paid training and development program
Voluntary benefits include:
Life & AD&D Insurance for employee, spouse, and children
Short-term and long-term disability (per plan guidelines)
Legal Shield and Identity Theft protection plans
Pet Insurance

Company: Advantis Global is becoming INSPYR Solutions
Job_description:
About This Featured Opportunity

The UI/UX Designer will work on the transformation of an internal tool used by retail and corporate for capex/opex planning, reporting, work order management system, etc.

THE OPPORTUNITY FOR YOU

You will contribute to the design efforts for various modules, starting with the critical preservation module and extending to six more modules. You will sit with business stakeholders occasionally to gather user stories and understand processes. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to brainstorm and conceptualize design solutions. You will create wireframes, user flows, and prototypes to visualize design concepts. You will develop high-fidelity UI designs for web and mobile applications, ensuring consistency in design elements, such as fonts, colors, and branding. You will focus on creating an intuitive and user-friendly experience. You will conduct usability testing to gather insights and iterate on designs accordingly. You will work on information architecture and user journeys to optimize the overall UX. You will build interactive prototypes to showcase design concepts and user flows and gather feedback from stakeholders and end-users to refine and improve prototypes.

KEY SUCCESS FACTORS


3-5 years of experience in web-based and iOS application UI/UX design
Substantial understanding of and experience with maintaining, creating, and utilizing design systems and libraries.
Proficiency with Sketch
Substantial understanding of and experience with maintaining, creating, and utilizing design systems and libraries.
Portfolio with detailed case studies showcasing design process

Benefits: health, dental, vision

Advantis Global is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions on the basis of merit, qualifications and abilities. Company policy prohibits unlawful discrimination based on race, color, religion, sex (including gender, gender identity, gender expression, pregnancy, childbirth or medical condition related to pregnancy or childbirth), sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, age, physical or mental disability, genetic information, political affiliation, union membership, marital or registered domestic partnership status, military or veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law (“Protected Characteristic”). Additionally, Advantis Global is committed to promoting pay equity and prohibits harassment of any employee on the basis of any Protected Characteristic.

Advantis Global is a progressive and open-minded collective. If you’re smart, optimistic and care about being awesome at what you do, come as you are! We welcome you with open arms.

This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

UX / UI Designer with Ecommerce Experience







MISSION:

Woxer stands as a prominent brand in the Women's Intimates apparel industry, particularly known for its exceptional range of women's Briefs. Our commitment to sustainability and comfort sets us apart in a market that values eco-friendly practices and cozy wear. At Woxer, we prioritize comfort above all else, ensuring that every product we create is meticulously crafted to provide an impeccable fit and a soft, lightweight sensation.

With a focus on using the finest sustainable fabrications and cutting-edge designs, we lead the charge in driving the growing trend towards comfortable and eco-conscious clothing. Our monthly new product releases boast a diverse array of unique designs, setting a new standard that caters to women from all walks of life.

Our goal at Woxer is to elevate your underwear experience by infusing it with unmatched comfort and craftsmanship. We pay meticulous attention to details, ensuring that our products make you feel like you're wearing nothing at all. As an aspirational brand, Woxer takes pride in being accessible to everyone. We believe that every individual deserves to experience the ultimate comfort that comes with wearing Woxer.




WHERE ARE WE GOING:

At Woxer we don’t only dream big, we plan big. Our goal is to become the top premium underwear brand in the United States with a global presence, while keeping our employees and customers at the forefront of everything we do. We believe in a winning office culture, will include opportunities for new leaders, a fun work environment, and cultivating an ideal work/life balance for our employees. We are committed to celebrating and achieving diversity in all facets of our business. Additionally, Woxer is focused on the development of sustainable practices, challenging ourselves to discover innovation in design production and technology.




Join our dynamic Marketing team as a UX/UI Designer, where your creative expertise will be pivotal in elevating our digital presence. We're on the lookout for a talented individual who can drive results by increasing conversion rates, improving customer satisfaction, and reducing customer service tickets through the identification and resolution of design-related issues. Your role will extend beyond mere aesthetics, encompassing the enhancement of brand perception, optimization of mobile user experience, implementation of data-driven design improvements, and an overall transformation of the app's look and feel. If you're passionate about crafting seamless user journeys and contributing to measurable business outcomes, this opportunity is tailor-made for you.




YOUR CORE FOCUS AREAS AND RESPONSIBILITIES WILL BE:




Develop, implement and update the company's style guide. You will collaborate with developers to ensure the style guide is effectively implemented across major pages (Home, Product, Collection, Cart, Checkout, About Us, Blog) by the end of the year.
Improve the overall conversion rate of the website by a minimum of 30%.
Conduct a minimum of 5 A/B tests per month, focusing on the homepage, product page, and collection page.
Present weekly A/B test proposals based on data insights, seeking team approval for implementation.
Collaborate with the development team and customer service lead to create new experiences that reduce ticket volume and resolve customer issues, enhancing the customer Experience.
Aim to reduce customer service tickets related to design issues by 90% or more.
Utilize analytics tools, including Microsoft Clarity, to make data-driven decisions.
Present insights and recommendations to the team based on data analysis.
Decrease the mobile website bounce rate by 25% through improvements in mobile user experience.
Elevate the visual appeal and functionality of our app to create a highly converting and aesthetically pleasing platform.
Increase the app's conversion rate, aiming for a 30% growth.







WHAT DO YOU NEED TO SUCCEED




Must have 3 years experience in a $5M+ ecom brand or agency (Note: Applications without this specified e-commerce experience will not be considered).
Experience planning, conducting, and analyzing A/B tests to optimize website and app performance.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to derive insights from data using tools like Microsoft Clarity , Hotjar, Lucky Orange, or Google Analytics.
Understanding of customer experience principles and ability to empathize with user needs.
Previous experience collaborating with customer service teams to address user concerns and reduce ticket volumes.
Strong project management skills to ensure timely implementation of design changes and adherence to deadlines.
Ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks simultaneously.
Excellent communication skills to effectively convey design concepts, A/B test proposals, and data-driven insights to cross-functional teams.
Experience presenting findings and recommendations in a clear and compelling manner.
Innovative and creative mindset with the ability to think outside the box, contributing to the creation of visually appealing and high-converting designs.
Proven track record of achieving measurable results in terms of conversion rate improvements, reduced bounce rates, and enhanced customer satisfaction.
Ability to adapt to a fast-paced environment and evolving business needs.







MUST HAVE:




Must have 3 years experience in a $5M+ ecom brand or agency (Note: Applications without this specified e-commerce experience will not be considered).
Bachelor’s degree in graphic design, Web Design, HCI, or a related field.
Proven experience (7+ years) in UX/UI design, with a strong portfolio showcasing successful projects and a track record of improving conversion rates.
Proficiency in design tools such as Adobe Creative Suite, Sketch, Figma, or similar.
Openness to feedback and continuous improvement.




NICE TO HAVE:




Specific experience in mobile UX/UI design with a focus on reducing bounce rates and improving user experience on mobile devices.




If you are passionate about creating exceptional user experiences, driving conversion rates, and contributing to the success of our brand, we invite you to join our dynamic team. Your creativity and expertise will be integral in achieving our ambitious goals and delivering an outstanding digital presence.







BENEFITS & PERKS




Your well-being is our top priority. Our benefits and total compensation are designed for the whole person, caring for

both you and your family.




Benefits & Perks for eligible / USA employees:

Work Remote
Competitive Salary
401K Plan
Medical / Dental / Vision Coverage
25 PTO
9 Company Holidays
Life Insurance
FSA/ HAS (v)
Accident and Critical Illness Insurance (v)
Short-Term Disability (STD) (v)
Long Term Disability (LTD) (v)
Parental Medical Leave
Child Bonding Leave




HOW TO APPLY:

Please send your resume and Portfolio to Jose@woxer.com




The above is not an exhaustive list of duties and you will be expected to perform different tasks as necessitated by your changing role within the organization and the overall business objectives of the organization.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to diversity, inclusion, and equality in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, race, color, age, national origin, religion, physical and mental disability, genetic information, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity/assignment, citizenship, pregnancy or maternity, protected veteran status, or any other status prohibited by applicable national, federal, state or local law.

Our commitment to sustainability and comfort sets us apart in a market that values eco-friendly practices and cozy wear. At Woxer, we prioritize comfort above all else, ensuring that every product we create is meticulously crafted to provide an impeccable fit and a soft, lightweight sensation.With a focus on using the finest sustainable fabrications and cutting-edge designs, we lead the charge in driving the growing trend towards comfortable and eco-conscious clothing. At Colibri Group, culture is a critical part of our collective success, and we live our values everyday: Love, Joy, Boldness, Teamwork, and Curiosity. These values guide our interactions with each other, our customers, and the community.

Position Overview

The UX Designer is an expert designer with strong interaction and UI design skills, creating engaging and intuitive design that helps users achieve goals while instilling confidence in the brand. You will craft memorable experiences, optimize flows, and reimagine the UX of pivotal moments in a user's journey. You will be responsible for the design of numerous product features. Produce and direct web-based, interactive prototypes of varying levels of fidelity that support client and user feedback in the context of the supported application. Work closely with designers, researchers, product managers, engineering, and business stakeholders to uncover customer needs, design solutions, and test ideas that bring the most value to the customer and business.

What You'll Do


You can develop concepts from ideation to execution
You have a love for crafting simple, beautiful software experiences
Great attention to detail
You are comfortable experimenting and iterating on ideas
Familiar with web patterns and design frameworks
You welcome criticism, feedback and can defend design decisions for the good of the product and customer.
Love validating on product designs with customers.
Ability to work on more than one project at a time
Create wireframes, prototypes, and final designs to test and improve existing features



What You'll Need to Succeed


3+ years of experience in interaction design, user interface design, and user experience research or related field
Strong command of visual design, interaction design and information architecture
Capable of communicating and prototyping interactions rapidly at all levels of fidelity
Working knowledge of UI and Web Patterns
Familiar with working with design systems
Comfortable with user research and utilizing data to inform decisions
Excellent communication and collaboration skills
Collaborate with cross-platform teams, including Product Managers, Stakeholders, and Engineering
Proven experience as a UX Designer with a strong portfolio showcasing previous design projects
Experience in the Online Learning industry, especially professional education, or Ecommerce is a plus



Colibri Group welcomes applicants from all backgrounds and experiences, and we understand that not every candidate will meet every requirement listed in the job description. Research has shown that women and people of color may be less likely to apply to jobs unless they feel they meet every qualification, and we want to actively combat this bias in our hiring process. If you're excited about the role and believe you have the skills and experience to contribute to our team, we encourage you to apply, even if your background doesn't align perfectly with every qualification listed. We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive workplace, and we believe that diversity of perspectives and experiences is essential to our success. You may be just the right candidate for this role or another position within our organization. Don't hesitate to take the leap and apply today!

Colibri Group is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. Colibri Group prohibits discrimination and harassment of any kind based on race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law.
Industries: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage and Internet Publishing

Job_description:
UI Designer
Location: San Francisco, CA/Hybrid
Duration: 6 months

Description:
Use user-centered design methods to craft industry-leading user experiences
Communicate the user experience at various stages of the design process with wireframes, flow diagrams, storyboards, mockups, and/or high fidelity prototypes
Advise, and partner with UX Designers, Researchers, Product Managers and Software Engineers
Ideate, prototype, and communicate the user experience at various stages of the design process.
Advocacy of user-centered design changes, refinements, and improvements
Build, create and refine designs on prototype hardware provided by Client
Create artifacts, prototypes, and/or specs that enable developers to implement designs efficiently
Thrives in dynamic creative environment

Minimum qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in engineering, Computer Science, related field, or equivalent practical experience.
2 years of experience in a technical, UX, or design environment.
Experience with WearOS development.
Experience with development on mobile platforms.
Experience working closely with other UX and visual designers, UX writers, UX researchers in the field to solve user problems
Experience and interest in visual design and prototyping

As an equal opportunity employer, ICONMA prides itself on creating an employment environment that supports and encourages the abilities of all persons regardless of race, color, gender, age, sexual orientation, citizenship, or disability.

We are seeking a talented UX Designer to join our team and play a key role in shaping the user experience of our products.




We are actively working on designing new solutions for our clients and using our data assets creatively to provide unique insights to our users.







Key Responsibilities:

Design Development: Develop user-centric designs by understanding business requirements, and user feedback.
Collaboration: Collaborate with various stakeholders including product managers, engineers, and customers to create seamless and effective web applications.
User Research: Conduct user research to understand pain points and improve the overall user experience.
Prototyping and Testing: Create prototypes, wireframes and conduct usability testing to gather feedback.
Design Execution: Implement modern UX design principles, maintain design system and methodologies to ensure a great user experience.
Continuous Improvement: Stay abreast of UX trends and look for creative ideas and inspiration in parallel analogous worlds.







Qualifications:

5+ years of experience in designing SaaS/Web applications.
Strong portfolio showcasing previous UX design work.
Experience maintaining a design system and implementing it with relative CSS units -- REM, EM, %
Experience building desktop-first designs with consideration for laptop to ultra-wide screen sizes.
Proficiency in design tools such as Sketch, Adobe XD, Figma, or similar.
Knowledge of HTML, CSS, Tailwind framework, and front-end development is a plus.
Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
Experience in the financial industry is a plus.







Salary Range:

Base salary between $90k and $130k plus bonus eligible







Benefits and Perks:

Base + target bonus compensation structure
Medical, Dental, Vision insurance
401K (with employer match)
Life insurance, long term disability, short term disability all covered by the company
Flexible paid time off (PTO)
Sixteen (16) weeks paid primary caregiver leave (Biological, adoptive, and foster parents are all eligible)
Four (4) weeks paid parental leave
Wellness subsidy provided by Trepp
Pet insurance
Laptop ​+ WFH equipment​
Career progression plan
Pre-tax commuter benefit with company subsidy (For NYC-office based employees only)
Involvement in Diversity and Inclusion programs
Fun company events and volunteering opportunities




Workplace Policy:

NYC, Dallas, and London office-based positions: Trepp’s offices follows a 3-2 hybrid-working policy with the expectation of in-office work on Tuesday-Thursday and the option to work from home on Monday and Friday.

Position Overview:

We are on a mission to build the most connected, entertained fanbase in the NBA through innovative and engaging products that capture the spirit of the Bulls’ iconic brand. In a significant move towards this goal, the Bulls recently brought on board leadership with a strong, pure technical background to lead product on this journey. Now, as part of this journey, we are looking for a dedicated UI/UX Designer to join our team and help bring our vision to life. We look for our designers to be creative, proactive, and skilled in all areas of designing technology experiences. Come be a part of a team that is shaping the future of sports experiences!

Responsibilities:


Become the founding member of the UI/UX Design group at the Chicago Bulls and build the foundation for how UI/UX design for digital products will evolve over the next several years.
Research, design, and prototype user experiences for mobile applications, websites, and internal tooling in close partnership with a variety of teammates across the Bulls organization.
Collaborate with product managers, engineers, and cross-functional team members to understand requirements and provide creative, thoughtful design solutions.
Communicate the user experience at various stages of the design process by using wireframes, flow diagrams, storyboards, and high-fidelity mockups.
Integrate user feedback and business requirements into design for ongoing product development.
Contribute to guidelines, standards, and processes that shape the Bulls’ new technology development processes.
Identify target user groups and carry out user experience research to help understand and document user needs.
Build prototypes to bring the designs you create to life.



Qualifications:


4+ years of UI/UX design experience and/or a comprehensive portfolio of work samples showcasing your UX, UI, and visual design for mobile apps and websites.
Proficiency in Figma and/or the Adobe suite of design tools.
An understanding of how color, typography, imagery, composition, and animation can build a sense of connection and fuel entertaining moments.
Shown ability to quickly and efficiently communicate design from scratch through sketches and wireframes.
Shown ability to work proactively and communicate strongly with a team or set of product development teams.
Proven experience with Lottie or similar animation tooling
Strong attention to detail in design iteration.
Take pride and ownership in what you craft.



We are an Equal Opportunity employer committed to a diverse workforce. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability, or any other status or characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.

Job Title: UX/UI Designer

Reports To: Creative Director

Classification: Exempt

Job Type: Full-Time

Location: NYC / Hybrid




Please note: This is a hybrid position and will require commuting to our Flatiron office in NYC 3 days per week.




We are the Institute for Integrative Nutrition (IIN), the world's largest health education platform. IIN pioneered the health coaching profession 30 years ago with our flagship Health Coach Training Program, and today, we offer a variety of health, wellness, and coaching courses that empower people to transform by focusing on “what feeds you” in life; mind, body, and career. Our mission is to heal the world through unparalleled educational experiences. Come help us make the world a happier, healthier place.




Job Summary:

As a User Experience Designer at IIN, you will be responsible for designing compelling, efficient, and innovative digital experiences, with a primary focus on optimizing our marketing and ecommerce website. The ideal candidate should have experience with all parts of the Design Thinking process. Specifically, you will focus on leveraging best practices and data to make design decisions, creating wireframes, low and high-fidelity mockups, and interactive prototypes for stakeholder approvals and developer handoffs, as well as usability testing designs.




Duties/Responsibilities:

Make strategic improvements for CRO across website properties, thinking about the UX of site and flow of traffic holistically
Lead UI/UX aspects of user experience research and associated interface design, wireframing, and documentation for engaging, interactive, and innovative capabilities,
Generate wireframes, low and high-fidelity mockups, interactive prototypes, and behavioral specifications.
Test prototypes and products to determine challenges that users experience during the interaction
Follow design guidelines for implementation, visual language, color story, themes, CSS styles based on IIN standards
Serve as a design lead for small interdisciplinary agile teams focused on producing user-informed functional prototypes that could be tested in target markets, and
Collaborate with both internal and external colleagues and consultants to ensure on-time completion of project goals.
Partner with cross-functional teams to design user testing projects & leverage for UX improvements
Partner with web manager to improve conversion rate performance of marketing & e-commerce website




Supervisory Responsibilities: None




Required Skills/Abilities:

BS Required, preferably in UX related fields of HCI, Product Design, Computer Science or Graphic Design
Business minded and data driven and comfortable setting up user testing processes, using G4, Crazy Egg, and similar tools
Have managed a CMS, especially Hubspot
Experience in Product Design tools like Figma, Axure RP or Adobe XD.
Knowledge of basic HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Invision.
At least 4 years of experience working as a web or UI designer, applying learning science and design principles to the development of technology enhanced learning solutions.
Ability to work collaboratively and effectively in agile teams
Ability to work collaboratively and effectively with cross-divisional stakeholder groups; can present and adapt ideas to different audiences.
Strong oral and written communication skills
Can prioritize, think critically, and see the big picture
Must be up to date on latest UX trends and best practices
Excellent time-management skills with ability to meet deadlines
Can self-manage and prioritize across multiple projects/deadlines
Excellent interpersonal skills; can give and receive constructive feedback
Flexible and able to adapt with a positive attitude




Some of the benefits of working at IIN:

Unlimited paid vacation days, with additional sick days, & generous parental leave
Additional paid “Winter Break” vacation days between December 25 and January 1
Annual paid commuter stipend bonus
401K plan with employer contribution of up to 4%
Free lunches and snacks while working in office
Health benefit plan that includes health, dental, vision, disability, and life insurance
Free access to our educational offerings
Heath Coach Reimbursement
Weekly virtual wellness sessions, which have included virtual yoga and meditation classes
A variety of seasonal health and wellness perks




About IIN

What started as a small classroom of passionate students in a live setting in 1992, IIN is now world-renowned for its flagship online Health Coach Training Program and other leading-edge educational offerings on the most current and important topics in health and wellness. With a monthly audience of 2 million+ wellness seekers, over 160,000 coaches and teachers in 175 countries worldwide, we are the undisputed leader in the field of wellness education, information and health coaching tools. We offer students access to a rich diversity of leading instructors committed to improving global wellness through education and prevention.




Why work for us?

At IIN, our goal is simple: to attract and retain a workplace that includes a diverse group of talented people who come together to play a crucial role in improving health and happiness for everyone. In order to achieve this, we hire the best individuals from all different backgrounds and experiences. Our commitment goes beyond a diverse and inclusive workforce; we are also committed to diversity in our curriculum and teachings as well. We feel it enriches the experience for all our students and the community and in turn creates the ripple effect that transforms the world!




We are a mission-driven company striving to make the world a healthier and happier place! We have the culture of a start-up paired with the resources, stability and foundation of an established company with 30 years at the top of its field. We strive to be a company that walks the walk, with great perks and an amazing team of awesome, collaborative, and passionate colleagues!




Compensation:

$88,000-$110,000

The range above is for the expectations as laid out in the job description, however we are often open to a wide variety of profiles, and recognize that the person we hire may be less experienced (or more senior) than this job description as posted. If that ends up being the case, the updated salary range will be communicated to you as a candidate.

Role: UI/UX DesignerLocation: Denver CO (Remote OK)Duration: 6+ MonthsJob DescriptionRole Responsibilities:In this role, you'll take the time to understand the business aspects of the products we build and collaborate with leaders of other UX, Engineering, and Product Management teams to create innovative experiences across all Western Union products, leveraging your passion for brand, craft, and design quality. In a fast-paced, collaborative environment, you'll work on all aspects of UX design including information architecture, interaction, motion, visual, and prototyping. You'll drive design from early-stage conceptual design through launch. Work with executive leadership, product management teams and engineering team across WU portfolios and partner closely with other teams to define experience strategies and create user journeys, conceptual wireframes, high-fidelity mockups, functional prototypes on a project-basis Going deep on consumer insights, product analytics, and competitive intelligence to identify unseen opportunities, and drive product & experience innovation. Create and rapidly iterate ideas in order to develop them, via storyboards, user flows, mock-ups, motion designs, and prototypes, or other novel methods. Responsible for creating, evaluating, and modifying prototypes to evangelize product vision to stakeholders and leadership. Role Requirements5+ years of experience designing complex consumer facing digital products and experiences (preferably cross platform web, mobile, point of sale UX) in a global context. Proficiency in using contemporary design tools to solve complex problems and communicate in visually stunning detail. Experience designing, guiding, and implementing formal and informal usability studies. Ability to zoom out and see the bigger picture, while zooming in to rationalize and perfect the nuanced details. Bachelor's degree in design, HCI, or related field or equivalent professional experience. Nice to have: Experience in Fintech consumer products.

UX / UI Designer with Ecommerce Experience







MISSION:

Woxer stands as a prominent brand in the Women's Intimates apparel industry, particularly known for its exceptional range of women's Briefs. Our commitment to sustainability and comfort sets us apart in a market that values eco-friendly practices and cozy wear. At Woxer, we prioritize comfort above all else, ensuring that every product we create is meticulously crafted to provide an impeccable fit and a soft, lightweight sensation.

With a focus on using the finest sustainable fabrications and cutting-edge designs, we lead the charge in driving the growing trend towards comfortable and eco-conscious clothing. Our monthly new product releases boast a diverse array of unique designs, setting a new standard that caters to women from all walks of life.

Our goal at Woxer is to elevate your underwear experience by infusing it with unmatched comfort and craftsmanship. We pay meticulous attention to details, ensuring that our products make you feel like you're wearing nothing at all. As an aspirational brand, Woxer takes pride in being accessible to everyone. We believe that every individual deserves to experience the ultimate comfort that comes with wearing Woxer.




WHERE ARE WE GOING:

At Woxer we don’t only dream big, we plan big. Our goal is to become the top premium underwear brand in the United States with a global presence, while keeping our employees and customers at the forefront of everything we do. We believe in a winning office culture, will include opportunities for new leaders, a fun work environment, and cultivating an ideal work/life balance for our employees. We are committed to celebrating and achieving diversity in all facets of our business. Additionally, Woxer is focused on the development of sustainable practices, challenging ourselves to discover innovation in design production and technology.




Join our dynamic Marketing team as a UX/UI Designer, where your creative expertise will be pivotal in elevating our digital presence. We're on the lookout for a talented individual who can drive results by increasing conversion rates, improving customer satisfaction, and reducing customer service tickets through the identification and resolution of design-related issues. Your role will extend beyond mere aesthetics, encompassing the enhancement of brand perception, optimization of mobile user experience, implementation of data-driven design improvements, and an overall transformation of the app's look and feel. If you're passionate about crafting seamless user journeys and contributing to measurable business outcomes, this opportunity is tailor-made for you.




YOUR CORE FOCUS AREAS AND RESPONSIBILITIES WILL BE:




Develop, implement and update the company's style guide. You will collaborate with developers to ensure the style guide is effectively implemented across major pages (Home, Product, Collection, Cart, Checkout, About Us, Blog) by the end of the year.
Improve the overall conversion rate of the website by a minimum of 30%.
Conduct a minimum of 5 A/B tests per month, focusing on the homepage, product page, and collection page.
Present weekly A/B test proposals based on data insights, seeking team approval for implementation.
Collaborate with the development team and customer service lead to create new experiences that reduce ticket volume and resolve customer issues, enhancing the customer Experience.
Aim to reduce customer service tickets related to design issues by 90% or more.
Utilize analytics tools, including Microsoft Clarity, to make data-driven decisions.
Present insights and recommendations to the team based on data analysis.
Decrease the mobile website bounce rate by 25% through improvements in mobile user experience.
Elevate the visual appeal and functionality of our app to create a highly converting and aesthetically pleasing platform.
Increase the app's conversion rate, aiming for a 30% growth.







WHAT DO YOU NEED TO SUCCEED




Must have 3 years experience in a $5M+ ecom brand or agency (Note: Applications without this specified e-commerce experience will not be considered).
Experience planning, conducting, and analyzing A/B tests to optimize website and app performance.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to derive insights from data using tools like Microsoft Clarity , Hotjar, Lucky Orange, or Google Analytics.
Understanding of customer experience principles and ability to empathize with user needs.
Previous experience collaborating with customer service teams to address user concerns and reduce ticket volumes.
Strong project management skills to ensure timely implementation of design changes and adherence to deadlines.
Ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks simultaneously.
Excellent communication skills to effectively convey design concepts, A/B test proposals, and data-driven insights to cross-functional teams.
Experience presenting findings and recommendations in a clear and compelling manner.
Innovative and creative mindset with the ability to think outside the box, contributing to the creation of visually appealing and high-converting designs.
Proven track record of achieving measurable results in terms of conversion rate improvements, reduced bounce rates, and enhanced customer satisfaction.
Ability to adapt to a fast-paced environment and evolving business needs.







MUST HAVE:




Must have 3 years experience in a $5M+ ecom brand or agency (Note: Applications without this specified e-commerce experience will not be considered).
Bachelor’s degree in graphic design, Web Design, HCI, or a related field.
Proven experience (7+ years) in UX/UI design, with a strong portfolio showcasing successful projects and a track record of improving conversion rates.
Proficiency in design tools such as Adobe Creative Suite, Sketch, Figma, or similar.
Openness to feedback and continuous improvement.




NICE TO HAVE:




Specific experience in mobile UX/UI design with a focus on reducing bounce rates and improving user experience on mobile devices.




If you are passionate about creating exceptional user experiences, driving conversion rates, and contributing to the success of our brand, we invite you to join our dynamic team. Your creativity and expertise will be integral in achieving our ambitious goals and delivering an outstanding digital presence.







BENEFITS & PERKS




Your well-being is our top priority. Our benefits and total compensation are designed for the whole person, caring for

both you and your family.




Benefits & Perks for eligible / USA employees:

Work Remote
Competitive Salary
401K Plan
Medical / Dental / Vision Coverage
25 PTO
9 Company Holidays
Life Insurance
FSA/ HAS (v)
Accident and Critical Illness Insurance (v)
Short-Term Disability (STD) (v)
Long Term Disability (LTD) (v)
Parental Medical Leave
Child Bonding Leave




HOW TO APPLY:

Please send your resume and Portfolio to Jose@woxer.com




The above is not an exhaustive list of duties and you will be expected to perform different tasks as necessitated by your changing role within the organization and the overall business objectives of the organization.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to diversity, inclusion, and equality in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, race, color, age, national origin, religion, physical and mental disability, genetic information, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity/assignment, citizenship, pregnancy or maternity, protected veteran status, or any other status prohibited by applicable national, federal, state or local law.

At SimpsonScarborough, we spend our days building brands that endure, inspire, and elevate the all-important work of colleges and universities in shaping our future. Recognized as a leader in the higher ed marketing industry, our company runs a fully remote team of approximately 65 employees coast to coast.

We are a growing team looking for a self-motivated and enthusiastic new member. We expect a lot from our team members and champion their successes.

Requirements


Use Figma for high-fidelity UI/UX designs, interactive prototypes, and design systems following atomic design principles.
Translate wireframes and concepts into visually appealing and user-friendly interfaces.
Iterate designs based on user feedback, usability testing, and data insights.
Collaborate with developers to ensure design feasibility and consistency throughout development.
Develop and maintain design systems, style guides, and documentation for consistency.
Communicate design decisions effectively to both technical and non-technical team members.
Apply interaction design principles and animation techniques, including Webflow, for engaging user interfaces.
Lead client-facing meetings and discussions, with occasional travel up to 10% of the time.


Qualifications


Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience
3-5 years of UI/UX experience
Proven UI/UX design expertise with a strong portfolio demonstrating design process, Figma proficiency, and user-centered design.
Deep understanding of HCI principles, accessibility standards, and usability best practices.
Familiarity with front-end development principles, technical constraints, and design handoff processes
In-depth knowledge of Figma features, components, and collaboration functionalities.
Ability to independently manage projects with minimal supervision.
Comfortable collaborating with remote project teams nationwide.


Bonus Points


Knowledge of advanced animation techniques using CSS, JavaScript, or other animation libraries.
Familiarity with design systems management platforms like Drupal, Wordpress, AEM, and Cascade


Salary, Perks & Benefits


Salary starts at $80,000.00 and will be commensurate with experience.
SimpsonScarborough offers a full benefits package, including nationwide health coverage, dental, vision, employer paid life insurance, flexible time off (FTO), student loan reimbursement after waiting period, and voluntary benefits such as critical illness and accident insurance, 100% paid parental leave, and a 401k with employer contribution after waiting period.
Perks include flexible work model including Flexible Fridays, telework stipend, weeklong agency closures (summer and winter), and a day off for your birthday.


At SimpsonScarborough, we believe diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging are central to our core values, cultural norms, and critical to our long-term success. We believe this work is a continual effort that requires consistency, intentionality, vulnerability and accountability for ourselves and others. Through our efforts we strive to make impact in our work, in our workplace and in our industry.

SimpsonScarborough is an equal opportunity employer. We have a strict anti-harassment policy and a no tolerance non-discrimination policy. We welcome employees of all backgrounds regardless of nationality, race, religion, gender identity, veteran status, and all characteristics protected by state and federal law.

Company: Center for the Study of Services

At Colibri Group, culture is a critical part of our collective success, and we live our values everyday: Love, Joy, Boldness, Teamwork, and Curiosity. These values guide our interactions with each other, our customers, and the community.

Position Overview

The UX Designer is an expert designer with strong interaction and UI design skills, creating engaging and intuitive design that helps users achieve goals while instilling confidence in the brand. You will craft memorable experiences, optimize flows, and reimagine the UX of pivotal moments in a user's journey. You will be responsible for the design of numerous product features. Produce and direct web-based, interactive prototypes of varying levels of fidelity that support client and user feedback in the context of the supported application. Work closely with designers, researchers, product managers, engineering, and business stakeholders to uncover customer needs, design solutions, and test ideas that bring the most value to the customer and business.

What You'll Do


You can develop concepts from ideation to execution
You have a love for crafting simple, beautiful software experiences
Great attention to detail
You are comfortable experimenting and iterating on ideas
Familiar with web patterns and design frameworks
You welcome criticism, feedback and can defend design decisions for the good of the product and customer.
Love validating on product designs with customers.
Ability to work on more than one project at a time
Create wireframes, prototypes, and final designs to test and improve existing features



What You'll Need to Succeed


3+ years of experience in interaction design, user interface design, and user experience research or related field
Strong command of visual design, interaction design and information architecture
Capable of communicating and prototyping interactions rapidly at all levels of fidelity
Working knowledge of UI and Web Patterns
Familiar with working with design systems
Comfortable with user research and utilizing data to inform decisions
Excellent communication and collaboration skills
Collaborate with cross-platform teams, including Product Managers, Stakeholders, and Engineering
Proven experience as a UX Designer with a strong portfolio showcasing previous design projects
Experience in the Online Learning industry, especially professional education, or Ecommerce is a plus



Colibri Group welcomes applicants from all backgrounds and experiences, and we understand that not every candidate will meet every requirement listed in the job description. Research has shown that women and people of color may be less likely to apply to jobs unless they feel they meet every qualification, and we want to actively combat this bias in our hiring process. If you're excited about the role and believe you have the skills and experience to contribute to our team, we encourage you to apply, even if your background doesn't align perfectly with every qualification listed. We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive workplace, and we believe that diversity of perspectives and experiences is essential to our success. You may be just the right candidate for this role or another position within our organization. Don't hesitate to take the leap and apply today!

Colibri Group is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. Colibri Group prohibits discrimination and harassment of any kind based on race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law.
Industries: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage and Internet Publishing

Job_description:
UI Designer
Location: San Francisco, CA/Hybrid
Duration: 6 months

Description:
Use user-centered design methods to craft industry-leading user experiences
Communicate the user experience at various stages of the design process with wireframes, flow diagrams, storyboards, mockups, and/or high fidelity prototypes
Advise, and partner with UX Designers, Researchers, Product Managers and Software Engineers
Ideate, prototype, and communicate the user experience at various stages of the design process.
Advocacy of user-centered design changes, refinements, and improvements
Build, create and refine designs on prototype hardware provided by Client
Create artifacts, prototypes, and/or specs that enable developers to implement designs efficiently
Thrives in dynamic creative environment

Minimum qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in engineering, Computer Science, related field, or equivalent practical experience.
2 years of experience in a technical, UX, or design environment.
Experience with WearOS development.
Experience with development on mobile platforms.
Experience working closely with other UX and visual designers, UX writers, UX researchers in the field to solve user problems
Experience and interest in visual design and prototyping

As an equal opportunity employer, ICONMA prides itself on creating an employment environment that supports and encourages the abilities of all persons regardless of race, color, gender, age, sexual orientation, citizenship, or disability.

We are seeking a talented UX Designer to join our team and play a key role in shaping the user experience of our products.




We are actively working on designing new solutions for our clients and using our data assets creatively to provide unique insights to our users.







Key Responsibilities:

Design Development: Develop user-centric designs by understanding business requirements, and user feedback.
Collaboration: Collaborate with various stakeholders including product managers, engineers, and customers to create seamless and effective web applications.
User Research: Conduct user research to understand pain points and improve the overall user experience.
Prototyping and Testing: Create prototypes, wireframes and conduct usability testing to gather feedback.
Design Execution: Implement modern UX design principles, maintain design system and methodologies to ensure a great user experience.
Continuous Improvement: Stay abreast of UX trends and look for creative ideas and inspiration in parallel analogous worlds.







Qualifications:

5+ years of experience in designing SaaS/Web applications.
Strong portfolio showcasing previous UX design work.
Experience maintaining a design system and implementing it with relative CSS units -- REM, EM, %
Experience building desktop-first designs with consideration for laptop to ultra-wide screen sizes.
Proficiency in design tools such as Sketch, Adobe XD, Figma, or similar.
Knowledge of HTML, CSS, Tailwind framework, and front-end development is a plus.
Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
Experience in the financial industry is a plus.







Salary Range:

Base salary between $90k and $130k plus bonus eligible







Benefits and Perks:

Base + target bonus compensation structure
Medical, Dental, Vision insurance
401K (with employer match)
Life insurance, long term disability, short term disability all covered by the company
Flexible paid time off (PTO)
Sixteen (16) weeks paid primary caregiver leave (Biological, adoptive, and foster parents are all eligible)
Four (4) weeks paid parental leave
Wellness subsidy provided by Trepp
Pet insurance
Laptop ​+ WFH equipment​
Career progression plan
Pre-tax commuter benefit with company subsidy (For NYC-office based employees only)
Involvement in Diversity and Inclusion programs
Fun company events and volunteering opportunities




Workplace Policy:

NYC, Dallas, and London office-based positions: Trepp’s offices follows a 3-2 hybrid-working policy with the expectation of in-office work on Tuesday-Thursday and the option to work from home on Monday and Friday.

United States, Georgia, Atlanta

Innovation & Operations Technology

15-Feb-2024

Ref #: 23806

How you'll help us Keep Climbing (overview & key responsibilities)

Delta’s Innovation Team is made up of a multidisciplinary team of Designers, Engineers, Researchers, and Strategists. Our mission is to use technology to bring humanity back to travel. The team works closely with every part of the business to introduce new ideas, pilot new technologies, and partner with startups in the aviation space. Our user-centered approach means that whether we’re designing for customers or employees, a beautiful experience is the expectation.

As a Senior UX Designer, you will craft industry-leading digital products, working from concept to final execution. You will work closely with other Innovation Team members to identify opportunities, understand the market, ideate digitally, research user behavior, and refine. Your work will be seen and loved by millions of Delta customers, and your ideas will help guide the future of the Delta travel experience.

Responsibilities:


Develop user flows, wireframes, prototypes, and digital presentations to communicate design ideas.
Translate complex problems into simple solutions.
Execute innovative and compelling user interface and interaction design experiences across Delta’s digital platforms.
Take ownership of initiatives and play an active role in ensuring they progress efficiently.


Benefits and Perks to Help You Keep Climbing

Our culture is rooted in a shared dedication to living our values – Care, Integrity, Resilience, Servant Leadership, and Teamwork – every day, in everything we do. At Delta, our people are our success. At the heart of what we offer is our focus on Sharing Success with Delta employees. Exploring a career at Delta gives you a chance to see the world while earning great compensation and benefits to help you keep climbing along the way:


Competitive salary, industry-leading proﬁt sharing program, and performance incentives
401(k) with generous company contributions up to 9%
Paid time off including vacation, holidays, paid personal time, maternity and parental leave
Comprehensive health beneﬁts including medical, dental, vision, short/long term disability and life beneﬁts
Family care assistance through fertility support, surrogacy and adoption assistance, lactation support, subsidized back-up care, and programs that help with loved ones in all stages
Holistic Wellbeing programs to support physical, emotional, social, and financial health, including access to an employee assistance program offering support for you and anyone in your household, free financial coaching, and extensive resources supporting mental health
Domestic and International space-available flight privileges for employees and eligible family members
Career development programs to achieve your long-term career goals
World-wide partnerships to engage in community service and innovative goals created to focus on sustainability and reducing our carbon footprint
Business Resource Groups created to connect employees with common interests to promote inclusion, provide perspective and help implement strategies
Recognition rewards and awards through the platform Unstoppable Together
Access to over 500 discounts, specialty savings and voluntary benefits through Deltaperks such as car and hotel rentals and auto, home, and pet insurance, legal services, and childcare


What You Need To Succeed (minimum Qualifications)


Minimum of 5 years of experience in digital design.
Bachelor’s degree in Design or equivalent practical experience.
Strong portfolio of digital design work that demonstrates a deep understanding of design principles and best practices.
Understanding of user research and testing methodologies and their application in the design process.
Experience using Figma and similar prototyping tools.
Excellent verbal and written communication/presentation skills.
Consistently prioritizes safety and security of self, others, and personal data.
Embraces diverse people, thinking, and styles.
Possesses a high school diploma, GED, or high school equivalency.
Is at least 18 years of age and has authorization to work in the United States.


What Will Give You a Competitive Edge (preferred Qualifications)


Understanding of digital accessibility design and user experience best practices.
Understanding of responsive design and mobile-first design principles.
Solid foundation in all aspects of digital design including photography, typography, layout, and design optimization.
Knowledge of web development technologies such as HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.

The ideal candidate will play a key role in ensuring the usability, functionality, and overall user satisfaction of the try-on product. They will be responsible for conducting both primary and secondary research, testing our Figma designs and prototypes, and try-on modals on app and browser, analyzing user feedback, and collaborating closely with designers to iterate on designs and improve user experience.


Conducting primary and secondary research to understand user behavior, preferences, and pain points related to the try-on product
Planning and executing user testing sessions to gather qualitative and quantitative feedback on Figma designs and try-on modals on app and browser
Analyzing research findings and translating them into actionable insights to inform product development decisions
Collaborating with designers and developers, to iterate on designs based on user feedback and research findings
Assisting with creating wireframes, prototypes, and high-fidelity prototypes
Generating research reports and presentations to communicate findings, insights, and recommendations to stakeholders
Crafting detailed case studies that showcase successful UX research methodologies and project processes and outcomes, demonstrating their contributions to product improvements and user satisfaction
Staying updated to industry trends, best practices, and technologies in UX research and design
Based in USA, West Coast business hours


Requirements


1 - 3 years of professional experience in UX research
Bachelor's degree in Psychology, Behavioral Economics, Anthropology, Sociology, or similar passion for working and learning in a fast-growing company
Ability to conduct all different type of research
Experience in UX Design
Ability to jump into UX design if needed
Knowledge of Figma and user flows
Experience creating and documenting case studies
Comfortable working in a fast-paced environment
Passion for fashion and AI


Benefits


Competitive salary and performance-based incentives
Comprehensive health and wellness benefits
Opportunities for professional development and growth
Fully remote work environment
Be at the forefront of revolutionizing the fashion and tech industries
Work alongside industry leaders and influencers

Experience Designer at a large Banking/Financial organization, we are guided by a common purpose: To help make lives better by connecting our internal users with the tools and resources they need to be successful.Required Skills: As an Experience Designer, you Should have experience designing complex transactional systems into intuitive and valuable products. Experience Designers need to be excellent analytical and conceptual thinkers that translate user needs, business objectives and technology capabilities into innovative design. This position requires a strong foundation in user centered design methods and the ability to communicate design decisions effectively to senior stakeholders and team members alike. This position is for a thoughtful designer with a passion for making complex data and workflow problems simpler.You will introduce creativity while driving consistency, ensuring that styles express our brand but are optimized for context and the technical platform being utilized.You will participate in design meetings and critiques and provide feedback to teammates.Core deliverables of yours include low and high-fidelity wireframes that you will translate into clickable prototypes for user testing validation and to communicate your designs to technology partners and business stakeholders. You’re a person who has 5+ years of design experience Exceptional interaction and visual design skills A strong portfolio that shows a commitment to user centered design Experience applying brand and digital standards, and as needed, contributing to asset libraries for cross-team use Experience designing responsive websites, applications, and other digital interfaces. Experience designing native mobile applications is a plus. Experience with Sketch, In Vision, Figma, Balsamiq and other design and management tools Experience working in an Agile environment, using tools like JIRADesired Skills: You will be better prepared if you have Bachelor's or Master's degree in design or related discipline Financial or similar industry experience. Experience with of human-centered design methodologies and rapid ideation processes such as Lean XD and Design Sprints is expected.Qualification: UX Design for different medium.As an equal opportunity employer, ICONMA provides an employment environment that supports and encourages the abilities of all persons without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws.

Title: Web/UX Designer/Researcher




Location: New York, NY Onsite




Lead end-to-end user research activities, including planning, recruiting, moderating sessions, analyzing data, and presenting actionable insights.
Design and conduct in-depth user interviews, usability tests, surveys, and other research methods to uncover user needs, pain points, and behaviors.
Collaborate closely with Product Managers, UX Designers, and Engineers to translate research findings into actionable recommendations that drive product enhancements.
Champion a user-centered approach throughout the product development lifecycle, advocating for user needs and promoting empathy within the team.
Develop and maintain research plans, ensuring alignment with project goals and timelines.
Craft persuasive and impactful research reports and presentations that communicate insights, opportunities, and recommendations clearly and effectively.
Stay informed about industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies, and apply this knowledge to inform research methodologies and recommendations.




Contribute your financial services knowledge to provide deeper context to research findings and recommendations, ensuring our products align




Strong organizational skills and ability to manage multiple projects and priorities simultaneously.

Title: Web/UX Designer/ResearcherLocation: New York, NY OnsiteLead end-to-end user research activities, including planning, recruiting, moderating sessions, analyzing data, and presenting actionable insights.Design and conduct in-depth user interviews, usability tests, surveys, and other research methods to uncover user needs, pain points, and behaviors.Collaborate closely with Product Managers, UX Designers, and Engineers to translate research findings into actionable recommendations that drive product enhancements.Champion a user-centered approach throughout the product development lifecycle, advocating for user needs and promoting empathy within the team.Develop and maintain research plans, ensuring alignment with project goals and timelines.Craft persuasive and impactful research reports and presentations that communicate insights, opportunities, and recommendations clearly and effectively.Stay informed about industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies, and apply this knowledge to inform research methodologies and recommendations.Contribute your financial services knowledge to provide deeper context to research findings and recommendations, ensuring our products alignStrong organizational skills and ability to manage multiple projects and priorities simultaneously.

We are seeking a talented UX Designer to join our team and play a key role in shaping the user experience of our products.




We are actively working on designing new solutions for our clients and using our data assets creatively to provide unique insights to our users.







Key Responsibilities:

Design Development: Develop user-centric designs by understanding business requirements, and user feedback.
Collaboration: Collaborate with various stakeholders including product managers, engineers, and customers to create seamless and effective web applications.
User Research: Conduct user research to understand pain points and improve the overall user experience.
Prototyping and Testing: Create prototypes, wireframes and conduct usability testing to gather feedback.
Design Execution: Implement modern UX design principles, maintain design system and methodologies to ensure a great user experience.
Continuous Improvement: Stay abreast of UX trends and look for creative ideas and inspiration in parallel analogous worlds.







Qualifications:

5+ years of experience in designing SaaS/Web applications.
Strong portfolio showcasing previous UX design work.
Experience maintaining a design system and implementing it with relative CSS units -- REM, EM, %
Experience building desktop-first designs with consideration for laptop to ultra-wide screen sizes.
Proficiency in design tools such as Sketch, Adobe XD, Figma, or similar.
Knowledge of HTML, CSS, Tailwind framework, and front-end development is a plus.
Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
Experience in the financial industry is a plus.







Benefits and Perks:

Base + target bonus compensation structure
Medical, Dental, Vision insurance
401K (with employer match)
Life insurance, long term disability, short term disability all covered by the company
Flexible paid time off (PTO)
Sixteen (16) weeks paid primary caregiver leave (Biological, adoptive, and foster parents are all eligible)
Four (4) weeks paid parental leave
Wellness subsidy provided by Trepp
Pet insurance
Laptop ​+ WFH equipment​
Career progression plan
Pre-tax commuter benefit with company subsidy (For NYC-office based employees only)
Involvement in Diversity and Inclusion programs
Fun company events and volunteering opportunities




Workplace Policy:

NYC, Dallas, and London office-based positions: Trepp’s offices follows a 3-2 hybrid-working policy with the expectation of in-office work on Tuesday-Thursday and the option to work from home on Monday and Friday.

A User Experience (UX) Designer is responsible for creating and enhancing the overall user experience of a product or service. They combine user research, information architecture, interaction design, and visual design principles to design intuitive and engaging user interfaces.




Responsibilities:

Conduct user research to understand user needs, goals, and behaviors through methods such as interviews, surveys, and usability testing.
Analyze and interpret research findings to identify user insights and create user personas, user journeys, and other UX artifacts.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including product managers, developers, and visual designers, to define and prioritize product requirements.
Create wireframes, prototypes, and interactive mockups to effectively communicate design ideas and concepts.
Design and iterate on user interfaces, ensuring they are intuitive, visually appealing, and aligned with user-centered design principles.
Conduct usability testing and gather feedback to validate design decisions and identify areas for improvement.
Collaborate with developers to ensure the successful implementation of designs, maintaining consistency and quality throughout the development process.
Stay up-to-date with industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies in UX design and incorporate them into the design process.




Requirements:

Bachelor's degree in Design, Human-Computer Interaction (HCI), or a related field. A master's degree is a plus.
Proven experience as a UX Designer or similar role, with a strong portfolio showcasing previous design work.
Proficiency in design and prototyping tools such as Sketch, Adobe XD, Figma, or similar.
Solid understanding of user-centered design principles and best practices.
Experience conducting user research and usability testing.
Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to effectively present and justify design decisions to stakeholders.
Ability to work in a fast-paced, iterative design environment and manage multiple projects simultaneously.
Knowledge of front-end development technologies (HTML, CSS, JavaScript) is a plus.
Familiarity with Agile development methodologies is a plus.
Industries: Staffing and Recruiting, Technology, Information and Media, and Information Services

Industries: Staffing and Recruiting, Technology, Information and Media, and Information Services

Job_description:
Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: Mountain View, CA, USA; Seattle, WA, USA; San Francisco, CA, USA.Minimum qualifications:


Bachelor's degree in Design, Human-Computer Interaction, Computer Science, a related field, or equivalent practical experience.
4 years of experience in product design or UX.
Experience designing across multiple platforms, and working with technical/design teams to create user flows, wireframes, and building user interface mockups and prototypes.
Portfolio highlighting multiple projects and your direct contributions.


Preferred qualifications:


Master's degree in Design, Human-Computer Interaction, Computer Science, a related field, or equivalent practical experience.
2 years of experience working in a complex, cross-functional organization.
1 year of experience leading design projects.
Problem-solving skills and familiarity with technical constraints and limitations as they apply to designing for platforms such as desktop and mobile (Android and iOS).
Ability to lead and ideate products from scratch and improve features within a user-centered design process.
Skills in communicating and influencing product design strategy.


About The Job

At Google, we follow a simple but vital premise: "Focus on the user and all else will follow." Google’s Interaction Designers take complex tasks and make them intuitive and easy-to-use for billions of people around the globe. Throughout the design process—from creating user flows and wireframes to building user interface mockups and prototypes—you’ll envision how people will experience our products, and bring that vision to life in a way that feels inspired, refined, and even magical.

Google User Experience (UX) is made up of multi-disciplinary teams of UX Designers, Researchers, Writers, Content Strategists, Program Managers, and Engineers: we care deeply about the people who use our products. The UX team plays an integral part in gathering insights about the attitudes, emotions, and behaviors of people who use our products to inspire and inform design. We collaborate closely with each other and with engineering and product management to create industry-leading products that deliver value for the people who use them, and for Google’s businesses.

As an Interaction Designer, you’ll rely on user-centered design methods to craft industry-leading user experiences—from concept to execution. Like all of our UX jobs, you’ll collaborate with your design partners to leverage and evolve the Google design language to build beautiful, innovative, inspired products that people love to use.

Chrome is dedicated to building a better, more open web. We’re focused on making a better browser (on both desktop and mobile) to help users take advantage of all the web has to offer in a safe and secure way.Chrome is available across all major platforms — iOS, Android, Windows, Mac, Linux and Chrome OS. We also built Chrome as an open source project so the entire web ecosystem could benefit from the latest innovations in speed, simplicity and security.

The US base salary range for this full-time position is $118,000-$172,000 + bonus + equity + benefits. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location. The range displayed on each job posting reflects the minimum and maximum target for new hire salaries for the position across all US locations. Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range for your preferred location during the hiring process.

Please note that the compensation details listed in US role postings reflect the base salary only, and do not include bonus, equity, or benefits. Learn more about benefits at Google .

Responsibilities


Collaborate with product managers, engineers, and cross-functional stakeholders to understand requirements, and provide creative, thoughtful solutions.
Communicate the user experience at various stages of the design process with wireframes, flow diagrams, storyboards, mockups, and/or high fidelity prototypes.
Integrate user feedback and business requirements into ongoing product experience updates.
Advocate for the prioritization of design centered changes, refinements, and improvements.



Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .
Industries: Information Services and Technology, Information and Internet
