We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .
Industries: Information Services and Technology, Information and Internet

Job_description:
Northwest Partners is seeking a UX Designer experienced in accessibility design to join a dynamic web accessibility assessment and remediation initiatives.

**Candidates must be legally authorized to work for any employer in the United States without sponsorship**

What YOU will do as a successful UX Designer


Facilitate comprehensive user research through interviews, surveys, and workshops to gather insights on user interaction with our products.
Develop and refine user flows, wireframes, mockups, and prototypes to foster intuitive user experiences.
Innovate and design wireframes, user narratives, pathways, and mockups, ensuring optimal functionality across diverse devices and interfaces.
Strategically enhance user experience by making informed decisions about core functionalities and emerging features.
Work collaboratively with colleagues and stakeholders to advance project goals.
Champion the client's vision by crafting, testing, and refining digital experiences.
Execute user interface testing, including calls-to-action, banners, layout configurations, design aesthetics, navigational flows, and landing page link targets.
Utilize data and analytics to refine user experiences and communicate performance metrics.
Ensure UX design compliant with ADA accessibility guidelines.


Minimum Qualification For Consideration


At least 5 years of related professional experience using standard UX tools such as Figma, Sketch, Adobe Suite, XD, Axure, UXPin, InVision.
Experience in designing responsive consumer-facing applications.
Professional certification in UI accessibility design is a plus.
A minimum of 3 years of experience in phased UX modernization of products.
Practical knowledge of HTML5 and CSS.
Proficiency in generating interaction design materials like concept diagrams, wireframes, and prototypes (both low and high fidelity).
Effective communication skills, both written and verbal.
A bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.


About Northwest Partners

Northwest Partners is dedicated to moving at the speed of innovation. We work with clients across the globe to provide exceptional knowledge, talent, and resources. As a trusted partner, we merge the client's vision with our expertise to deliver powerful results. Northwest Partners is known for building and managing elite teams in technology across diverse industries. Our mission is to empower every talent and every client to achieve more.

Are you looking to join a growing, successful SaaS startup? Are you excited about delivering high-value, frequently-used features to users who rely on your products to execute their jobs daily? Are you looking to help a startup achieve its next level of growth? If yes, then keep reading!

PerformYard has developed a simple and effective platform that helps drive staff performance through the roof. Our long-term vision is to change how performance is managed and measured in organizations of all sizes. To get there, we need to add to our fantastic team, and that’s where you come in!

Our Product UI/UX Designer will work closely with other designers and product managers to take our roadmap and product requirements and turn them into clean and straightforward user experiences and designs that will drive end-user adoption, engagement, and satisfaction.

A successful candidate at PerformYard will be a strongly self-motivated and driven individual who is creative, efficient, detail-oriented, and organized in their UX and UI product design approach. This position has growth potential as our Product team continues to grow.

Click this link to learn more about our SaaS platform: https://www.performyard.com/flexible-features

Requirements

As a critical Product team member, the Product UI/UX Designer will own and drive UX and UI designs to help us deliver our vision of simple, scalable, and effective performance management software used daily by leading HR professionals.

What You’ll Do:


Collaborate and help drive the user experience for the PerformYard SaaS products
Collaborate directly with product managers to translate our product roadmap and product requirements into simple and clean user experiences and designs
Collaborate with engineers in agile scrum teams to drive design concepts forward through implementation, including developing wireframes and UI Prototypes when necessary and annotated design specs using Figma, including CSS specifications
Enhance and help maintain the PerformYard UI design system


What You’ll Bring:


3+ years of UI design experience on a commercial SaaS product
Portfolio of past product UX and UI design work demonstrating breadth and depth in UI design
Strong visual design skills and attention to detail
Ability to work and innovate at various levels, from systems-level thinking to technical design specifications
Figma Design Experience
BA in graphic design, human factors, or UI design
Some hands-on experience with CSS and HTML
Prior experience working on agile/scrum product teams
Prior experience working on a team of UI/UX designers


Bonus Points:


Experience designing for React-based web applications
Design experience with HRIS or Employee Management applications
Front-end web application development experience (Javascript, HTML, React.)
Experience designing for Accessibility (WCAG 2.x AA/AAA.)


Benefits

In addition to your compensation plan we also have medical, dental, and vision health insurance benefits w/ HSA plan, disability insurance, 401k plan, generous PTO, paid holidays and other benefits.

Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity

The Future Is What You Make It.

When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars. Working at Honeywell isn’t just about developing cool things. That’s why our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries.

Are you ready to help us make the future?

As part of the User Experience Design team, you will become an important part of Honeywell’s Experience Design team as you help define the next generation of products for Honeywell’s Sensing & Productivity Solutions (SPS) business. Deliver an end-to-end user experience across every user touch point for Honeywell’s Sensing & Productivity Solutions (SPS) business, using well established human-centered design principles to ensure that Honeywell products and applications are the most useful, usable and desirable products in the marketplace. You will collaborate with other designers, user researchers, and engineers to constructively partner across the business to advocate for designs that enable users needs.

We are looking for interns for the Summer 2024 term in the roles of:

Industrial Design

Key Responsibilities:


Support industrial design development and implementation for product categories.
Develop and implement cohesive design strategies, incorporating research insights and business needs that span touchpoints across the life cycle of multiple products.
Utilize Industrial Design principals to execute design projects within an agile development process.
Be a champion for User Experience and demonstrate how your designs solve complex challenges in an industrial environment.
Identify opportunities in the User Experience and propose solutions which add value to both the user and the customer.
Develop an understanding of the Honeywell marketplace, competition, industry, methods, and relevant trends and apply those learnings to your designs.
Carefully apply and contribute to the Honeywell brand design language.
Work closely with mechanical engineering in executing high level product experiences to meet the needs of our customers and users.
Create low to high-fidelity prototypes and familiarity with rapid prototyping techniques.
Excellent 3D modeling skills in Solidworks/Rhino and a portfolio that showcases this area.
UX/UI Design


Key Responsibilities


Assist senior UX Designers in creating wireframes, designs, and prototypes.
Apply UX/UI skills to create experiences that meet business goals and user needs.
Participate in user research, usability testing, and research analysis.
Contribute to design brainstorming and work sessions.
Incorporate feedback from team members and users to refine designs.
Stay updated on UX trends and best practices.
Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders.
Contribute to design system components and documentation.
Prototype programs using wireframing or clickable prototypes.
Utilize design tools such as Figma and B2B software to design and deliver seamless experiences.
Additional working flows requiring a basic understanding of HTML/CSS.


Design Research

Key Responsibilities:


Work effectively with user experience professionals and stakeholders to understand both customer and user experience outcomes, ensuring their needs are represented in product requirements.
Execute generative user research, design thinking workshops and opportunity framing exercises to support innovation projects and strategic customer engagements.
Apply human-centered design methodologies and UX best practices to ensure solutions are useful, usable and desirable.
Collaborate with design disciplines, including industrial, graphic and interaction design, to create strategies that deliver outstanding products that delight our end users.


Minimum Qualifications


Entering your Junior or Senior year in an accredited Industrial Design, Product Design, User Experience Design, User Interaction Design, Design Research (or similar) degree or certification.
Reliable transportation to our office in Fort Mill, SC.


WE VALUE


Exceptional portfolio demonstrating innovative concepts, design thinking and a user-centered focus.
Potential ability to work across multiple types of products and platforms.
Appreciation of corporate branding and design language systems.
Experience in creating low to high-fidelity prototypes and rapid prototyping.
Familiarity with research methods and usability.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Proficiency in statistics and data storytelling is a plus.
An attitude biased toward ownership, action, and pragmatic tradeoffs between user and business needs.
Excellent written and oral communication skills.
Strong team player that’s also effective at working independently.
“Can-Do” attitude that is willing to learn from seasoned professionals from diverse disciplines and backgrounds.


Additional Information


JOB ID: req426177
Category: Engineering
Location: 9680 Old Bailes Rd,Fort Mill,South Carolina,29707-7539,United States
Nonexempt



Early Career (ALL)

Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, religion, or veteran status.

Role: UI/ UX Designer

Location: Washington, DC (Hybrid work, 3 times in a week)

Duration: Long term

Rate: Market

Job Description


Develop wireframe / web page designs to help users visualize the layout and position of information on web pages, navigational elements, etc.
Develop graphical design dements for inclusion in web pages or other system user interfaces using state of the art tools and web based technologies, User Experience includes the activities associated With the definition and assessment of user requirements that are used to determine detailed application design.
Assist with the design of the application based on user requirements as well as information architecture and security requirements, interface. requirements, and regulator/ statutes.
Works with users and key stakeholders to develop components within the application and design easy.to-use, role based applications.
Create navigation and content architectures, guidelines for layout consistency, and a visual design recommendation (e.g. Wire frames, front a layout arid content perspective and using the business rules.
Develop as needed layered image files, wire frames, interactive prototypes. and a style guide that aligns with the organization branding practices. Review Use Cases and User Stories to uncover the users context, needs, goals, and attitudes, leading to Conceptual Interaction Models that outline how a user navigates the product. performs tasks, and uses tools.
Develop Conceptual Interaction Models. Work with development team to implement conceptual interaction models. Provide visualization of user stories for the development team. Participate in backlog grooming sessions.


Education

Bachelor's degree or equivalent professional experience in Information Systems, Graphical Design or related technical or functional discipline.

At least three (3) years of relevant business analysis experience.

Waiver for degree can be allowed with three years of experience in this field.

About Vouch

Insurance... sounds slow, old-fashioned, and unexciting. Exactly. Insurance is broken, and it's failing fast-moving, innovative startups.

Vouch is a new, technology-first insurance company backed with $160M in funding from world-class investors. Like Stripe for payments or Brex for credit cards, Vouch is creating the go-to business insurance for high-growth companies.

We're doing this by making insurance fast, responsive, and focused on our high-growth and innovative customers. Instead of printed PDF applications and week-long waits, Vouch is building new technology to solve real problems, writing policies that actually cover relevant startup scenarios, and designing simple experiences in an otherwise frustrating industry.

What does a work environment look like at Vouch?

Vouch is a Virtual First Workplace with San Francisco, Chicago, and New York City office locations. This role can be based anywhere in the U.S. as long as you can work our Vouch core collaboration hours (8:30 am-2:30 pm Pacific Time.) when most internal meetings are held.

A Bold Mission Made Possible By Design

At Vouch, we’re on a mission to revolutionize the insurance industry. Faced with the challenge of designing for complex products and discerning clients, particularly in the tech sector, we aim to blend exceptional service with digital efficiency. Our goal is not just to create a great product but to embed design thinking into our DNA, becoming a design-forward company.

The Role

As a UI/UX Designer, your work will be pivotal in shaping our client experience. You'll maintain our core design system, empower our design team, and create delightful user experiences that resonate with our clients. Your role is a blend of technical proficiency, creative design, and strategic collaboration.

Your Mandate


Own Our Design System & Component Library: Lead the design and enhancement of our design systems to meet diverse needs and in accordance with industry best practices and accessibility guidelines. Maintain and evolve our component library in collaboration with engineering and QA teams
Prototype & Test: Develop high-fidelity prototypes using tools like Figma and ProtoPie. Conduct usability testing for components and workflows, refining the user experience based on feedback.
Design Workflows & Features: Practice your “design thinking” by working with product managers to deliver impactful product features and improvements, ensuring alignment with user needs and enhancing the overall client experience.


About You


Professional Experience: 2-3 years in UI/UX design, with a portfolio demonstrating proficiency in design systems, prototyping, and user-centered design.
Technical Skills: Proficiency in design and prototyping tools (e.g. Figma, ProtoPie), as well as a strong understanding of HTML/CSS.
Collaborative Approach: Strong communication and teamwork skills, able to work effectively with cross-functional teams.
Problem-Solving Mindset: Adept at identifying user needs and translating them into practical and aesthetically pleasing design solutions.
**Your application will not be considered if you do not provide a portfolio/website


Vouch provides a number of benefits to help you bring your best self to work:


Competitive compensation and equity packages
Health, dental, and vision insurance
Parental leave
Flexible vacation time (Unlimited PTO)
Wellness allowance ($80/month)
Technology allowance ($100/month)


Salary Range

The pay range for this role is: $120,000 to $135,000 per year.

Our salary ranges are based on paying competitively for our size and industry and are one part of our total compensation package that also includes benefits and other perks. We also include stock options in all compensation packages and believe all Vouch employees should have the opportunity to become owners in the company. Individual pay decisions are based on a number of factors, including qualifications for the role, experience level, skill set, location, and business need. The base pay range provided is subject to change and may be modified in the future.

Vouch believes in putting our people first, and building a diverse team is at the front of everything we do. We welcome people from different backgrounds, experiences, perspectives, and ranges of abilities. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate the diversity of our growing team.

If you require reasonable accommodation in completing this application, interviewing, completing any pre-employment testing, or otherwise participating in the employee selection process, please direct your inquiries to recruiting@vouch.us.

Conduct usability testing for components and workflows, refining the user experience based on feedback.Design Workflows & Features: Practice your “design thinking” by working with product managers to deliver impactful product features and improvements, ensuring alignment with user needs and enhancing the overall client experience.About YouProfessional Experience: 2-3 years in UI/UX design, with a portfolio demonstrating proficiency in design systems, prototyping, and user-centered design.Technical Skills: Proficiency in design and prototyping tools (e.g. Figma, ProtoPie), as well as a strong understanding of HTML/CSS.Collaborative Approach: Strong communication and teamwork skills, able to work effectively with cross-functional teams.Problem-Solving Mindset: Adept at identifying user needs and translating them into practical and aesthetically pleasing design solutions.**Your application will not be considered if you do not provide a portfolio/websiteVouch provides a number of benefits to help you bring your best self to work:Competitive compensation and equity packagesHealth, dental, and vision insuranceParental leaveFlexible vacation time (Unlimited PTO)Wellness allowance ($80/month)Technology allowance ($100/month)Salary RangeThe pay range for this role is: $120,000 to $135,000 per year.Our salary ranges are based on paying competitively for our size and industry and are one part of our total compensation package that also includes benefits and other perks. We also include stock options in all compensation packages and believe all Vouch employees should have the opportunity to become owners in the company. Individual pay decisions are based on a number of factors, including qualifications for the role, experience level, skill set, location, and business need. The base pay range provided is subject to change and may be modified in the future.Vouch believes in putting our people first, and building a diverse team is at the front of everything we do. We welcome people from different backgrounds, experiences, perspectives, and ranges of abilities. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate the diversity of our growing team. If you require reasonable accommodation in completing this application, interviewing, completing any pre-employment testing, or otherwise participating in the employee selection process, please direct your inquiries to recruiting@vouch.us.

UX DesignerFulltime positionRemote opportunityPay rate: $60.00 per hour.We have partnered with one of the world's largest apparel companies and a global leader in jeans apparel. With 500 plus stores worldwide, and products available in more than 100 countries. The company is searching for UX Designer to join their team.We are searching for a UX Designer who will help drive consumer understanding through fact-based analyses and insights to strengthen our companies eCommerce business. Your work will raise the UX bar across multiple platforms and help define the shopping experience on the websites and native apps for one of the most iconic brands in the world. You will support the Product Management & UX Design teams to ensure the voice of consumers informs discovery, development, optimization, and analysis of digital and Omni channel experiences. You will initiate, plan, and execute research projects focusing on our products in Asia, the Middle East, and Australia (AMA). Your work will help us better understand our consumers and put their needs at the center of our design process.We are looking for another great team player ready to jump in and make an impact. As a UX Designer and Researcher you will.Collaborate with Product Management, UX Design, and other teamsWork across a variety of research methodologies and platforms (qualitative and quantitative across site & app)Plan, design and conduct user research studies focused on understanding and improving the user experienceUncover and deliver clear and actionable insightsPresent and communicate insights across regions and levelsParticipate in regular research operations meetingsPartner with our product team to understand the roadmap and guide how to support product development with insights bestEvangelize UX & UI best practices to our partners and stakeholdersEffectively manage your research projectsContribute to a positive, collaborative, and dynamic design cultureRequirements5+ years of experience in a UX research roleDeep knowledge of different research methodologies and toolsExperience with: usability testing, 1:1 user interviews, concept testing, survey development, competitive analysis, discovery, and design thinking.Proven track record delivering impactful/actionable insightsAbility to build and nurture cross-functional relationshipsStrong communication skills (written and verbal)A strong bias toward actionHands-on experience with feedback platforms & tools such as Qualtrics, usertesting.com, or an equivalentDegree in Product innovation, Human Factors, Human-computer Interaction, Market Research, or a related field

Experience Designer at a large Banking/Financial organization, we are guided by a common purpose: To help make lives better by connecting our internal users with the tools and resources they need to be successful.Required Skills: As an Experience Designer, you Should have experience designing complex transactional systems into intuitive and valuable products. Experience Designers need to be excellent analytical and conceptual thinkers that translate user needs, business objectives and technology capabilities into innovative design. This position requires a strong foundation in user centered design methods and the ability to communicate design decisions effectively to senior stakeholders and team members alike. This position is for a thoughtful designer with a passion for making complex data and workflow problems simpler.You will introduce creativity while driving consistency, ensuring that styles express our brand but are optimized for context and the technical platform being utilized.You will participate in design meetings and critiques and provide feedback to teammates.Core deliverables of yours include low and high-fidelity wireframes that you will translate into clickable prototypes for user testing validation and to communicate your designs to technology partners and business stakeholders. You’re a person who has 5+ years of design experience Exceptional interaction and visual design skills A strong portfolio that shows a commitment to user centered design Experience applying brand and digital standards, and as needed, contributing to asset libraries for cross-team use Experience designing responsive websites, applications, and other digital interfaces. Experience designing native mobile applications is a plus. Experience with Sketch, In Vision, Figma, Balsamiq and other design and management tools Experience working in an Agile environment, using tools like JIRADesired Skills: You will be better prepared if you have Bachelor's or Master's degree in design or related discipline Financial or similar industry experience. Title: Web/UX Designer/Researcher




Location: New York, NY Onsite




Lead end-to-end user research activities, including planning, recruiting, moderating sessions, analyzing data, and presenting actionable insights.
Design and conduct in-depth user interviews, usability tests, surveys, and other research methods to uncover user needs, pain points, and behaviors.
Collaborate closely with Product Managers, UX Designers, and Engineers to translate research findings into actionable recommendations that drive product enhancements.
Champion a user-centered approach throughout the product development lifecycle, advocating for user needs and promoting empathy within the team.
Develop and maintain research plans, ensuring alignment with project goals and timelines.
Craft persuasive and impactful research reports and presentations that communicate insights, opportunities, and recommendations clearly and effectively.
Stay informed about industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies, and apply this knowledge to inform research methodologies and recommendations.




Contribute your financial services knowledge to provide deeper context to research findings and recommendations, ensuring our products align




Strong organizational skills and ability to manage multiple projects and priorities simultaneously.

Title: Web/UX Designer/ResearcherLocation: New York, NY OnsiteLead end-to-end user research activities, including planning, recruiting, moderating sessions, analyzing data, and presenting actionable insights.Design and conduct in-depth user interviews, usability tests, surveys, and other research methods to uncover user needs, pain points, and behaviors.Collaborate closely with Product Managers, UX Designers, and Engineers to translate research findings into actionable recommendations that drive product enhancements.Champion a user-centered approach throughout the product development lifecycle, advocating for user needs and promoting empathy within the team.Develop and maintain research plans, ensuring alignment with project goals and timelines.Craft persuasive and impactful research reports and presentations that communicate insights, opportunities, and recommendations clearly and effectively.Stay informed about industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies, and apply this knowledge to inform research methodologies and recommendations.Contribute your financial services knowledge to provide deeper context to research findings and recommendations, ensuring our products alignStrong organizational skills and ability to manage multiple projects and priorities simultaneously.

We are seeking a talented UX Designer to join our team and play a key role in shaping the user experience of our products.




We are actively working on designing new solutions for our clients and using our data assets creatively to provide unique insights to our users.







Key Responsibilities:

Design Development: Develop user-centric designs by understanding business requirements, and user feedback.
Collaboration: Collaborate with various stakeholders including product managers, engineers, and customers to create seamless and effective web applications.
User Research: Conduct user research to understand pain points and improve the overall user experience.
Prototyping and Testing: Create prototypes, wireframes and conduct usability testing to gather feedback.
Design Execution: Implement modern UX design principles, maintain design system and methodologies to ensure a great user experience.
Continuous Improvement: Stay abreast of UX trends and look for creative ideas and inspiration in parallel analogous worlds.







Qualifications:

5+ years of experience in designing SaaS/Web applications.
Strong portfolio showcasing previous UX design work.
Experience maintaining a design system and implementing it with relative CSS units -- REM, EM, %
Experience building desktop-first designs with consideration for laptop to ultra-wide screen sizes.
Proficiency in design tools such as Sketch, Adobe XD, Figma, or similar.
Knowledge of HTML, CSS, Tailwind framework, and front-end development is a plus.
Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
Experience in the financial industry is a plus.







Benefits and Perks:

Base + target bonus compensation structure
Medical, Dental, Vision insurance
401K (with employer match)
Life insurance, long term disability, short term disability all covered by the company
Flexible paid time off (PTO)
Sixteen (16) weeks paid primary caregiver leave (Biological, adoptive, and foster parents are all eligible)
Four (4) weeks paid parental leave
Wellness subsidy provided by Trepp
Pet insurance
Laptop ​+ WFH equipment​
Career progression plan
Pre-tax commuter benefit with company subsidy (For NYC-office based employees only)
Involvement in Diversity and Inclusion programs
Fun company events and volunteering opportunities




Workplace Policy:

NYC, Dallas, and London office-based positions: Trepp’s offices follows a 3-2 hybrid-working policy with the expectation of in-office work on Tuesday-Thursday and the option to work from home on Monday and Friday.

A User Experience (UX) Designer is responsible for creating and enhancing the overall user experience of a product or service. They combine user research, information architecture, interaction design, and visual design principles to design intuitive and engaging user interfaces.




Responsibilities:

Conduct user research to understand user needs, goals, and behaviors through methods such as interviews, surveys, and usability testing.
Analyze and interpret research findings to identify user insights and create user personas, user journeys, and other UX artifacts.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including product managers, developers, and visual designers, to define and prioritize product requirements.
Create wireframes, prototypes, and interactive mockups to effectively communicate design ideas and concepts.
Design and iterate on user interfaces, ensuring they are intuitive, visually appealing, and aligned with user-centered design principles.
Conduct usability testing and gather feedback to validate design decisions and identify areas for improvement.
Collaborate with developers to ensure the successful implementation of designs, maintaining consistency and quality throughout the development process.
Stay up-to-date with industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies in UX design and incorporate them into the design process.




Requirements:

Bachelor's degree in Design, Human-Computer Interaction (HCI), or a related field. A master's degree is a plus.
Proven experience as a UX Designer or similar role, with a strong portfolio showcasing previous design work.
Proficiency in design and prototyping tools such as Sketch, Adobe XD, Figma, or similar.
Solid understanding of user-centered design principles and best practices.
Experience conducting user research and usability testing.
Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to effectively present and justify design decisions to stakeholders.
Ability to work in a fast-paced, iterative design environment and manage multiple projects simultaneously.
Knowledge of front-end development technologies (HTML, CSS, JavaScript) is a plus.
Familiarity with Agile development methodologies is a plus.
Industries: Staffing and Recruiting, Technology, Information and Media, and Information Services

Job_description:
Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: Mountain View, CA, USA; Seattle, WA, USA; San Francisco, CA, USA.Minimum qualifications:


Bachelor's degree in Design, Human-Computer Interaction, Computer Science, a related field, or equivalent practical experience.
4 years of experience in product design or UX.
Experience designing across multiple platforms, and working with technical/design teams to create user flows, wireframes, and building user interface mockups and prototypes.
Portfolio highlighting multiple projects and your direct contributions.


Preferred qualifications:


Master's degree in Design, Human-Computer Interaction, Computer Science, a related field, or equivalent practical experience.
2 years of experience working in a complex, cross-functional organization.
1 year of experience leading design projects.
Problem-solving skills and familiarity with technical constraints and limitations as they apply to designing for platforms such as desktop and mobile (Android and iOS).
Ability to lead and ideate products from scratch and improve features within a user-centered design process.
Skills in communicating and influencing product design strategy.


About The Job

At Google, we follow a simple but vital premise: "Focus on the user and all else will follow." Google’s Interaction Designers take complex tasks and make them intuitive and easy-to-use for billions of people around the globe. Throughout the design process—from creating user flows and wireframes to building user interface mockups and prototypes—you’ll envision how people will experience our products, and bring that vision to life in a way that feels inspired, refined, and even magical.

Google User Experience (UX) is made up of multi-disciplinary teams of UX Designers, Researchers, Writers, Content Strategists, Program Managers, and Engineers: we care deeply about the people who use our products. The UX team plays an integral part in gathering insights about the attitudes, emotions, and behaviors of people who use our products to inspire and inform design. We collaborate closely with each other and with engineering and product management to create industry-leading products that deliver value for the people who use them, and for Google’s businesses.

As an Interaction Designer, you’ll rely on user-centered design methods to craft industry-leading user experiences—from concept to execution. Like all of our UX jobs, you’ll collaborate with your design partners to leverage and evolve the Google design language to build beautiful, innovative, inspired products that people love to use.

Chrome is dedicated to building a better, more open web. We’re focused on making a better browser (on both desktop and mobile) to help users take advantage of all the web has to offer in a safe and secure way.Chrome is available across all major platforms — iOS, Android, Windows, Mac, Linux and Chrome OS. We also built Chrome as an open source project so the entire web ecosystem could benefit from the latest innovations in speed, simplicity and security.

The US base salary range for this full-time position is $118,000-$172,000 + bonus + equity + benefits. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location. The range displayed on each job posting reflects the minimum and maximum target for new hire salaries for the position across all US locations. Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range for your preferred location during the hiring process.

Please note that the compensation details listed in US role postings reflect the base salary only, and do not include bonus, equity, or benefits. Learn more about benefits at Google .

Responsibilities


Collaborate with product managers, engineers, and cross-functional stakeholders to understand requirements, and provide creative, thoughtful solutions.
Communicate the user experience at various stages of the design process with wireframes, flow diagrams, storyboards, mockups, and/or high fidelity prototypes.
Integrate user feedback and business requirements into ongoing product experience updates.
Advocate for the prioritization of design centered changes, refinements, and improvements.



Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .
Industries: Information Services and Technology, Information and Internet

Job_description:
Northwest Partners is seeking a UX Designer experienced in accessibility design to join a dynamic web accessibility assessment and remediation initiatives.

**Candidates must be legally authorized to work for any employer in the United States without sponsorship**

What YOU will do as a successful UX Designer


Facilitate comprehensive user research through interviews, surveys, and workshops to gather insights on user interaction with our products.
Develop and refine user flows, wireframes, mockups, and prototypes to foster intuitive user experiences.
Innovate and design wireframes, user narratives, pathways, and mockups, ensuring optimal functionality across diverse devices and interfaces.
Strategically enhance user experience by making informed decisions about core functionalities and emerging features.
Work collaboratively with colleagues and stakeholders to advance project goals.
Champion the client's vision by crafting, testing, and refining digital experiences.
Execute user interface testing, including calls-to-action, banners, layout configurations, design aesthetics, navigational flows, and landing page link targets.
Utilize data and analytics to refine user experiences and communicate performance metrics.
Ensure UX design compliant with ADA accessibility guidelines.


Minimum Qualification For Consideration


At least 5 years of related professional experience using standard UX tools such as Figma, Sketch, Adobe Suite, XD, Axure, UXPin, InVision.
Experience in designing responsive consumer-facing applications.
Professional certification in UI accessibility design is a plus.
A minimum of 3 years of experience in phased UX modernization of products.
Practical knowledge of HTML5 and CSS.
Proficiency in generating interaction design materials like concept diagrams, wireframes, and prototypes (both low and high fidelity).
Effective communication skills, both written and verbal.
A bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.


About Northwest Partners

Northwest Partners is dedicated to moving at the speed of innovation. We work with clients across the globe to provide exceptional knowledge, talent, and resources. As a trusted partner, we merge the client's vision with our expertise to deliver powerful results. Northwest Partners is known for building and managing elite teams in technology across diverse industries. Our mission is to empower every talent and every client to achieve more.

Are you looking to join a growing, successful SaaS startup? Are you excited about delivering high-value, frequently-used features to users who rely on your products to execute their jobs daily? Are you looking to help a startup achieve its next level of growth? If yes, then keep reading!

PerformYard has developed a simple and effective platform that helps drive staff performance through the roof. Our long-term vision is to change how performance is managed and measured in organizations of all sizes. To get there, we need to add to our fantastic team, and that’s where you come in!

Our Product UI/UX Designer will work closely with other designers and product managers to take our roadmap and product requirements and turn them into clean and straightforward user experiences and designs that will drive end-user adoption, engagement, and satisfaction.

A successful candidate at PerformYard will be a strongly self-motivated and driven individual who is creative, efficient, detail-oriented, and organized in their UX and UI product design approach. This position has growth potential as our Product team continues to grow.

Click this link to learn more about our SaaS platform: https://www.performyard.com/flexible-features

Requirements

As a critical Product team member, the Product UI/UX Designer will own and drive UX and UI designs to help us deliver our vision of simple, scalable, and effective performance management software used daily by leading HR professionals.

What You’ll Do:


Collaborate and help drive the user experience for the PerformYard SaaS products
Collaborate directly with product managers to translate our product roadmap and product requirements into simple and clean user experiences and designs
Collaborate with engineers in agile scrum teams to drive design concepts forward through implementation, including developing wireframes and UI Prototypes when necessary and annotated design specs using Figma, including CSS specifications
Enhance and help maintain the PerformYard UI design system


What You’ll Bring:


3+ years of UI design experience on a commercial SaaS product
Portfolio of past product UX and UI design work demonstrating breadth and depth in UI design
Strong visual design skills and attention to detail
Ability to work and innovate at various levels, from systems-level thinking to technical design specifications
Figma Design Experience
BA in graphic design, human factors, or UI design
Some hands-on experience with CSS and HTML
Prior experience working on agile/scrum product teams
Prior experience working on a team of UI/UX designers


Bonus Points:


Experience designing for React-based web applications
Design experience with HRIS or Employee Management applications
Front-end web application development experience (Javascript, HTML, React.)
Experience designing for Accessibility (WCAG 2.x AA/AAA.)


Benefits

In addition to your compensation plan we also have medical, dental, and vision health insurance benefits w/ HSA plan, disability insurance, 401k plan, generous PTO, paid holidays and other benefits.

Job Description

We are seeking a talented UI/UX Designer to join our growing team. The ideal candidate is a creative thinker with a strong foundation in both user interface and user experience design. You will work closely with the software team and product owners to understand user needs, business requirements, and translate them into visually appealing and intuitive designs.

WORK LOCATION: Orlando, FL or Chandler, AZ - VirTra does not sponsor work visas

Essential Duties:


Collaborate with product owners, software engineers, and other stakeholders to understand user needs and business goals.
Create wireframes, mockups, and prototypes that effectively communicate design concepts.
Conduct user research and usability testing to gather feedback and iteratively enhance designs.
Stay up to date with industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies to continuously improve design processes.
Work closely with multiple teams to ensure seamless implementation of designs that meet stakeholder's expectations.
Comply with department ISO 9001 processes and company quality policy
Manage and log time worked daily by project code
Provide miscellaneous support to other departments, as needed.
Performs other duties as requested


Qualifications You must Have:


Proven experience as a UI/UX Designer or similar role.
Strong portfolio showcasing a range of design projects and a deep understanding of design principles.
Proficient in design tools such as Sketch, Figma, Adobe XD, or similar.
Experience with user research, usability testing, and iterative design processes.
Solid understanding of responsive design principles.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
Bachelor's degree in design, HCI, or related field (or equivalent work experience).


Competencies:


Detail oriented
Collaboration
Creative thinker
Initiative
Analytical


Physical Demands:

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit. The employee frequently is required to walk; use hands to finger, handle or feel; reach with hands and arms; and talk or hear. Often the employee will be required to stand and walk. Ability to occasionally lift objects up to 20 lbs. and to sit and work at a computer for upwards of 4 hours at a time. Often the employee will be sitting at a desk for long periods of time using a computer.

Additional Requirements, if any:

Full time position consisting of 40+hours per week; normal hours of operation are Monday through Friday, 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. This position may require periodic overtime and weekend work during periods of high production or deadlines.

Pre-employment drug screening

Pre-employment background check

Equal Opportunity Employer–minorities/females/veterans/individuals with disabilities/ gender identity/ sexual orientation

Company Description

VirTra’s Mission is to save lives by developing, manufacturing and supporting the most powerful and immersive firearm training simulators, scenarios and accessories worldwide.

VirTra is a conscientious, high-growth, fast-paced judgmental use of force simulation training company specializing in military and law enforcement. VirTra helps prepare law enforcement officers for real-life incidents so they and the communities they serve can remain safe.

Each real-world judgmental use of force training simulator has surreal scenarios that provide an in-depth look into human performance.

VirTra helps prepare law enforcement officers for real-life incidents so they and the communities they serve can remain safe. Each real-world judgmental use of force training simulator has surreal scenarios that provide an in-depth look into human performance. The demands on law enforcement to make critical decisions in tense, uncertain and rapidly evolving situations require that the human performance aspect of cognitive neuroscience and human physiology are taken into account as part of the police training methodology. Research on how to best use law enforcement simulation technology is taken into account within what VirTra does. Training scenarios are filmed in superior quality and contain the full fidelity of real actors—thus eliminating ‘video game’ training. VirTra’s extensive branching options further increase the realism by allowing scenarios to unfold based on the instructor, trainee or team’s decisions.

Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity

The Future Is What You Make It.

When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars. Working at Honeywell isn’t just about developing cool things. That’s why our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries.

Are you ready to help us make the future?

As part of the User Experience Design team, you will become an important part of Honeywell’s Experience Design team as you help define the next generation of products for Honeywell’s Sensing & Productivity Solutions (SPS) business. Deliver an end-to-end user experience across every user touch point for Honeywell’s Sensing & Productivity Solutions (SPS) business, using well established human-centered design principles to ensure that Honeywell products and applications are the most useful, usable and desirable products in the marketplace. You will collaborate with other designers, user researchers, and engineers to constructively partner across the business to advocate for designs that enable users needs.

We are looking for interns for the Summer 2024 term in the roles of:

Industrial Design

Key Responsibilities:


Support industrial design development and implementation for product categories.
Develop and implement cohesive design strategies, incorporating research insights and business needs that span touchpoints across the life cycle of multiple products.
Utilize Industrial Design principals to execute design projects within an agile development process.
Be a champion for User Experience and demonstrate how your designs solve complex challenges in an industrial environment.
Identify opportunities in the User Experience and propose solutions which add value to both the user and the customer.
Develop an understanding of the Honeywell marketplace, competition, industry, methods, and relevant trends and apply those learnings to your designs.
Carefully apply and contribute to the Honeywell brand design language.
Work closely with mechanical engineering in executing high level product experiences to meet the needs of our customers and users.
Create low to high-fidelity prototypes and familiarity with rapid prototyping techniques.
Excellent 3D modeling skills in Solidworks/Rhino and a portfolio that showcases this area.
UX/UI Design


Key Responsibilities


Assist senior UX Designers in creating wireframes, designs, and prototypes.
Apply UX/UI skills to create experiences that meet business goals and user needs.
Participate in user research, usability testing, and research analysis.
Contribute to design brainstorming and work sessions.
Incorporate feedback from team members and users to refine designs.
Stay updated on UX trends and best practices.
Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders.
Contribute to design system components and documentation.
Prototype programs using wireframing or clickable prototypes.
Utilize design tools such as Figma and B2B software to design and deliver seamless experiences.
Additional working flows requiring a basic understanding of HTML/CSS.


Design Research

Key Responsibilities:


Work effectively with user experience professionals and stakeholders to understand both customer and user experience outcomes, ensuring their needs are represented in product requirements.
Execute generative user research, design thinking workshops and opportunity framing exercises to support innovation projects and strategic customer engagements.
Apply human-centered design methodologies and UX best practices to ensure solutions are useful, usable and desirable.
Collaborate with design disciplines, including industrial, graphic and interaction design, to create strategies that deliver outstanding products that delight our end users.


Minimum Qualifications


Entering your Junior or Senior year in an accredited Industrial Design, Product Design, User Experience Design, User Interaction Design, Design Research (or similar) degree or certification.
Reliable transportation to our office in Fort Mill, SC.


WE VALUE


Exceptional portfolio demonstrating innovative concepts, design thinking and a user-centered focus.
Potential ability to work across multiple types of products and platforms.
Appreciation of corporate branding and design language systems.
Experience in creating low to high-fidelity prototypes and rapid prototyping.
Familiarity with research methods and usability.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Proficiency in statistics and data storytelling is a plus.
An attitude biased toward ownership, action, and pragmatic tradeoffs between user and business needs.
Excellent written and oral communication skills.
Strong team player that’s also effective at working independently.
“Can-Do” attitude that is willing to learn from seasoned professionals from diverse disciplines and backgrounds.


Additional Information


JOB ID: req426177
Category: Engineering
Location: 9680 Old Bailes Rd,Fort Mill,South Carolina,29707-7539,United States
Nonexempt



Early Career (ALL)

Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, religion, or veteran status.

Role: UI/ UX Designer

Location: Washington, DC (Hybrid work, 3 times in a week)

Duration: Long term

Rate: Market

Job Description


Develop wireframe / web page designs to help users visualize the layout and position of information on web pages, navigational elements, etc.
Develop graphical design dements for inclusion in web pages or other system user interfaces using state of the art tools and web based technologies, User Experience includes the activities associated With the definition and assessment of user requirements that are used to determine detailed application design.
Assist with the design of the application based on user requirements as well as information architecture and security requirements, interface. requirements, and regulator/ statutes.
Works with users and key stakeholders to develop components within the application and design easy.to-use, role based applications.
Create navigation and content architectures, guidelines for layout consistency, and a visual design recommendation (e.g. Wire frames, front a layout arid content perspective and using the business rules.
Develop as needed layered image files, wire frames, interactive prototypes. and a style guide that aligns with the organization branding practices. Review Use Cases and User Stories to uncover the users context, needs, goals, and attitudes, leading to Conceptual Interaction Models that outline how a user navigates the product. performs tasks, and uses tools.
Develop Conceptual Interaction Models. Work with development team to implement conceptual interaction models. Provide visualization of user stories for the development team. Participate in backlog grooming sessions.


Education

Bachelor's degree or equivalent professional experience in Information Systems, Graphical Design or related technical or functional discipline.

At least three (3) years of relevant business analysis experience.

Waiver for degree can be allowed with three years of experience in this field.

About Vouch

Insurance... sounds slow, old-fashioned, and unexciting. Exactly. Insurance is broken, and it's failing fast-moving, innovative startups.

Vouch is a new, technology-first insurance company backed with $160M in funding from world-class investors. Like Stripe for payments or Brex for credit cards, Vouch is creating the go-to business insurance for high-growth companies.

We're doing this by making insurance fast, responsive, and focused on our high-growth and innovative customers. Instead of printed PDF applications and week-long waits, Vouch is building new technology to solve real problems, writing policies that actually cover relevant startup scenarios, and designing simple experiences in an otherwise frustrating industry.

What does a work environment look like at Vouch?

Vouch is a Virtual First Workplace with San Francisco, Chicago, and New York City office locations. This role can be based anywhere in the U.S. as long as you can work our Vouch core collaboration hours (8:30 am-2:30 pm Pacific Time.) when most internal meetings are held.

A Bold Mission Made Possible By Design

At Vouch, we’re on a mission to revolutionize the insurance industry. Faced with the challenge of designing for complex products and discerning clients, particularly in the tech sector, we aim to blend exceptional service with digital efficiency. Our goal is not just to create a great product but to embed design thinking into our DNA, becoming a design-forward company.

The Role

As a UI/UX Designer, your work will be pivotal in shaping our client experience. You'll maintain our core design system, empower our design team, and create delightful user experiences that resonate with our clients. Your role is a blend of technical proficiency, creative design, and strategic collaboration.

Your Mandate


Own Our Design System & Component Library: Lead the design and enhancement of our design systems to meet diverse needs and in accordance with industry best practices and accessibility guidelines. Maintain and evolve our component library in collaboration with engineering and QA teams
Prototype & Test: Develop high-fidelity prototypes using tools like Figma and ProtoPie. Conduct usability testing for components and workflows, refining the user experience based on feedback.
Design Workflows & Features: Practice your “design thinking” by working with product managers to deliver impactful product features and improvements, ensuring alignment with user needs and enhancing the overall client experience.


About You


Professional Experience: 2-3 years in UI/UX design, with a portfolio demonstrating proficiency in design systems, prototyping, and user-centered design.
Technical Skills: Proficiency in design and prototyping tools (e.g. Figma, ProtoPie), as well as a strong understanding of HTML/CSS.
Collaborative Approach: Strong communication and teamwork skills, able to work effectively with cross-functional teams.
Problem-Solving Mindset: Adept at identifying user needs and translating them into practical and aesthetically pleasing design solutions.
**Your application will not be considered if you do not provide a portfolio/website


Vouch provides a number of benefits to help you bring your best self to work:


Competitive compensation and equity packages
Health, dental, and vision insurance
Parental leave
Flexible vacation time (Unlimited PTO)
Wellness allowance ($80/month)
Technology allowance ($100/month)


Salary Range

The pay range for this role is: $120,000 to $135,000 per year.

Our salary ranges are based on paying competitively for our size and industry and are one part of our total compensation package that also includes benefits and other perks. We also include stock options in all compensation packages and believe all Vouch employees should have the opportunity to become owners in the company. Individual pay decisions are based on a number of factors, including qualifications for the role, experience level, skill set, location, and business need. The base pay range provided is subject to change and may be modified in the future.

Vouch believes in putting our people first, and building a diverse team is at the front of everything we do. We welcome people from different backgrounds, experiences, perspectives, and ranges of abilities. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate the diversity of our growing team.

If you require reasonable accommodation in completing this application, interviewing, completing any pre-employment testing, or otherwise participating in the employee selection process, please direct your inquiries to recruiting@vouch.us.

A portfolio of UX-related work should be provided with the resume submission.

SUMMARY:

You will be responsible for researching, designing, innovating, and prototyping new user experiences that pave the way for the future of energy & vehicles in a way that has never been done before.
As a member of the UX Design organization, you will optimize and scale employee EHS&S processes globally, collaborating with EHS&S teams, designers, engineers, and global partners, and will be a key contributor and originator.




RESPONSIBILITIES:

Research and define the UX strategy; contribute to the overall product and design direction from concept to implementation.
Develop creative and innovative design solutions for internal tools and mobile app experiences that support multiple types of users in different types of roles with varying scope and objectives.
Constantly measure how designs are performing for target customers; iterate and improve those experiences as needed.
Work in a highly collaborative fashion with engineers and other partners; invest in building relationships and trust with stakeholders.
Presenting work to senior stakeholders regularly
Foster the defining and sharing of UX design standards and guidelines and consistency across team members.




QUALIFICATIONS:

Bachelors or master's degree in the study of design; portfolio that shows equivalent project experience or equivalent
4+ years of experience designing interactive applications for the web.
An excellent portfolio showcasing user experience, visual design, and UI work with a strong design sensibility and excellent, user-centric storytelling.
Excellent visual, UI, and interaction skills; ability to think through complex interaction design.
Customer-focused, with experience using design research methods to uncover customer insights.
Self-motivated, able to work independently but also collaborative and driven by group critique.

With 500 plus stores worldwide, and products available in more than 100 countries. The company is searching for UX Designer to join their team.We are searching for a UX Designer who will help drive consumer understanding through fact-based analyses and insights to strengthen our companies eCommerce business. Your work will raise the UX bar across multiple platforms and help define the shopping experience on the websites and native apps for one of the most iconic brands in the world. You will support the Product Management & UX Design teams to ensure the voice of consumers informs discovery, development, optimization, and analysis of digital and Omni channel experiences. You will initiate, plan, and execute research projects focusing on our products in Asia, the Middle East, and Australia (AMA). Your work will help us better understand our consumers and put their needs at the center of our design process.We are looking for another great team player ready to jump in and make an impact. As a UX Designer at Data Society, you will be responsible for working directly with customers to uncover their goals and transform them into usable, accessible, highly functional and delightful interactive experiences. You will work closely with product managers and our development team to create clickable wireframes, mockups, functional requirements and finished products. You should understand basic HTML and CSS, and while coding skills are not required, you should have a good understanding of how web technologies like single page React apps, component libraries, APIs, and Databases work and how to design with them in mind.

You should be comfortable working in an agile environment, and familiar with concepts like scrums, sprints, story refinement, and demo days.


Responsibilities
Lead discovery sessions for new projects and create user stories from them.
Create UX artifacts like personas and customer journeys.
Create low-fidelity clickable wireframes, present them to customers for feedback, and test them with representative future users.
Write functional requirements from your user stories and wireframes with product managers and developers.
Create high-fidelity clickable mockups, present them to customers for feedback, and test them with representative future users.
Work closely with the development team to answer design questions and create or change designs as needed. We operate on the principle that the fastest way to solve an engineering problem is often design, and the fastest way to solve a design problem is often engineering.

Skills you bring
You are very experienced with Figma. We use it for our design work.
You have some experience in Adobe products like Illustrator and Photoshop.
You are familiar with the difference between low and high fidelity designs.
You understand usability and how to create web products that are visually appealing but also intuitive.
You have significant experience with accessibility, and how to design for it. We strive for full 508 and WCAG compliance.
You have experience in responsive design, and how to create designs that work well at any screen size.
You can communicate professionally with customers and users while gathering requirements and testing designs.
You have at minimum a basic understanding of HTML and CSS, and how they are used to turn designs into web pages and applications.
Experience with JavaScript and React are considered strong pluses. This role isn’t required to write code, but knowing how your designs will be built is always helpful, as is being able to write or edit code yourself.
You will need to be able to open Visual Studio, pull the latest code from our repo, and run it locally so you can help check how your designers were implemented. Basic familiarity with how Git and branches work is a strong plus.

A portfolio or collection of past work is expected for this position. It can be shared privately if you don’t or can't share it on a live website.

The ideal candidate for this role is located within the Continental US and able to work on EST hours. This position is able to be fully remote for the right candidate. Current salary range is $90,000-$110,000 though we are open to negotiation. This position is eligible for full benefits including health, medical, dental, short and long-term disability, and life insurance, as well as our 401k, transit subsidy, unlimited PTO, and 15 paid holidays during 2024.

Guidehouse is a leading global provider of consulting services to the public sector and commercial markets, with broad capabilities in management, technology, and risk consulting. By combining our public and private sector expertise, we help clients address their most complex challenges and navigate significant regulatory pressures focusing on transformational change, business resiliency, and technology-driven innovation. Across a range of advisory, consulting, outsourcing, and digital services, we create scalable, innovative solutions that help our clients outwit complexity and position them for future growth and success.




The company has more than 13,000 professionals in over 50 locations globally. Guidehouse is a Veritas Capital portfolio company, led by seasoned professionals with proven and diverse expertise in traditional and emerging technologies, markets, and agenda-setting issues driving national and global economies. For more information, please visit guidehouse.com.







Job Family:

Digital Consulting




Travel Required:

None




Clearance Required:

Ability to Obtain Public Trust




What You Will Do:




Conduct user experience research (UX) (20%)

Define, lead, and manage workstreams as part of a larger engagement
Develop work products from start to finish (from brainstorming and framework development to final edits and end-product) based on client requirements
Lead user research, using quantitative and qualitative methods




Lead User Interface design, with a direct focus on designing websites and other digital products for a large federal client (50%)

Create and refine wireframes, mockups, and prototypes
Lead usability testing through interviews, surveys, card sorting, and other techniques
Understand and communicate user accessibility concepts and best practices
Utilize style guides and components to design multiple iterations of potential webpages and other digital designs for client input and collaboration
Develop impactful visualizations, presentations, and client briefs




Support Client Engagement & Consulting Activities (20%)

Provide consultative input and guidance for both design-related and non-design-related topics by learning about client specific subject matter and applying it to work
Participate in requirements elicitation and elaboration, providing an experience design point of view and recommendations
Develop trusted relationships with clients
Develop communications for internal and external client stakeholders
Provide weekly status updates on project progress to project manager and/or client




Support team and firm growth (10%)

Support business development activities, including creating marketing collateral, writing and reviewing proposals, and participating in sales meetings as subject matter experts (SME)
Write thought leadership, including white papers and research briefs on a variety of topics
Present solutions to both internal and external stakeholders to build individual network and increase opportunities to grow business by expanding capabilities for specific practice areas
Exemplify Professionalism & Teamwork
Understand firm capabilities and solutions
Lead with quality, including creating high quality work products and deliverables
Provide guidance and feedback to team members




What You Will Need:

Bachelor’s degree (4 year college degree)
4+ years of direct user experience/user interface design experience (UX/UI) with a strong, publicly available design portfolio
Strong, demonstrable experience conducting design work with the Federal Government or experience working with commercial clients in a highly regulated industry such as Health Care, Financial Services, Life Sciences, or Energy/Utilities
Knowledge of design concepts, including journey mapping, interviewing, and digital design
Experience developing presentations, creating storyboards, managing project plans, conducting research, and making recommendations for process improvement
Demonstrate flexibility in prioritizing and completing tasks
Advanced Experience with user interface design & prototyping software, such as Figma, Mural, and InVision
Professional Skills: Demonstrated critical thinking, attention to detail, comfort with ambiguity and unstructured situations, and strong communication skills
US Citizenship
Ability to obtain a minimum of Public trust security clearance
Ability to travel up to 20%, if required as part of client engagement




What Would Be Nice To Have:

Experience working on technical or software development projects and/or experience in a consulting environment.
Experience with Jira and requirements management
Professional Certifications in User Experience Design, Human Centered Design, or Design Thinking
Certified Scrum Master (CSM) or other Agile certifications (PMP, PMI-ACP, SAFe)




The annual salary range for this position is $77,500.00-$125,000.00. Compensation decisions depend on a wide range of factors, including but not limited to skill sets, experience and training, security clearances, licensure and certifications, and other business and organizational needs.




What We Offer:

Guidehouse offers a comprehensive, total rewards package that includes competitive compensation and a flexible benefits package that reflects our commitment to creating a diverse and supportive workplace.

Benefits include:

Medical, Rx, Dental & Vision Insurance
Personal and Family Sick Time & Company Paid Holidays
Parental Leave
401(k) Retirement Plan
Group Term Life and Travel Assistance
Voluntary Life and AD&D Insurance
Health Savings Account, Health Care & Dependent Care Flexible Spending Accounts
Transit and Parking Commuter Benefits
Short-Term & Long-Term Disability
Tuition Reimbursement, Personal Development, Certifications & Learning Opportunities
Employee Referral Program
Corporate Sponsored Events & Community Outreach
Care.com annual membership
Employee Assistance Program
Supplemental Benefits via Corestream (Critical Care, Hospital Indemnity, Accident Insurance, Legal Assistance and ID theft protection, etc.)
Position may be eligible for a discretionary variable incentive bonus

Rhombus Power is purposefully transforming defense and global security enterprises with Guardian, our Artificial Intelligence platform for strategic, operational, and tactical decision-making at the speed of relevance.

We provide relevant, actionable, and AI-powered insights at each step in the defense decision-making cycle. Equipped with Guardian's AI-powered tools-- from infrastructure to data to insights -- our clients are able to solve their most complex, interconnected challenges and achieve decision and operational superiority.

Come join our cross-disciplinary and world-class team that is delivering game-changing solutions to transform global security.

Learn more about Rhombus and watch a demonstration of Guardian, our AI Platform here -- https://youtube.com/watch?v=3PxY6su1Q-Q

See the following articles to learn more about what we do:

https://foreignpolicy.com/2023/06/19/ai-artificial-intelligence-national-security-foreign-policy-threats-prediction/

https://federalnewsnetwork.com/air-force/2023/12/new-decision-advantage-tool-will-change-how-air-force-makes-investment-decisions/

Location

Palo Alto, California or Washington, DC

Job Description

Rhombus Power seeks a highly motivated UI/UX Designer to join our fast-growing team, delivering complex enterprise solutions.

We're looking for colleagues that are intrinsically motivated to create polished user interfaces and interactions, positive experiences, and have a growth mindset. We want someone who's looking to figure out that 'Ok, but what's next?' portion of a problem, anticipating and proactively responding to the entirety of the UI/UX process.

You're motivated to understand user needs and behaviors and use that to drive product design and identify areas for improvement. You'll be creating, reviewing, and iterating on wireframes, prototypes, and pixel-perfect designs and helping build out our design system!

You can expect to work with customer stakeholders, product, engineering, and leadership teams on existing, and future products that are changing the way US policy decisions are being made. Learn more about Rhombus and watch a demonstration of Guardian, our cutting edge AI Platform here, with additional insights here

The position requires US Citizenship and ability to obtain/maintain a Government Security clearance. It will be based in either Washington, DC (Right on the Yellow Line), or at our HQ in Palo Alto, California.

Responsibilities


Creation of storyboards, wireframes, user journeys, mockups and prototypes to communicate and validate designs
Conduct research and communicate with stakeholders and clients to deeply understand their goals and challenges
Clearly and confidently present design concepts and key milestone deliverables to internal teams and key stakeholders
Identify opportunities for design and process improvements and drive their implementation
Work on multiple projects with varying levels of UX engagement, time to complete, and expectations
Help develop guidance/documentation for dev handoff and design specifications and components to ensure a cohesive design language
Be engaged in helping develop team process and practices


Qualifications


3+ years of work experience in UI/UX Designer
Strong and diverse portfolio showcasing UX and design skills. We're looking for someone with an eye for design!
Fluency in best practices for HCD and usability principles and techniques.

Job Title: UX/UI Designer

Client Location: Remote

Starting: 03/18/2024




Salary/Pay Rate: $53.52 to $59.47 an hour

Firm, non-negotiable: No

Duration: 1 year




Job Description:

Picture yourself building a successful career working alongside other talented, highly motivated individuals committed to reaching our client's goal of becoming the world’s leading insurance provider. They believe that their success depends on building a world-class team.

The UI Designer is aligned with their internal IT team to support their clients. The position collaborates with product owners and the UX/UI team to design innovative user interfaces for their client accounts. The position will work in a collaborative team environment, with independent duties. The Designer will understand business requirements and deliver user interface designs with an intuitive user experience.

As an influencer, people come to the Designer as a “go-to” source for help and support because of their deep knowledge and expertise. As a more experienced team member, they are capable of driving continual improvement and impacting the way that things get done. Because of their influence, whether direct or indirect, they can deliver powerful outcomes for their clients.

Responsibilities;

• Work with a team to design user interfaces.

• Work with product owners and business analysts to understand business requirements.

• Create clean, visually consistent designs that follow user-centered design principles and practices.

• Create UI design deliverables: Sitemaps, user flows, wireframes, lo-fi and hi-fi layouts, and prototypes.

• Manage design libraries and design systems with adherence to product and client branding requirements.

• Follow usability and accessibility standards.

• Perform UAT, cross-platform and accessibility testing

• Work closely with IT leadership, peers, and business clients to create the best possible business solution including ways to improve software and business processes.

• Manage multiple deliverables until conclusion.

Experience:

• Bachelor’s Degree or professional training, in UI Design, Web Design, Graphic Design or a related field is preferred.

• 5 years of experience with web and application design.

• Experience in an enterprise-level employer

• Excellent understanding of responsive design and grid principles.

• Strong typography, layout, and visual design skills.

• Working knowledge of industry tools: Sketch, XD, Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, InVision.

• Previous experience with user-centered design principles and practices, web/mobile standards, typography and color, and web/mobile usability and accessibility standards.

• Experience with cross-platform and accessibility testing.

• Ability to work with designers and developers to implement new ideas.

• Proactive, independent working style.

• Working knowledge of HTML, JavaScript, and CSS.

• Experience creating rapid prototypes.

• Experience with digital analytics to assess the impact of all UI design and usability changes

• Experience with user research, interviews, surveys, and usability studies, translating findings into wireframes and prototypes

• Experience with copywriting

• Knowledge of tag management and analytics

The target hiring compensation range for this role is the equivalent of $53.52 to $59.47 an hour. Compensation is based on several factors including, but not limited to education, relevant work experience, relevant certifications, and location.
