Aquent Talent connects the best talent in marketing, creative, and design with the world's biggest brands.

Our eligible talent get access to amazing benefits like subsidized health, vision, and dental plans, paid sick leave, and retirement plans with a match. We also offer free online training through Aquent Gymnasium. More information on our awesome benefits!

We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics. We're about creating an inclusive environment—one where different backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives are valued, and everyone can contribute, grow their careers, and thrive.

Job Title: UI/UX Designer | UI/UX Consultant

Rate: $100 per hour

Employment Type: 3 temporary resources needed, possibility of temp-to-hire

Duration: 6-week engagement, December 2023 – January 2024

Location: Hybrid role with requirement to be onsite Tuesdays and Wednesdays in Columbus, OH or Merrillville, IN. Must be local to either location.

Scope Of Services

The UI/UX Designers/Consultants will help the company’s products work with greater efficiency and effectiveness. They will identify and troubleshoot UX problems by meeting with key stakeholders, including frontline workers. They will gather user requirements by conducting ride-alongs, focus groups, stakeholder interviews, and collaborating with people in the field who are utilizing the tech. The UI/UX Consultants will compile a comprehensive UX/UI assessment to determine the alignment of existing solutions with key metrics, identify any issues, and prioritize key indicators for improvement. The Consultants will then present stakeholders with a list of needed improvements and an implementation strategy that is tailored to the business and that solves all the necessary problems. Thereby, the company can accelerate the development of innovative solutions.

Role, Responsibilities, And Deliverables


Conduct several sessions of product analysis
Identify and troubleshoot UX problems (e.g. responsiveness)
Understand what users want from their device, gather user requirements
Conduct a comprehensive UX/UI assessment to determine the alignment of existing solutions with key metrics, identify any issues, and prioritize key indicators for improvement
Develop UI mockups and prototypes that clearly illustrate how tech should function
Gather and evaluate user requirements in collaboration with product managers and engineers
Suggest layout adjustments based on user feedback
Provide guidance on the implementation of UX research methodologies, testing activities, and predict user behavior
Present stakeholders with a list of needed improvements and an implementation strategy that is tailored to the business and that solves all the necessary problems.
Provide design guideline standard to ensure good UX is achieved across digital products


Qualifications


Proven work experience as a UI/UX Designer or similar role
Portfolio of design projects
Knowledge of wireframe tools (e.g. Wireframe.cc and InVision)
Up-to-date knowledge of design software like Adobe Illustrator and Photoshop
Team spirit; strong communication skills to collaborate with various stakeholders
Good time-management skills
BSc in UI/UX Design, Computer Science or related degree


To apply, please submit a resume outlining your relevant experience as a UI/UX Designer/Consultant. Short-listed candidates will be expected to complete a Blue Star Partners Bio.

Title : UX Designer

Location : Santa Clara, CA 95054 Hybrid (4-days in office weekly is required (no exceptions)

Duration : Initial 3 months but possibility of extension and conversion to full time depending on performance and team fit.

USC or GCH candidates only




Researching and understanding user needs and behaviors through methods such as user interviews, surveys, and analytics data
Creating user personas and user flows to identify key user journeys and pain points. Create mind maps, user flows
Understand front-end development process and limitations (basic knowledge of HTML/CSS/JS is a plus)
Understand, apply and promote our design thinking and design system
Collaborating with stakeholders, such as Product Managers and Developers, to create design concepts and prototypes that align with business goals and technical constraints
Conducting usability testing and gathering feedback from users to refine and iterate on designs based on research
Creating detailed design specifications and documentation for Developers to implement
Continuously iterating on designs and testing new features to improve the user experience
Creating hi-fidelity and low fidelity designs for multiple platforms such as mobile, web
Creating a prototype for user testing and validation.




Education

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Fine Arts, Graphic Design, Product Management, Engineering, or a related field, or the equivalent. If no bachelors degree, will accept 10+ years of experience




Experience:

6-8 years of experience
Must be proficient in visual design and Figma.
Have experience with enterprise SaaS products.
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Fine Arts, Graphic Design, Product Management, Engineering, or a related field, or the equivalent and 6-8 years of experience. If no bachelors degree, will accept 10+ years of experience
Understand cloud-native app development (DevOps, Agile Methodology, microservices, cloud platforms, containers like Kubernetes and Docker, CI/CD)
Plan own tasks considering collaboration with the team
Willingness to iterate, learn, and improve based on feedback
Share knowledge with other team members and help to improve design maturity.
Support written and verbal communication in order to plan further work, explain and document ideas
Industries: Technology, Information and Media, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Software Development

Job_description:
Rhombus Power is purposefully transforming defense and global security enterprises with Guardian, our Artificial Intelligence platform for strategic, operational, and tactical decision-making at the speed of relevance.

We provide relevant, actionable, and AI-powered insights at each step in the defense decision-making cycle. Equipped with Guardian's AI-powered tools-- from infrastructure to data to insights -- our clients are able to solve their most complex, interconnected challenges and achieve decision and operational superiority.

Come join our cross-disciplinary and world-class team that is delivering game-changing solutions to transform global security.

Learn more about Rhombus and watch a demonstration of Guardian, our AI Platform here -- https://youtube.com/watch?v=3PxY6su1Q-Q

See the following articles to learn more about what we do:

https://foreignpolicy.com/2023/06/19/ai-artificial-intelligence-national-security-foreign-policy-threats-prediction/

https://federalnewsnetwork.com/air-force/2023/12/new-decision-advantage-tool-will-change-how-air-force-makes-investment-decisions/

Location

Palo Alto, California or Washington, DC

Job Description

Rhombus Power seeks a highly motivated UI/UX Designer to join our fast-growing team, delivering complex enterprise solutions.

We're looking for colleagues that are intrinsically motivated to create polished user interfaces and interactions, positive experiences, and have a growth mindset. We want someone who's looking to figure out that 'Ok, but what's next?' portion of a problem, anticipating and proactively responding to the entirety of the UI/UX process.

You're motivated to understand user needs and behaviors and use that to drive product design and identify areas for improvement. You'll be creating, reviewing, and iterating on wireframes, prototypes, and pixel-perfect designs and helping build out our design system!

You can expect to work with customer stakeholders, product, engineering, and leadership teams on existing, and future products that are changing the way US policy decisions are being made. Learn more about Rhombus and watch a demonstration of Guardian, our cutting edge AI Platform here, with additional insights here

The position requires US Citizenship and ability to obtain/maintain a Government Security clearance. It will be based in either Washington, DC (Right on the Yellow Line), or at our HQ in Palo Alto, California.

Responsibilities


Creation of storyboards, wireframes, user journeys, mockups and prototypes to communicate and validate designs
Conduct research and communicate with stakeholders and clients to deeply understand their goals and challenges
Clearly and confidently present design concepts and key milestone deliverables to internal teams and key stakeholders
Identify opportunities for design and process improvements and drive their implementation
Work on multiple projects with varying levels of UX engagement, time to complete, and expectations
Help develop guidance/documentation for dev handoff and design specifications and components to ensure a cohesive design language
Be engaged in helping develop team process and practices


Qualifications


3+ years of work experience in UI/UX Designer
Strong and diverse portfolio showcasing UX and design skills. We're looking for someone with an eye for design!
Fluency in best practices for HCD and usability principles and techniques.
Expertise in xD, and/or Sketch to create high-fidelity mock-ups and prototypes
Experience creating prototypes or wireframes for complex web applications, workflows, and data visualizations
Strong time-management skills and ability to self-manage effectively in a remote environment
An eye for detail and a high bar for quality
Familiarity with HTML, CSS and responsive design
US Citizenship, and the ability to obtain a Security Clearance


Nice To Have


Relevant degree Design, HCD, HCI or similar
Illustration or Drawing skills - Can you make custom icons?
Familiarity with graphing libraries like Highcharts
Advanced Figma skills - Variables/Tokens, conditionals etc
Functional experience with web front-end technologies such as HTML/CSS, Bootstrap, Leaflet, React
Experience with Storybook


Benefits


Full medical, dental, vision coverage for employee and dependents
401k matching program
PTO and Holidays
Bonus and other incentive programs
Access to mental health program
Access to Flexible Spending Accounts for Health Care, Dependent and Commuter

Rhombus Power Inc. (Rhombus) is a startup located in the heart of Silicon Valley at Stanford Research Park in Palo Alto.  We use cutting-edge cross-disciplinary approaches to solve pressing Big Data and Sensing problems in security, energy, and healthcare. Our advisory board includes two Nobel Laureates and a Draper Prize winner.

Rhombus compensates, motivates, and develops employees, who are trusted, empowered, and involved. Employees have clear roles and expectations – and their roles are flexible enough to move at the speed of innovation in order to meet and exceed client expectations. We have a unique culture of global purpose, rooted in the innovation and progress of Silicon Valley.

Rhombus knows that diversity is a condition for success. We are committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.

This candidate will be responsible for building a clean and effective user experience for our customers. By working cross-functionally, this candidate will understand needs from the product management, engineering, and business stakeholders and will be able to build solutions that fit those needs.




Responsibilities




Ensure that established design standards are consistently and appropriately applied within design work
Engage with product management, engineering, business stakeholders, and third-party vendors to understand project
Develop and present documentation, user flows, annotated wireframes, and interactive prototypes
Leverage user testing make product improvements

4+ years' of experience in UX design
Proficient in visual design and wireframing tools




Pay Range: $65-85




The specific compensation for this position will be determined by a number of factors, including the scope, complexity and location of the role as well as the cost of labor in the market; the skills, education, training, credentials and experience of the candidate; and other conditions of employment.

Job Title: Senior UX Researcher

Location: Atlanta, GA

Type: Contract (potential to extend/convert)




Position Overview:

We are seeking a highly skilled Senior UX Researcher to join our team at the world's leading distributor of automotive and industrial replacement parts and value-added services. In this role, you will lead research efforts for one or more products, working closely with a talented team to design products for the largest automotive and industrial replacement parts distribution companies in the world.




Responsibilities:

Lead the development and execution of user research programs, ensuring actionable insights are provided with both user needs and business objectives in mind.
Plan, conduct, and synthesize qualitative and quantitative user research, including usability testing, contextual inquiries, surveys, interviews, and competitive analysis.
Collaborate with Product/UX/UI designers, product managers, and engineers to translate research data into innovative design solutions.
Develop and maintain personas, journey maps, behaviors, and workflow analyses.
Advocate for the user throughout the product development process, ensuring that user needs are considered at every stage.
Communicate research findings and insights to stakeholders in a clear and impactful way.
Foster a culture of test and learn, establishing best practices and methodologies for user research.




Qualifications:

Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Human-Computer Interaction, Cognitive Psychology, Human Factors, Anthropology, or related field.
Minimum of 5 years of experience in UX Research, preferably in a senior role.
Proficient in UX research tools and software.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to articulate user needs, pain points, and behaviors effectively.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data and translate it into actionable recommendations.
Demonstrated experience working in cross-functional teams and collaborating effectively with stakeholders.
Experience working in design for ecommerce, retail, and/or supply chain is desirable.
Experience working with Agile/Scrum development teams is preferred.
A strong portfolio demonstrating past work experience and deliverables is required.
Industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Manufacturing, and Consumer Services

Job_description:
About Twine

We're a thriving ecosystem of top-tier freelancers from around the world. Trusted by Fortune 500 companies and Silicon Valley startups, Twine is the go-to platform for mission-critical projects. Twine's experts get to participate in generating quality datasets at an unprecedented scale. With over half a million registered freelancers and a growing roster of 35,000+ companies, we've become the comprehensive solution for freelancing.

Our Mission

At Twine, we recognise that companies require a flexible approach to hiring expert freelancers for their most critical projects. Traditional freelance platforms often fall short when it comes to scalability and diversity. That's where we shine. Twine operates as a thriving global freelance network, with diverse experts across various fields, including marketing, engineering, and AI. Our core mission is to empower creators, whether they're businesses or individual freelancers, to thrive in their creative endeavours.

About The Role

We are seeking an UI/UX Designer for a global full-service information technology and engineering services provider. The UI/UX Designer will be responsible for,

Developing and maintaining design wireframes and specifications

Collaborating with the product team to incorporate brand identity

Communicating screen designs and end-to-end experiences

Designing web-based applications

Staying current with industry trends

Developing Information Architecture, prototyping quickly, and acting on feedback.

Requirements

6+ years of experience in designing web-based applications focusing on the human-computer interface element

Proficiency in Figma or Envision

Knowledge of ISP and understanding of UI code at a high level

Familiarity with accessibility standards and their application in designs

Experience working in a fast-paced environment in a large organization

Who You Are:

Moxe is searching for a UI/UX Designer with 3 to 5 years of user interface design experience. The ideal candidate enjoys building intuitive experiences that help customers fulfill their day to day workflows with ease. We value people who are not only skilled designers but also those who can work really well with others on the team to bring those ideas to the forefront of the healthcare market. This role will report to the Director of Product.

What You'll Do: The UI/UX Designer will work hand in hand with developers, product managers, and the customer experience team to define problems and ship solutions together as one team.


Guide and own the development of the user interface, components, and visuals of our product lines
Develop and maintain guidelines for Moxe’s design system
Collaborate with the Product and Engineering teams to understand the goals and roadmap for Moxe’s products
Facilitate designs solutions from inception to a production to produce valuable user experiences for all our users
Rapidly produce multiple concepts and prototypes, knowing when to apply pixel-perfect attention to detail, and when to make low fidelity sketches and prototypes
Conduct user research, and usability testing to gather quantitative and qualitative customer data to make informed product and design decisions


What You'll Bring:


3-5 years of user interface design experience preferred
A portfolio showcasing refined visual, user interface, and experience design work
Experience with Figma, Adobe Suite, and/or other design software for prototyping and asset creation
Excellent collaboration and communication skills for working with Product and Engineering teams to make product visions come to life
Strong self-management, organizational and critical thinking skills
Welcomes feedback and critique
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a related field or equivalent experience


Ideally:


Healthcare delivery or Healthcare IT experience
SaaS software solutions experience
HTML/CSS/JS knowledge
What We Offer:
Unlimited PTO
Medical, Dental, Vison
Day 1 of employment
Company paid life insurance
Flex-scheduling
$500 yearly investment into you

Who We Are:

High quality, affordable healthcare is a basic human right and at Moxe, we are committed to making it a reality. We’re on a mission to slash billions from healthcare costs. It’s no secret that the US healthcare system is rife with inefficiencies and unnecessary costs. While the rest of us have migrated to interconnected, digital platforms, healthcare still uses paper, pdfs, snail mail and fax to transmit information.

We know there is a better way to deliver healthcare. Data exchange today consists of mailing or faxing paper files and pdf'ing endless records from existing Electronic Medical records. It can take months to process and compile those records into usable data. Job Title: UX Researcher

Work Location

Tampa, FL




Job Description:




Responsibilities

Can work closely with senior stakeholders, product managers and engineering teams to brainstorm and co-create ideas, approaches, and solutions
Can plan and execute a wide variety of research including user interviews, co-creation, journey mapping, usability and concept tests and surveys, ensuring that actionable results are delivered and shared.
Present and communicate research results and recommendations to stakeholder teams and the larger organization when needed.
Collaborate and share research findings and insights across the organization
Can help define relevant metrics for benchmarking and measurement of journeys
Integrate research insights with quantitative data to inform deep understanding of client journeys as well as data-driven prioritization
Apply a positive and constructive attitude to all feedback.
Create wireframes, prototypes, and high-fidelity designs using Figma, along with our established Design System
Ensure that designs follow best practices and use research & testing to inform and validate
Confidently challenge the status quo, encouraging all involved to address root causes to ensure the best outcome for users
Apply a positive and constructive attitude when giving and receiving all feedback
Deliver high-quality design assets to the engineering team, along with clear guidance to ensure all aspects of the designs are fully understood.
Provide ongoing support to engineering, with regular UX review checkpoints to ensure quality and that the system is being built as designed
Keep up to date with the latest UX practices, innovations, and tools
Ensure all designs comply with ADA/WCAG standards for accessibility
Deliver on time, identifying and managing risks to ensure timelines are met, and escalating where needed
Lead by example, supporting, training and developing junior members of the team.
Keep up to date with the latest UX practices, innovations, and tools.
Participate in the wider UX community of practice.



Required Skills, Experience and Competencies

10-12 years of relevant UX Research or UX Architect experience
Strong attention to detail, analytical skills and problem-solving
Hands-on experience leading qualitative and quantitative UX research in a product design environment across the Design Thinking approach.
Experience leading and conducting generative and evaluative user research
Ability to lead workshops relating to UX Research both in-person and/or remote
Creative problem solver comfortable dealing with uncertainty
Experience on complex, enterprise-scale or consumer design projects
Self-starter with the ability to define goals and strategies
Able to combine strategic thinking with pragmatism without sacrificing quality
Proactive and positive attitude, with strong attention to detail & analytical skills
Outstanding written and oral communication skills
Significant experience working with senior stakeholders and engineers
Familiarity with research tools e.g UserZoom, UserTesting.com, Dovetail, EnjoyHQ, Qualtrics
Bachelor’s/University degree
Excellent written and oral communication skills




Desirable Skills, Experience and Competencies

Experience with agile methodology
Financial services industry and commercial banking experience
Master’s degree

Job Summary:

UX Designer with a strong background in UI/UX Design and user research to

Works with the product owner(s), customers and scrum team(s) to enhance our customer experience. In this role, you should be an analytical and creative designer who is able to grasp user needs and solve problems. A strong portfolio of successful UX and other technical projects is essential. Ultimately, you will make the product more user-friendly and intuitive to attract and retain customers.




Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

The essential functions include, but are not limited to:

1. Strong UI/UX design skills showcasing problem solving techniques focused on the customer

2. Expertise in design software such as Figma, Figjam, and Miro.

3. Deep understanding of user-centered design principles and practices.

4. Strong understanding of usability principles, journey mapping techniques, information architecture, and interaction design.

5. Experience in conducting user research and usability testing to support evidence-focused design decisions.

6. Excellent communication skills to articulate design decisions and process.

7. Define and execute a customer centric strategy to focus on the customer experience through user research

8. Strong journey mapping experience.

9. Developing wireframes and task flows based on user needs

10. Collaborating with Designers and Developers to create intuitive, user-friendly software

11. Understand product specifications and user psychology

12. Conduct concept and usability testing and gather feedback

13. Create personas through user research and data

14. Define the right interaction model and evaluate its success

15. Work with existing UI Developer to create wireframes and prototypes around customer needs

16. Find creative ways to solve UX problems (e.g. usability, findability)

17. Ability to lead and manage a team




Basic Qualifications:

1. Bachelor’s degree in Business or other relevant discipline such as UX Design, Human-Computer Interaction, Design Thinking, or a related discipline.

2. 10+ years of proven experience as a UX Designer responsible for Design and UX Research and advocating for customer experience

3. 3 – 5 years of user research and usability testing




Other Qualifications:

1. Strong Interpersonal and consultative skills – Seeks understanding, excellent listener

2. Strong presentation and communication skills

3. Ability to collaborate across product, engineering, marketing and key stakeholders

4. Detail-oriented and able to deliver at an elevated level of accuracy

5. Experience working with agile development methodologies.

6. Strong portfolio showcasing web application projects, detailing your role and process

7. Strong portfolio of design projects

8. Proven expertise in creating designs that work seamlessly across multiple devices and screen sizes

9. Background in project management and research

10. Familiarity with interaction design and information architecture

11. Proficient in design software (e.g. Figma)

12. Some knowledge of HTML/CSS; JavaScript/React is a plus

13. Problem-solving aptitude

14. Analytical mind with a business acumen

15. Effective communication skills and the ability to articulate design decisions and thought processes

Description

We’re looking for a collaborative and empathetic UX Design intern who is a creative problem solver! As a UX Design Intern, you'll work with the UX team, product managers, and engineers to create work that has a direct impact on the company's success. You will be paired with an experienced mentor who wants to help you develop your career.

This is an onsite paid role located in Rogers, Arkansas. Remote candidates will not be considered.

Key Responsibilities

You will participate in all stages of the product development process from conception through release, including:


Collaborating with stakeholders to define problems and goals, map user flows, and brainstorm solutions
Creating wireframes, hifis, and prototypes that meet product requirements, customer wants, and technical feasibility
Contributing to SupplyPike’s design language and system
Iterating on product usability through UX research, usability testing, and user feedback


Skills Knowledge and Expertise


Pursuing a bachelor's degree or equivalent professional work experience.
Strong understanding of typography, iconography, and user flows
Familiar with prototyping tools such as Figma (that’s what we use), Sketch, Illustrator, InVision, or similar
Strong communication skills and proficiency in design
Excellent problem-solving abilities, intellectual curiosity, and eagerness to learn
Can work independently and collaboratively across multidisciplinary teams
Basic understanding of design systems, HTML/CSS, and UI frameworks a plus
Availability to work 35 hours per week during the summer


Culture Code

Why intern at SupplyPike?


You will play a huge part in solving the problems of your assigned team
You will be treated as part of the team where your opinions, ideas, and suggestions are heard
You will get direct face-to-face time with the leadership team
You will have many opportunities to showcase your leadership, presentation, and communication skills
You will learn about the hard skills and soft skills needed to build your career path
Check out this video from our past interns!


SupplyPike Culture (more here)

SupplyPike is Great Place To Work™ certified and is recognized as Arkansas’ Best Places To Work. We pride ourselves on creating an open, transparent, and collaborative work environment. The SupplyPike company pillars are:


Curiosity: We advocate for our employees to explore new concepts, enhance their knowledge, and better themselves.
Collaboration: We encourage cross-team collaboration and interdisciplinary skills.
Agility: We embrace the concept of fast iterative development.
Integrity: Our work culture is all about ownership and agency where we can reflect upon mistakes and learn from them.
Empathy: We strive for a welcoming and considerate environment where we take a “no blame” approach.
Determination: We embody an unwavering commitment to achieving ambitious goals and overcoming challenges.
Play: We set aside time for social clubs, events, team outings, and lunches.


SupplyPike Benefits

All SupplyPike employees are critical to our success, and our compensation philosophy is aimed to attract and reward top talent responsibly. We believe in competitive pay, directly linking compensation to performance, ensuring fairness, and being transparent about our approach. In addition to competitive salaries, our full-time employees enjoy a comprehensive benefits package, including medical, dental, and vision coverage, a 401K match program, and flexible paid time off. We foster a culture of continuous growth and development, with compensation structured to reflect increasing skills and responsibilities over time.

About SupplyPike

SupplyPike is on a mission to change the lives of suppliers by giving them amazing tools to change the way they work. But that won’t happen without awesome people like you joining our team!

Founded in Fayetteville, Ark. in 2018, SupplyPike is a diverse group of smart, caring, and driven people that want to make a dent in the world. We strive to treat each other as human beings, and that means creating an inclusive environment where everyone can be themselves and freely contribute ideas, express dissent, and share experiences that will help us grow as people and as a company.

About Northwest Arkansas

Beautiful NWA, nestled in the lush Ozark Mountains, consistently ranks in the Top 5 U.S. News best places to live in the U.S (2021, 2020, 2019) for its quality of life and cost of living and the Top 10 in job growth (Forbes). In addition to being the home to two Fortune 100 and three Fortune 500 companies, Northwest Arkansas also has a strong entrepreneurial community with a growing number of startup companies.

In this position, you will join a collaborative team of world-class designers and be able to learn and grow from the experience.

The ideal candidate must be able to demonstrate Design Thinking while developing detail level work flows, assist in design and execution of research studies, and acquiring user insights based on studies and research.

Position Responsibilities


Assist in the design and execution of research studies from concept generation through product release, including planning studies, moderating study sessions, writing reports, creating video highlights and presenting results.

Work effectively with designers, program managers, and hardware and software engineers in a highly collaborative environment.
Support design validation and iteration through an iterative research process


Required Skills

Passionate about user-centered design for web and mobile experiences
An individual that is organized, detail-oriented, and results-driven
Open communicator with excellent visual, verbal and written communication skills

Description

JOB DESCRIPTION

Duties: Conceptualize, structure, and detail user experiences within the context of a broader user journey. Collaborate with product managers and engineers, involved in prioritization, planning, and decisions along the way to execution. Design products across mobile and web that target specific customer values as well as business goals. Create screen mock-ups, user flows and prototypes to communicate and learn about designs. Create design documentation for the development of customer and employee facing products. Participate in design critiques and peer reviews. Collaborate with product managers, executive and legal, risk, and compliance stakeholders to realize the designs.

Qualifications

Minimum education and experience required: Master’s degree in Design and Technology, Interdisciplinary Visual Arts, Interaction Design, Human Computer Interface, User Experience Design, or related field of study plus 2 years of experience in the job offered or as User Experience Designer, Product Manager, or related occupation. The employer will alternatively accept a Bachelor’s degree in Design and Technology, Interdisciplinary Visual Arts, Interaction Design, Human Computer Interface, User Experience Design, or related field of study plus 4 years of experience in the job offered or as User Experience Designer, Product Manager, or related occupation.

Skills Required: Requires experience in the following: Designing native mobile and web experiences; Interaction Design; Visual/UI Design or Information Architecture; User Research; UX Writing; Prototyping; Collaborating with design teams, including other designers, UX researchers, and content designers, and cross-functionally with product managers and software engineers; and presenting work to cross-functional Directors.

Job Location: 450 West 33rd Street, New York, NY 10001. Telecommuting permitted up to 40% of the week.

Salary: $124,800.00-$165,000.00 per year.

About Us

Chase is a leading financial services firm, helping nearly half of America’s households and small businesses achieve their financial goals through a broad range of financial products. Our mission is to create engaged, lifelong relationships and put our customers at the heart of everything we do. We also help small businesses, nonprofits and cities grow, delivering solutions to solve all their financial needs.

We offer a competitive total rewards package including base salary determined based on the role, experience, skill set, and location. For those in eligible roles, discretionary incentive compensation which may be awarded in recognition of individual achievements and contributions. We also offer a range of benefits and programs to meet employee needs, based on eligibility. These benefits include comprehensive health care coverage, on-site health and wellness centers, a retirement savings plan, backup childcare, tuition reimbursement, mental health support, financial coaching and more. Additional details about total compensation and benefits will be provided during the hiring process.

We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. We also make reasonable accommodations for applicants’ and employees’ religious practices and beliefs, as well as mental health or physical disability needs. Visit our FAQs for more information about requesting an accommodation.

Equal Opportunity Employer/Disability/Veterans

About The Team

Our Consumer & Community Banking division serves our Chase customers through a range of financial services, including personal banking, credit cards, mortgages, auto financing, investment advice, small business loans and payment processing. We’re proud to lead the U.S. in credit card sales and deposit growth and have the most-used digital solutions – all while ranking first in customer satisfaction.

WHO WE ARE




We’re a passionate team of hardworking people who enjoy what we do. At Hannon Hill, we build and support content management and digital personalization tools that make it easy for non-technical users to build sophisticated websites that deliver powerful user experiences. 




Our flagship product, Cascade CMS, empowers users to create, edit, and share digital content across sites and channels. Clive is an engagement and real-time personalization tool for collecting visitor attributes and delivering relevant content.




We’re on strong financial footing with over 21 years of organic growth, and continue to maintain our reputation as the #1 commercial content management system for higher education.




POSITION SUMMARY

You’ll work primarily on the web interfaces of our core products—Cascade CMS and Clive—as well as any new products we create. Clive’s user interface is based on a component design system built in React and maintained in Figma. Cascade CMS’s design is more ad-hoc though we’re moving towards more component-based design everywhere. We have the beginnings of a Design System already in place in Figma.




We work in 6-8 week product cycles and often release new functionality weekly for both products. During a cycle, you might be working on 3-4 different projects with different members of the Product team with additional reviews of others’ work throughout.




Here are some projects we’ve worked on recently:

Redesigned a Form builder in our product, Clive, that allows users to create and publish their own web forms from a selection of fields, and reorder and customize them.
Built a new report in Cascade CMS that allows users to see summaries of in-progress and completed Workflows in the product and take action directly from the report.
Assessed our products for WCAG 2 AA accessibility and made changes to visual components to make them more accessible.
Designed an Integrations interface to allow our product Clive to connect with third-party systems and create data mapping between them.
Prototyped many new features as clickable prototypes to solicit feedback from stakeholders and customers before building them. Sometimes a simple pen and paper sketch will be enough. And sometimes a more high-fidelity design will be needed.




ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Work daily with Engineers to conceptualize, design, and build product experiences.
Create Designs of different fidelities for different needs. 
Maintain and improve an existing Design System managed in Figma to create consistent product experiences and brand identity across products
Conduct design and UX reviews of work by Engineers, Product team members and other Designers
Work closely with UX-focused Engineers on large-scale improvements to product UX over time
Apply the “Jobs to be Done” product philosophy to help us identify customers’ core needs and devise solutions in collaboration with the Product team.
Conduct user research and tests to help identify new opportunities and the best solution to customer needs.
Brainstorm ideas for design-led product functionality and other business initiatives.
Follow industry trends and best practices in Product design and apply them where appropriate.
Provide Design support to other departments. This will include creating compelling visuals for presentations and proposals and improving the design of our own web properties.
Write microcopy for our products, write project comments and project proposals designed to persuade team members to adopt ideas, and write design critiques of people’s work.




KNOWLEDGE AND SKILL

Excellent written communication skills across a variety of mediums and contexts (Slack, Github, and Figma) are required. 
Ability to work asynchronously while maintaining team productivity. 
Comfortable writing basic HTML/CSS (and perhaps some Javascript!). 
Excellent reading comprehension across a variety of different mediums.
Ability to keep up with multiple conversation threads in Slack, email, Github, and Figma and respond in a timely manner. 
Prior experience building or working in a component-based Design System is preferred.
Experience with user research and testing methods and product discovery processes are a plus.




PHYSICAL DEMANDS

Sitting for long periods of time
Frequent use of computers and standard office equipment
Lift and/or carry up to 30 pounds




WORK ENVIRONMENT




This job operates in a casual, but professional hybrid office environment. This position frequently utilizes standard office equipment such as computers, phones, printers, and scanners.

Are you a UX Designer local to Brooklyn, NY and able to work onsite 3 days a week? Do you enjoy taming complexity for users through thoughtful design planning and execution?

Our client, a global financial services company, is looking for a UX Designer to join their team (40 hours a week for 6 months, likely extending and potentially converting to full-time), hybrid, onsite in Brooklyn three days a week (Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Fridays). The office is easily commutable, modern and has impressive amenities!

The UX Designer will participate in the full range of design practice, from upfront research, insights, and strategy, through to ideation, prototyping, and testing, and to delivery of final designs.

Responsibilities


Lead a team in the design and re-design of product experiences across our the product line offerings
Contribute to product vision, roadmap, requirements, and project plans with Product Managers and Engineers
Participate in upfront user research to better understand user needs and behaviors, and usability testing to see how your solutions work for users, with the support and guidance of Experience Researchers
Communicate expectations within the design team for standards of quality through establishing a vision, providing creative direction, and conducting critique
Diagram overarching structure of omnichannel product experience, with detailed UI design of key interactions, including potential updates to the Design System
Present work and articulate strategy and design decisions to leadership
Partner with small multi-disciplinary teams, including Experience Designers, Experience Researchers and Content


Qualifications


Advanced skills in Interaction Design, Visual/UI Design, and Information Architecture; Intermediate ability in adjacent skills such as User Research, UX Writing, and Prototyping
Prior work involves collaboration within design teams (with other designers, UX researchers, and content designers) and cross-functionally with product managers and software engineers
Degree in relevant design discipline (e.g., Interaction Design, Human Computer Interface, User Experience Design), certification from credible bootcamp or similar accelerated learning program, or equivalent work experience
Can direct self and others in both planning and structuring the work, and executing on expected levels of quality
Able to show how your understanding of technical constraints and opportunities informed your design solutions
Prior work shows how you used an understanding of business value and product strategy to lead to successful design outcomes
Comfortable and confident when presenting work to executives
Advocate for Accessibility Guidelines and Inclusive Design practices
Experience leading design work on successful digital products, demonstrating user- and human-centered design approaches is preferred
Familiar with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, frameworks such as React, and mobile UI standards is preferred

Knowledge/SkillsSolid grasp of web design principles and a good understanding of front-end web technologies requiredExcellent understanding of user experience design for the Web, mobile, and touch devices requiredAbility to coordinate, prioritize, and accomplish multiple tasks in a fast-paced atmosphere with minimal supervision requiredExperience in writing detailed design specifications (IA, work flow, page functionality and layout, etc.), which technology developers use to build the product requiredMust be a self-starter that can create schedules and define scope of work even when there are no clear requirements and direction requiredStrong ability to communicate your design, defend your design decisions, and respond quickly to business needs requiredProven ability to set the design direction for your projects and to collaborate with other designers working in the space required A team player who can easily adapt in a rapidly changing environment requiredExperience5+ years professional UX design experience required8+ years professional UX design experience preferredOtherMust be legally authorized to work in the United States for any employer without sponsorshipSuccessful completion of interview required to meet job qualificationsReliable, punctual attendance is an essential function of the position

The application window will be open until at least March 13, 2024. This opportunity will remain online based on business needs which may be before or after the specified date.

Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: Boulder, CO, USA; Cambridge, MA, USA; New York, NY, USA; Redwood City, CA, USA; Sunnyvale, CA, USA; Seattle, WA, USA.Minimum qualifications:


Bachelor's degree in Design, Human-Computer Interaction, Computer Science, a related field, or equivalent practical experience.
4 years of experience in product design or UX.
Experience designing across multiple platforms, and working with technical/design teams to create user flows, wireframes, and building user interface mockups and prototypes.
Portfolio highlighting multiple projects and your direct contributions.


Preferred qualifications:


Master's degree in Design, Human-Computer Interaction, Computer Science, a related field, or equivalent practical experience.
2 years of experience working in a complex, cross-functional organization.
1 year of experience leading design projects.
Problem-solving skills and familiarity with technical constraints and limitations as they apply to designing for platforms such as desktop and mobile (Android and iOS).
Ability to lead and ideate products from scratch and improve features within a user-centered design process.
Skills in communicating and influencing product design strategy.


About The Job

At Google, we follow a simple but vital premise: "Focus on the user and all else will follow." Google’s Interaction Designers take complex tasks and make them intuitive and easy-to-use for billions of people around the globe. Throughout the design process—from creating user flows and wireframes to building user interface mockups and prototypes—you’ll envision how people will experience our products, and bring that vision to life in a way that feels inspired, refined, and even magical.

Google User Experience (UX) is made up of multi-disciplinary teams of UX Designers, Researchers, Writers, Content Strategists, Program Managers, and Engineers: we care deeply about the people who use our products. The UX team plays an integral part in gathering insights about the attitudes, emotions, and behaviors of people who use our products to inspire and inform design. We collaborate closely with each other and with engineering and product management to create industry-leading products that deliver value for the people who use them, and for Google’s businesses.

As an Interaction Designer, you’ll rely on user-centered design methods to craft industry-leading user experiences—from concept to execution. Like all of our UX jobs, you’ll collaborate with your design partners to leverage and evolve the Google design language to build beautiful, innovative, inspired products that people love to use.

Google Cloud accelerates every organization’s ability to digitally transform its business and industry. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology, and tools that help developers build more sustainably. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.

The US base salary range for this full-time position is $118,000-$172,000 + bonus + equity + benefits. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location. The range displayed on each job posting reflects the minimum and maximum target for new hire salaries for the position across all US locations. Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range for your preferred location during the hiring process.

Please note that the compensation details listed in US role postings reflect the base salary only, and do not include bonus, equity, or benefits. Learn more about benefits at Google .

Responsibilities


Collaborate with product managers, engineers, and cross-functional stakeholders to understand requirements, and provide creative, thoughtful solutions.
Communicate the user experience at various stages of the design process with wireframes, flow diagrams, storyboards, mockups, and/or high fidelity prototypes.
Integrate user feedback and business requirements into ongoing product experience updates.
Advocate for the prioritization of design centered changes, refinements, and improvements.



Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .
Industries: Information Services and Technology, Information and Internet

Job_description:
WHO WE AREIf you ask us, we’re the perfect mix of athletes, entrepreneurs, engineers, and creatives. Our diverse backgrounds and shared values are what help make Hydrow great. Our mission is not just to create an amazing fitness experience, but a beautiful human experience - one that’s honest, inclusive, and positive.. Hydrow is the Live Outdoor Reality (LOR)™ rowing machine that delivers on-water experiences at home with workouts led by world-class athletes. At Hydrow, you’ll have the chance to shape a company that is disrupting the fitness industry while creating engaging content unmatched in the marketplace today. Sound exciting? That’s because it is!We are looking for a Designer

to be a part of the Hydrow Digital marketing & ecommerce team. We’re looking for a self-starter to come join our team at the ground floor. The ideal candidate is someone with strong communication skills who will drive and own the process of executing and creating content based on learnings and input from analytics, the executive team, and other stakeholders. If you’re looking for a job with huge potential for growth at a rapidly growing company, we’d love to hear from you.WHAT YOU’LL DO

Hydrow.com

UI/UX design & optimizationLanding page design & optimizationHydrow ecommerce design & optimizationDesigner focused on end to end customer experience for

hydrow.comPartner with product, analytics and engineering to create a robust roadmap reflective of customer experiences and features that will make shopping

an enjoyable & seamless experiencePartner with product, analytics and engineering for A/B testing & overall experimentation across

Customer centric designer who loves turning creative ideas into solutions for customer problems5-7 years experience with ecommerce design experienceExperience with A/B testing & Experimentation in ecommerceExperiment driving some user testing & research to build confidence in design patternsExpertise in producing relevant deliverables including competitive audits, detailed site maps, user flows, page flows, wireframes, prototypes, etc.Strong communication skills & ability to listenComfort with (and even a need for) data driven decision makingAbility working with agencies and 3rd party partnersExperience with digital marketing campaign creation and optimizationExperience with software like Figma, Invision, etcPhotoshop & Illustrator expertiseMobile first web-design philosophyBONUS POINTS IF YOU HAVE

Design DirectorHOW WE WORKAuthentic And Inclusive

Familiarity with tools like Amplitude, Shopify, Contentful & Storybook.HTML / CSS experienceExperience designing advertising creativeExperience with mockup software like invisionExperience creating wireframesExperience with After Effects or any video editing software/experience with animation workREPORTS TO:

We Embrace Each And Every One Of Our Differences And Celebrate Our Diversity. We Commit To Fostering a Space Where Everyone Belongs And Is Heard.Nimble With Purpose

We are a fleet of speedy boats, instead of a barge. As pathfinders of positive change, we adapt our focus with ease when our purpose points us in a new directionResilient Teammates:

We support our Hydrow teammates and members through challenges: technical, personal, or unexpected waves. We overcome the present obstacle and persevere together.Hydrow is a community of innovators, risk-takers, and trailblazers who celebrate individual differences and recognize that unique perspectives make us stronger, smarter, and more successful. Hydrow actively seeks applicants who can bring a variety of experiences, perspectives, and backgrounds to the team. Hydrow provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, ancestry, national origin, gender, sex, pregnancy, pregnancy-related condition, sexual orientation, marital status, religion, age, disability, qualified handicap, gender identity, results of genetic testing, military status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.Our team values diversity in experience and backgrounds—we do our best work when we create space for different voices and perspectives. Whatever unique experiences or skill sets you bring, we look forward to learning from each other.BENEFITS AND PERKS (Full Time Permanent Hydrownauts)???? Job_description:
Who We Are

Pixel Vault is a media group focused on elevating crypto-native assets across a variety of mediums through the development of intellectual property, as we build alongside the community. Through blockchain gaming, comics, and other mediums, our team uses storytelling to bring life to on-chain digital assets for the benefit of stakeholders and the broader crypto community — and we have fun doing it!

Position Overview

We are seeking a highly skilled Game UI/UX Designer to join our Gaming team and contribute to a variety of gaming projects at Pixel Vault. The ideal candidate will have at least 2 years of experience in the gaming industry and, ideally, 5+ years of experience in an intermediate or senior position in UI/UX game design.

As a Game UI/UX Designer, you will play a crucial role in crafting intuitive, visually appealing, and user-centric interfaces for our games. You will collaborate with multidisciplinary teams to create engaging user experiences that enhance gameplay and connect players with our gaming products.

You will report directly to the Technical Art Director - Gaming, and collaborate with other team members to design and help implement user interfaces, resulting in high quality content for the web3 market and beyond.

General Responsibilities


Design high-quality user interfaces for games, ensuring a seamless and intuitive user experience
Collaborate closely with producers and game designers to understand project requirements and translate them into functional and visually captivating UI designs/solutions, focusing on ‘how they work’ as much as ‘how they’ll look’
Work alongside artists and developers to ensure implementation matches the design specification and help unblock design related issues where needed
Create wireframes, prototypes, and mockups to effectively communicate interaction and design ideas
Conduct user testing and gather feedback to iterate on designs and improve usability
Work on various platforms and devices to adapt designs and ensure a consistent user experience across different interfaces
Stay updated on industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in UI/UX design, incorporating them into our game development process


Qualifications


5+ years as an intermediate/senior UI/UX designer in the gaming industry
Proficiency in design tools such as Figma, Sketch, and the Adobe Creative Suite
Strong understanding of user-centered design principles and methodologies
Knowledge of current trends in gaming and familiarity with different gaming platforms
Excellent communication and collaboration skills to work effectively within multidisciplinary teams in a remote working environment
A strong portfolio showcasing UI/UX design work, demonstrating a range of design styles and successful projects
Self-starting and highly motivated to make high quality gaming products


Required Experience


Proven UI/UX design expertise, evidenced by at least one published game title or advanced personal game project, utilizing Unity as the development platform
Demonstrated skill in graphic design, including proficiency in motion design and animations for interactive UI components
Familiarity with Unity and other game development platforms
Some understanding of front-end development technologies (HTML, CSS, etc.)
Preference will be given to candidates who have a broad interest and engagement in various genres of games, such as collectible card games, 2d games, strategy games, and brawler/fighting games


LOCATION

This position is fully remote. US-based and international candidates are welcome to apply.

The compensation for this role is structured with a base annual salary ranging between $115K - 130K USD. The actual annual salary paid for this position will be based on several factors, including but not limited to, skills, prior experiences, training, company needs, and current market demands.

What We Offer


100% remote
Localized comprehensive health benefits
Unlimited Discretionary Time Off
Paid leave for new parents to support work/life balance
Stipends for Wellness, Home Office, Professional Development, Crypto/Blockchain Conferences


Pixel Vault is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome applications from all qualified individuals without regard to race, religion, creed, color, gender, sexual orientation, age, disability, or nationality. In addition, Pixel Vault acknowledges that the tech industry lacks opportunities for those in underrepresented demographics. This is Praveen Kumar from Info Way Solutions; LLC We have job opening for a UI/UX Designer and the detailed Job description is given below:

Role: UI/UX Designer

Location: Denver (Remote OK)

Jd

Role Responsibilities


In this role, you'll take the time to understand the business aspects of the products we build and collaborate with leaders of other UX, Engineering, and Product Management teams to create innovative experiences across all Western Union products, leveraging your passion for brand, craft, and design quality.
In a fast-paced, collaborative environment, you'll work on all aspects of UX design including information architecture, interaction, motion, visual, and prototyping. You'll drive design from early-stage conceptual design through launch.
Work with executive leadership, product management teams and engineering team across WU portfolios and partner closely with other teams to define experience strategies and create user journeys, conceptual wireframes, high-fidelity mockups, functional prototypes on a project-basis
Going deep on consumer insights, product analytics, and competitive intelligence to identify unseen opportunities, and drive product & experience innovation.
Create and rapidly iterate ideas in order to develop them, via storyboards, user flows, mock-ups, motion designs, and prototypes, or other Client methods.
Responsible for creating, evaluating, and modifying prototypes to evangelize product vision to stakeholders and leadership.


Role Requirements


5+ years of experience designing complex consumer facing digital products and experiences (preferably cross platform web, mobile, point of sale UX) in a global context.
Proficiency in using contemporary design tools to solve complex problems and communicate in visually stunning detail.
Experience designing, guiding, and implementing formal and informal usability studies.
Ability to zoom out and see the bigger picture, while zooming in to rationalize and perfect the nuanced details.
Bachelor's degree in design, HCI, or related field or equivalent professional experience.
Nice to have: Experience in Fintech consumer products.

Sr. UX Designer

Fortune 17 Retail Client

100% Remote




As a Sr. UX Designer for our Fortune 17 Retail client, you will help successfully translate business objectives and customer needs into innovative and best-in-class, customer-centric solutions. For this project, you will own the customer experience component for their main e-commerce website.




Responsibilities:

Responsible for delivering the vision, experience, and creative strategy for your respective projects and products.
Lead the design strategy and execution for a functional or product area
Creating product prototypes, mockups, site maps, process flows, and journey maps
Conducting usability testing, competitor and customer analysis
Analyzing user feedback and activity, and iterating to enhance the user experience
Consulting with stakeholders to understand their goals and explaining research results Consulting with development teams
Build strong relationships with product management peers, development, and other critical partners to establish and deliver on the business and customer requirements that enhance digital experiences and products, meets the business goals and strengthens the company’s differentiation strategies.
You will do research, competitive analysis, design sprints, lean UX, and formal testing.




Qualifications:

5+ years of relevant work experience in UX Design
Demonstrated user experience design skills with expert knowledge of current design programs
Mastery of all the latest design tools, and versions of applicable software programs: Sketch, InVision, and Axure
Exposure to Journey mapping, Empathy mapping, and Affinity mapping
Understanding of the capabilities and limitations of HTML, DHTML, CSS, JavaScript
Understanding of browser display differences on different platforms (web and mobile)




Preferred Qualifications:

Previous project leadership experience in a retail environment or advertising agency
Exposure to UX design of an e-commerce website




What we’re looking for:

An ideal candidate will have a portfolio of artifacts showing their understanding of the UX process. Design is a process of research, learning, testing and iteration and you can show how that leads to a final deliverable.
You are highly collaborative; leaning on your team and peers for constructive feedback and not afraid to share your feedback.
You bring a design-thinking mentality and passion for doing the right thing for the user to solve their problems and ease their friction points.

At Echo, we foster a culture that promotes continuous learning, innovation, and personal development. Apply today and grow with Echo!

Echo Global Logistics is a top provider of technology-enabled solutions and supply chain management. Our solutions simplify transportation management for our clients by handling the crucial tasks. From coast to coast, dock to dock, and across all major transportation modes, Echo connects businesses to the carriers who transport their goods quickly, securely, and cost-effectively.

Crain's Business recently ranked Echo as a Top 25 Tech Employer in Chicago. We’ve also been recognized as the top 3PL provider. We’re seeking passionate, driven and imaginative minds to join our team and help carry out our mission of providing our clients with best in class service and technology!

Position Overview

Echo Global Logistics is looking for a UX Designer with experience in enterprise design, design systems, user research, low-fidelity prototyping and high-fidelity UI designs. You will report to the Staff UX Designer while collaborating with all members of the product and user experience team. The role will be focused on helping to build and advance our internal transportation management tool and external customer portal. Our proprietary software was created to simplify transportation management for our clients. You will help support the architectural vision of quality, scalability, performance and function. You will help build a world class technology platform.

Responsibilities


Collaborate with Product Owners, Product Managers, and business stakeholders to define feature requirements
Create workflows, wireframes, prototypes and high-fidelity designs
Work closely with front end developers and QA engineers to bring product to production
Work with business stakeholders and internal users to test product features, understand user needs
Collaborate with fellow UX Designers and Front-End Engineers on establishing and maintaining design system components
Be an engaged member of the UX Design team, working to improve our output across our internal and external products


Position Requirements


2+ years of professional experience as a UX Designer on a Product Team
Expert at industry standard design tools (Figma and Zeplin)
Excellent oral and written communication skills, comfortable leading conversations with senior leadership across the organization
A portfolio that displays strong visual design aesthetic, expertise at developing design concepts, and strong writing skills
Experience working across screen sizes and an understanding of the principles of responsive design and the 8 pt grid
Familiarity with Agile development methodologies is a plus
Experience in logistics industry is a plus


All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, status as a qualified individual with a disability, or Vietnam era or other protected veteran.
