GROW WITH US:

Tandem Diabetes Care creates new possibilities for people living with diabetes, their loved ones, and their healthcare providers through a positively different experience. We’d love for you to team up with us to “innovate every day,” put “people first,” and take a “no-shortcuts” approach that has propelled us to become a leader in the diabetes technology industry.

STAY AWESOME:

Tandem Diabetes Care is proud to manufacture and sell the t:slim X2 insulin pump with Control-IQ technology. We’re also so much more than that. Our company’s human-centered approach to design, development, and support delivers innovative products and services for people who use insulin. Since many of our own team members live with type 1 diabetes, or have a loved one impacted by diabetes, the work is personal, and we are committed to the cause. Learn more at tandemdiabetes.com.

A DAY IN THE LIFE:

The UX Designer II will contribute to the consumer-oriented GUI of Tandem’s medical devices and applications by generating inspired, innovative, elegant, and highly usable interaction design solutions and defining user experiences for new products and features.


Contributes to the design of innovative end-user interfaces focusing on designs that are clean, clear, effective, and pleasing to the eye.
Works within the team to document specifications that engineering will reference to implement for final end-user interface design.
Develops and refines design concepts and produce prototypes for evaluation (visual wireframes, task flows, design screenshots, or interactive prototypes).
Takes design concepts and works towards completion of development phases under general supervision.
Participates in concept development as part of an interdisciplinary team including product development, advanced technology, marketing research, user experience research, and quality assurance.
Collaborates with peers and stakeholders to communicate design direction and refine the user interface and experience.


YOU’RE AWESOME AT:


Knowledge of UX/UI design principles, design systems, best practices, and standards
Ability to communicate design ideas to stakeholders through concepts, workflows, and prototypes to collect feedback to iterate and improve designs.
Strong visual design skills with familiarity with selecting color palettes and designing screen layouts and typography.
Proficiency in information layout and visual design principles.
Proven ability to design products that benefit consumers by being both pleasurable and easy to use.
A solid grasp of graphic, web, and software design principles as well as the limitations associated with these environments.
An excellent eye for design detail.
Competent in UX software such as Sketch, Figma, or Adobe XD.
Experience in animation software such as Principle, LottieFiles or After Effects a plus.
Strong aptitude for taking input from multiple sources and for synthesizing it into coherent designs.
Ability to move easily between conceptual and detail design activities and translate business goals into intuitive designs.


WHAT YOU'LL NEED:


Applicants must be authorized to work for any employer in the U.S. We are unable to sponsor or take over sponsorship of an employment Visa at this time.
BA in Interaction Design or related fine arts/graphic design field preferred or equivalent combination of education and applicable job experience.
4 years of experience in combination of the following:
Consumer-oriented user design interfaces for mobile devices, web applications, and/or desktop software
Commercial UX/UI design, marketing, and website design and development.

WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU?

In addition to innovative technology, we have a culture that fosters the idea that the happiest people are the most productive people. Not only do we hire forward-thinking achievers to join our workforce; we reward, develop, and retain them too. Just one of the many reasons of how we #StayAwesome! To learn more about our culture and benefits please visit https://www.tandemdiabetes.com/careers.

BE YOU, WITH US!

Tandem is firmly committed to being an equal opportunity employer and maintaining a diverse and inclusive environment. We value and embrace that every single one of us brings value to the table. But sometimes we forget that when we don’t meet 100% of a job description’s criteria – maybe you’re feeling that way right now? We encourage you to apply anyway. Because we want you to be you, with us.

COMPENSATION & BENEFITS:

The starting base pay range for this position is $96 - $115K annually. Base pay will vary based on job-related knowledge, skills, experience and may also fluctuate depending on candidate’s location and the overall job market. In addition to base pay, Tandem offers a competitive compensation package that includes bonus, equity, and a robust benefits package.

Tandem offers health care benefits such as medical, dental, vision, health savings accounts and flexible saving accounts. You’ll also receive 11 paid holidays per year, a minimum of 20 days of paid time off (accural starts on day 1) and have access to a 401k plan with company match. Learn more about Tandem’s benefits here!

YOU SHOULD KNOW:

Potential new employees must successfully complete a drug screen (excludes marijuana) and background check which includes criminal search, education certification and employment verification prior to hire.

If you are applying for this job and live in California, please read Tandem’s CCPA Notice: https://www.tandemdiabetes.com/careers/california-consumer-privacy-act-notice-for-job-applicants.

APPLICATION DEADLINE: March 14th, 2024

REFERRALS:

We love a good referral! If you know someone that would be a great fit for this position, please share!

Sertifi is a self funded, leading technology company dedicated to helping businesses finalize business faster, providing a complete agreements platform for the Hospitality and Travel industry.  Brands like Marriott, Topgolf, and AEG Worldwide trust Sertifi to efficiently and securely sign documents, exchange card authorizations, and complete payments with their customers.   Sertifi's easy-to-use platform helps tens of thousands of businesses in more than 135 countries, with more than $5 billion in payment requests sent through the system annually.  With decades of experience in Hospitality and Travel, Sertifi is building a network that gives guests and travelers across the globe a great experience from the start.

We are looking for a talented UX Designer to join our Product Team.  You will be focused on designing the user interfaces for new products, features, and experiences for our customers. This position will work closely with Product Managers, Marketing, Development, and Executive Leadership to define the vision for a data and user feedback driven Sertifi user experience.

Our ideal candidate will have an analytical mindset and a proven track record of establishing the tools and processes to ensure correct decisions are made in every case to improve the user experience.

This position will report to our Director of Product.

Candidates must be based in the United States, in Chicago, or within a Sertifi approved state for remote work:

OR, AZ, CO, ID, SD, WI, IL, IN, IA, MI, MO, TX, FL, GA, NC, VA, MD, PA, NJ, MA, NH, ME

Challenges You'll Tackle:

Design the user interface for in app, or other interactive media to ensure easy-to-use interface and experience.
Provide data points and insights while collaborating with product managers and engineers on UI and UX decisions.
Gather requirements from all sources before designing ideas that can be communicated using storyboards.
Provide process flows or sitemaps.
Research and become familiar with customers, competitors, and industry products.
Participate in developing user personas, scenarios, and user stories.
Create prototypes, mock-ups, and wireframes.
Proactively review UI delivery of new features and enhancements to ensure they meet the designed expectations.
Establish usability testing protocols and ensure inclusion into QA cycles.
Actively contribute to develop brand standards and guidelines with Marketing to ensure consistency between our products, web presence and marketing materials.
Collaborate with Marketing on updates to brand standards within the product to ensure alignment with the overall Sertifi brand.
Facilitate usability processes including A/B testing, customer feedback sessions, and pilot discoveries to measure the success of our experience.
Proactively build relationships with user communities and engage in user experience discussions.
Data tracking over time, (click counts, processing time, hot spots, bail outs, etc.) comparative to baselines as enhancements and features are deployed.
Collect Pattern Recognition data to help improve user experience.
Influence accessibility standards.
Mapping out where users spend the most time.
Mentor other junior members of the team, to include Designers but also ensure processes are being followed throughout the delivery teams.

What You'll Need to Succeed:

8-15+ years of experience working on large scale web applications
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, or related field
UX Design tools
Usability testing experience
Prototyping and Wireframing tools
Graphic design tools
Ability to demonstrate UX design principles.

Physical Requirements:

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. While performing the duties of this Job, the employee is regularly required to sit; use hands to type, use computer, phone, cell phone and other office/home office equipment/technology. Must be able speak, see and hear. Must be able to remain in a stationary position for prolonged periods of time.

What’s in it for you:

You will work in a collaborative environment that welcomes new ideas and allows you to make an immediate impact on the team.  You can also expect to have dedicated heads down time to code along with time set aside each month on Innovation Ideas.  Additionally, we offer great benefits such as:  Competitive salary, Unlimited PTO, medical/dental/vision insurance, short-term and long-term disability insurance, 401k with company match, paid parental leave, life insurance, pre-tax Transit Benefit Program.

Sertifi is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. Sertifi is committed to building a diverse team of talented individuals who bring different perspectives to the business and who feel a sense of inclusion and belonging when they join our team. All individuals seeking employment at Sertifi are considered without regards to race, ethnicity, color, age, sex, religion, national origin, ancestry, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, physical or mental disability, registered domestic partner status, caregiver status, marital status, veteran or military status, citizenship status, or any other basis forbidden under federal, state, or local law.

Sertifi is a self funded, leading technology company dedicated to helping businesses finalize business faster, providing a complete agreements platform for the Hospitality and Travel industry.  Brands like Marriott, Topgolf, and AEG Worldwide trust Sertifi to efficiently and securely sign documents, exchange card authorizations, and complete payments with their customers.   Sertifi's easy-to-use platform helps tens of thousands of businesses in more than 135 countries, with more than $5 billion in payment requests sent through the system annually.  With decades of experience in Hospitality and Travel, Sertifi is building a network that gives guests and travelers across the globe a great experience from the start.We are looking for a talented UX Designer to join our Product Team.  You will be focused on designing the user interfaces for new products, features, and experiences for our customers. This position will work closely with Product Managers, Marketing, Development, and Executive Leadership to define the vision for a data and user feedback driven Sertifi user experience.Our ideal candidate will have an analytical mindset and a proven track record of establishing the tools and processes to ensure correct decisions are made in every case to improve the user experience.This position will report to our Director of Product.Candidates must be based in the United States, in Chicago, or within a Sertifi approved state for remote work:OR, AZ, CO, ID, SD, WI, IL, IN, IA, MI, MO, TX, FL, GA, NC, VA, MD, PA, NJ, MA, NH, MEChallenges You'll Tackle:Design the user interface for in app, or other interactive media to ensure easy-to-use interface and experience.Provide data points and insights while collaborating with product managers and engineers on UI and UX decisions.Gather requirements from all sources before designing ideas that can be communicated using storyboards.Provide process flows or sitemaps.Research and become familiar with customers, competitors, and industry products.Participate in developing user personas, scenarios, and user stories.Create prototypes, mock-ups, and wireframes.Proactively review UI delivery of new features and enhancements to ensure they meet the designed expectations.Establish usability testing protocols and ensure inclusion into QA cycles.Actively contribute to develop brand standards and guidelines with Marketing to ensure consistency between our products, web presence and marketing materials.Collaborate with Marketing on updates to brand standards within the product to ensure alignment with the overall Sertifi brand.Facilitate usability processes including A/B testing, customer feedback sessions, and pilot discoveries to measure the success of our experience.Proactively build relationships with user communities and engage in user experience discussions.Data tracking over time, (click counts, processing time, hot spots, bail outs, etc.) comparative to baselines as enhancements and features are deployed.Collect Pattern Recognition data to help improve user experience.Influence accessibility standards.Mapping out where users spend the most time.Mentor other junior members of the team, to include Designers but also ensure processes are being followed throughout the delivery teams.What You'll Need to Succeed:8-15+ years of experience working on large scale web applicationsBachelor's Degree in Computer Science, or related fieldUX Design toolsUsability testing experiencePrototyping and Wireframing toolsGraphic design toolsAbility to demonstrate UX design principles.Physical Requirements:The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. While performing the duties of this Job, the employee is regularly required to sit; use hands to type, use computer, phone, cell phone and other office/home office equipment/technology. Must be able speak, see and hear. Must be able to remain in a stationary position for prolonged periods of time.What’s in it for you:You will work in a collaborative environment that welcomes new ideas and allows you to make an immediate impact on the team.  You can also expect to have dedicated heads down time to code along with time set aside each month on Innovation Ideas.  Additionally, we offer great benefits such as:  Competitive salary, Unlimited PTO, medical/dental/vision insurance, short-term and long-term disability insurance, 401k with company match, paid parental leave, life insurance, pre-tax Transit Benefit Program.Sertifi is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. Our industry leading eCommerce client is expanding their User Interface Design team and seeking a UI Designer I. This position will be a contract for 6 months, that could be extended or converted at that point. Work collaboratively within a cross-functional team on global projects.




This position is 100% onsite, Monday - Friday.




Education: Bachelor’s degree in relevant field of study or equivalent years of related work experience required




Experience:2+ years of digital design experience preferred




Skills:

Self-motivated and able to work in a fast-paced environment while adhering to strict deadlines
Professional demeanor, effective listener, clear presenter and succinct writer
Ability to analyze, articulate, and solve complex problems and concepts to make effective business decisions
Strong interpersonal, written, verbal communication and presentation skills, with the ability to interface effectively with individuals at various levels, both internally and externally
Ability to effectively prioritize workload in a frequently changing environment while remaining detailed and organized
Working knowledge of design software (e.g. Adobe Creative Suite) and proficient in word processing software
Working knowledge of HTML/CSS and familiar with use of a content management system




Responsibilities:

Actively design layouts and comps in collaboration with the merchant and marketing teams to create innovative designs and compelling stories in line with each season’s inspiration and campaign.
Enhance customer site experiences and app experiences using existing templates and help explore new templates throughout the seasons.
Translate business and marketing objectives into designs that are clear, compelling, visually exciting, easy to use and engaging.
Actively communicate with cross-functional partners to understand the strategy and deliverables, and articulate creative thinking behind the aesthetic and design decisions.
Ensure consistent creative across all digital channels.
Research current trends in retail and related product categories.
Understand the learnings from previous campaigns and continue to evolve designs.
Ensure the level of excellence in all creative with a keen eye for typography, graphic design, illustration, photography, and accessibility.
Digital production as needed




Physical Requirements & Attendance:

Acceptable level of hearing and vision to perform job duties
Adhere to company work hours, policies, procedures, and rules governing professional staff behavior
Regular attendance required
Industries: Online and Mail Order Retail and Retail

Job_title: UX Researcher @ Chicago, IL - 12 Months with EXT - Remote Role
Job_description:
Remote role ( Local to Chicago Highly preferred )

Flight NOC operations project




Position: UX Researcher

Location: Chicago, IL

Duration: 12 Months with EXT




The UX Researcher will be an integral part of the United UX design team with a focus on conducting design research to inform the design process from discovery to wireframes to visual design. In this role, the UX Researcher will lead efforts to develop and execute research plans, and methodologies and report findings to inform design development. At the core, this position will transform unmet user needs and business opportunities into successful product launches through user research throughout different design phases. The UX Researcher will work to create a best-in-class user experience for United’s frontline employees, helping transform unmet user needs and business opportunities into successful employee tools.

The ideal candidate has a passion for user-centered research and design and has a wide breadth of experience across multiple types of products, channels, and research methodologies.

- Extensive knowledge of usability and user experience research tools and techniques (e.g. field research, heuristic reviews, benchmarking, card sorts, lo-fidelity prototyping methods, etc.)

- Strong project management and negotiating skills are central to the position.

- Strong communication, critical thinking, and creative problem-solving skills required.

- Ability to communicate research results, graphically depict data and justify methods and approaches—orally and in writing

- Strong moderation skills and methods for group facilitation and consensus-building

- Ability to work independently, in a team, and with or without direction is imperative.

- 5+ years of usability research experience with multifaceted responsibilities. (client prefers a mix of web and mobile experience).

- Related experience in another field such as human factors, interactive design, information architecture, and/or market research is a plus.

- Experience designing wireframes and creating interactive prototypes using related tools such as Axure, JustinMind, Invision, Figma, and Sketch.

- Experience creating user personas and journey maps to support a user-centered design methodology.

- Strong understanding of user interface design practices and principles a must—better still if you can demonstrate experience relating to research.

Position: User Experience (UX) Designer (MUST be a US Citizen)




MUST be a US Citizen




Security Requirement: Active Treasury Public Trust Clearance Preferred




This program requires a Minimum Background Investigation (MBI) clearance. Selected candidate shall not start work until authorization and first day logistics are provided by the Program.




Location: Remote/ Virtual Continental U.S (Hours: East Coast Time Zone) and Washington, DC




Description/Responsibilities




Role responsibilities include:




Collaborate with development teams to identify ideas and drive towards solutions
Analyze the client needs and requirements to provide related insight
Proactively accomplish User Experience Designer tasks, including but not limited to the creation of wireframes
Use human-centered design, Agile, and Pega practices to support elaboration and configuration as a voice advocating for the customer
Plan and conduct user interviews for requirements gathering and collaborate with team members on findings and recommendations
Support testing and future deployments by iteratively reviewing new organization functionalities with user groups
Independently conduct discussion on Pega design, functionality, and structure
Lead meetings to discuss and present wireframes, collect client feedback, and iteratively improve designs
Support business process design activities including describing and visualizing business expectations, objectives, user roles, and responsibilities

User Experience (UX) Designer




Length: 3mo+




GDECA is seeking a passionate User Experience (UX) Designer to join our team delivering a robust Satellite Analytics PowerBI dashboard solution. The engagement can be completed remotely.




Responsibilities:

· Work with consulting and client teams to understand various user groups

· Gather UX requirements and conceptualize dashboard design

· Design dashboard mockups to portray the correct look and feel for front-line to executive users

· Work with teams to enhance and/or customize design based on business unit-specific requirements and feedback




Requirements:

· 3-5 years experience in User Experience (UX) dashboard design

· Experience working in a highly matrixed, enterprise environment

· Passion for ux design for technology-centric initiatives

· Experience designing mockups for PowerBI in an enterprise environment

Job_title: UI/UX Designer (Axure & Figma) -- Dallas, TX, Onsite
Job_description:
Job Title: UI/UX Designer (Axure & Figma)

Location: Dallas, TX – Onsite

Duration: 6+ Months Contract

Job Description


We are seeking a talented UI/UX Designer to join our team in Dallas, TX. The ideal candidate will have a passion for creating intuitive and visually appealing user interfaces, along with a strong understanding of user experience principles. Proficiency in Axure and Figma is required for this role.


Responsibilities


Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand project requirements and user needs.
Design wireframes, prototypes, and user interfaces using Axure and Figma.
Conduct user research and gather feedback to iteratively improve designs.
Ensure consistency and adherence to design standards throughout the development process.
Communicate design concepts and rationale effectively to stakeholders.


Qualifications


Bachelor's degree in Design, Human-Computer Interaction, or related field.
Proven experience as a UI/UX Designer with a portfolio showcasing relevant work.
Proficiency in Axure RP for wireframing and prototyping.
Experience with Figma for designing and collaborating on UI/UX projects.
Strong understanding of user-centered design principles and best practices.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.


Preferred Skills


Knowledge of front-end development technologies (HTML, CSS, JavaScript) is a plus.
Experience working in an Agile development environment.
Familiarity with usability testing methodologies and tools.

Location: Detroit/Ann Arbor, MI OR NYC, NY

Duration: Long term

Need to be in person in NYC, NY or Ann Arbor, MI

Required

3+ years of creative experience across web, mobile, and interaction design.

Fluency with Figma or Sketch, the Adobe Creative Suite (After Effects, Photoshop, InDesign), and other creative tools.

An appetite for iteration and innovation to arrive at the best solutions for design challenges.

An ability to take complex ideas and communicate them simply to a wide audience through words, graphics, and layouts.

Partner with visual designers, product managers, engineers, contractors, growth, and the founders to produce and improve experiences in our mobile app.

Work closely with the product and founding team to prototype new features.

Create, improve, and maintain internal libraries and documentation around our design system and process while enabling colleagues and community members to effortlessly use the DIMO brand.

Create low and high fidelity designs and prototypes in Figma to communicate designs to engineers, designers, and key decision makers.

Help define DIMO's brand across every part of the company, including social media, investor decks, swag, our mobile app, our website, and plenty more.

Nice To Have

Knowledge of the mobility, connected vehicle, or self driving space. IoT product experience is also a plus.

Experience in web3, consumer software, or financial services.

Knowledge of Blender 3D, Cinema The Client, and/or Keyshot.

An outstanding visual design portfolio that demonstrates proficiency in typography, color, visual hierarchy and includes clear examples of creative execution.

Startup or entrepreneurship experience.Experience building and maintaining design systems including components, libraries, templates, and documentation.

Our UX Research team is designing for the global diversity of human needs, which requires us to deeply understand the behaviors of the people behind them. Our researchers tackle some of the most complex challenges to gain deeper insights into how people interact with each other and the world around them, and work collaboratively to contribute new ideas to products that impact the experiences of billions of people on a global scale. This job description represents different full-time roles across Meta.We use a variety of qualitative and quantitative methods to accomplish our goals, including surveys, focus groups, field studies, usability tests, and 1:1 interviews. We value a diverse range of perspectives and stem from many different backgrounds.We’re looking for excellent communicators who are knowledgeable about research devoted to understanding people, and curious about the relationship between technology and society. They will also need to be comfortable in a fast-moving organization, open-minded about learning new research methods, committed to high-quality and rigorous research, and focused on influencing the future of Meta.

UX Researcher, Mixed Methods Responsibilities:


Work closely with product and business teams to identify research topics
Act as a thought leader in the domain of research, while advocating for the people who could use our products
Design and execute end-to-end custom primary research using a wide variety of methods
Design studies that address both user behavior and attitudes
Ability to work independently and autonomously
Effectively manage and prioritize research plans through ambiguous and fast-changing environments, align and efficiently execute critical insights and work with a large group of stakeholders
Communicate results and illustrate suggestions in compelling and creative ways
Work cross-functionally with design, product management, content strategy, engineering and marketing
Generate insights that both fuel ideation and evaluate designs


Minimum Qualifications:


Bachelor’s degree with 7+ years’ of relevant experience in user experience, applied research and/or product research and development or a Master’s degree and 5+ years’ relevant experience, or PhD and 2+ year relevant experience
Relevant experience within user experience, applied research setting and/or product research and development
Experience conducting In-Depth Interviews or Focus Groups and Concept Testing or Usability Testing
Experience coding with R, SQL, STATA, SPSS or equivalent
Experience applying statistical analysis methods such as Regressions, ANOVA, and T-Tests
Interest in and experience executing hands-on, primary research
Experience translating research findings into strategic narratives


Preferred Qualifications:


Experience with consumer products, consumer insights, or product development
Degrees in a human behavior related field, such as Human-Computer Interaction, Psychology, Sociology, Communication, Information science, Media studies, Computer Science, or Economics


About Meta:

Meta builds technologies that help people connect, find communities, and grow businesses. When Facebook launched in 2004, it changed the way people connect. Apps like Messenger, Instagram and WhatsApp further empowered billions around the world. Now, Meta is moving beyond 2D screens toward immersive experiences like augmented and virtual reality to help build the next evolution in social technology. People who choose to build their careers by building with us at Meta help shape a future that will take us beyond what digital connection makes possible today—beyond the constraints of screens, the limits of distance, and even the rules of physics.

Meta is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Meta participates in the E-Verify program in certain locations, as required by law. Who We Are:

Intercept Games is a Private Division/Take-Two development studio currently focused on the creation of Kerbal Space Program 2 (KSP2) as well as an unannounced stylized science-based adventure game. We have a deep love for space, simulation, strategy, and of course all things video games. Our studio prioritizes an inviting and diverse workplace that pushes creativity and passion for what we do, resulting in games that we can truly be proud of. We believe that by creating an environment of trust, potential for growth, psychological safety, Engineering Excellence, and fun, we can ship some of the most amazing experiences in the world of interactive entertainment.

The Challenge

Are you an enthusiastic UX Designer with a creative and analytical mindset? Do you enjoy discovering and learning new processes, trades, and tool? If you said 'yes', this may be the role for you!

As a UX Designer on our team, you will collaborate with the design team to design, implement, and optimize UI assets for our titles. A successful teammate in this role is highly collaborative and open to prototype and iteration.

What You'll Take On


Maintaining high visual fidelity, competitive aesthetics, and presenting game information in a clear and understandable manner.
Creating storyboards, user flows, wire-frames, and prototypes.
Run user tests to identify and troubleshoot UX problems.
Create and improve features across the game that present information and functions clearly.
Create comprehensive documentation detailing individual feature. functions, states, and interactions.


What You Bring


2+ years of UX design experience.
Bachelor's degree in Design or equivalent practical experience.
Experience designing and implementing UI mock-ups within Unity.
Knowledge of wire-frame tools (e.g., Figma, Adobe XD, InVision).
Knowledge of design software (e.g., Photoshop, Illustrator, After Effects).
Portfolio is required, the portfolio must include UX & UI focused work samples.


Preferred Skills


Experience working within a collaborative environment across multi-disciplinary departments.
Self-motivated team player with a supportive nature and proven work ethic.
Passion for space exploration.


What We Offer You:


Great Company Culture. Ranked as one of the most creative and innovative places to work. Innovation, efficiency, diversity and philanthropy are among the core tenets of our organization and are integral drivers of our continued success.
Growth. As a global entertainment company, we pride ourselves on creating environments where employees are encouraged to be themselves, inquisitive, collaborative, and to grow within and around the company.
Team Mentality. We strive to build teams that work together and celebrate together through company events such as team gatherings, game release parties, monthly socials, and wellness programs.
Benefits. Medical (HSA & FSA), dental, vision, 401(k) with company match, employee stock purchase plan, commuter benefits, in-house wellness program, broad learning & development opportunities, a charitable giving platform with company match and more!
Perks. Fitness allowance, employee discount programs, free games & events, stocked pantries and the ability to earn up to $500+ per year for taking care of yourself and more!


The pay range for this position in Washington at the start of employment is expected to be between $61,500 and $90,000 per year. However, base pay offered is based on market location, and may vary further depending on individualized factors for job candidates, such as job-related knowledge, skills, experience, and other objective business considerations. Subject to those same considerations, the total compensation package for this position may also include other elements, including a bonus and/or equity awards and eligibility to participate in our 401(K) plan, in addition to a full range of medical, dental, vision, and basic life insurance. Employees will also receive 14 paid holidays per calendar year, are eligible to earn a minimum of 15 days of vacation leave per year (subject to proration based on start date during the calendar year) and will receive 10 sick days per calendar year. Details of participation in these benefit plans will be provided if an employee receives an offer of employment. If hired, employee will be in an "at-will position" and the Company reserves the right to modify base salary (as well as any other discretionary payment or compensation or benefit program) at any time, including for reasons related to individual performance, Company or individual department/team performance, and market factors.

Experience: Proven experience as a UX Designer with a strong portfolio showcasing previous work and design process.

Communication: Excellent communication and collaboration skills to work effectively with cross-functional teams.

Attention to Detail: A keen eye for detail and a commitment to delivering high-quality design work.

Accessibility: Familiarity with accessibility standards and guidelines (WCAG) is a plus.

Adaptability: Ability to adapt to changing project requirements and priorities in a fast-paced environment.

We are looking for a Principal User Researcher who can help to shape the product direction by building a deep understanding of users, competition, and markets. You'll work with designers, product managers, and developers to strategize together on ambiguous and ambitious challenges. You'll apply a broad set of research techniques to create empathy and gather insights that influence the product roadmap. You'll use your storytelling skills to inspire change at all stages of product development by delivering engaging, insightful, and action-oriented recommendations that are easy to digest and act upon.

Your primary job as an advocate for our users is to turn their needs into reality by helping the product team understand what would make a user's experience more useful, valuable, and delightful. You'll be joining Microsoft's larger community of researchers across the globe where we share best practices and celebrate our learning in an annual conference, publications, mentorship programs, and more. Our team is dedicated to creating an inclusive culture to build the most diverse and talented group of employees possible. If you embrace a growth mindset, have a record of accomplishment and of delivering results, and find energy in collaborating with others, this is a team and role for you.

Responsibilities


Proactively identifies research needs and potential problem areas that need to be researched while balancing reactive research requests by PM and design teams
Work closely with cross-functional product teams to develop a research strategy that includes generative and evaluative research studies, and ensure the right data is being collected to positively impact the product direction
Conduct a mixture of qualitative and quantitative research activities to inform product design, including but not limited to: usability studies, heuristic evaluations, interviews, surveys, user journey maps, benchmarks, telemetry analyses, and personas
Communicate your findings in a clear and concise manner to our key stakeholders on the product and design teams, and drive meaningful action based on those findings
Help foster a diverse and inclusive team environment that empowers our team members to do their best work



Qualifications


A minimum of MA/MS in Experimental Psychology, Cognitive Psychology, Human Factors, Human-Computer Interaction or a related field, OR significant industry experience
7+ years' experience in user experience research, design research, product research or equivalent
Proven track record of collaborating across many disciplines - data science, marketing, design, program management, and engineering - to influence product strategy and roadmap
In-depth understanding and demonstrated experience with using and appropriately selecting a wide variety of design research methodologies including but not limited to: usability studies, prototype testing, concept value testing, field/remote studies, in-depth interviews, heuristic evaluations, user journey mapping, personas, competitive reviews, benchmark studies, and surveys
Ability to quickly and effectively analyze research data and present rich findings simply and clearly to influence product design and direction
Strong leadership skills to deliver projects and customer insights within and across product teams that result in strong product impact
Experience in emerging technologies such as mixed reality applications and/or computer vision
Proven ability to develop and communicate a research plan that balances strategic and tactical needs
Passion for learning new technologies and understanding the needs of users across a wide range of technical abilities
Excellent communication, presentation, interpersonal, and analytical skills
Comfortable and effective at working with ambiguity and fast-paced environments
Industries: Non-profit Organizations and Primary and Secondary Education

Job_description:
UX Designer (1297831)




Responsibilities:

Researching and understanding user needs and behaviors through methods such as user interviews, surveys, and analytics data
Creating user personas and user flows to identify key user journeys and pain points. Create mind maps, user flows
Understand front-end development process and limitations (basic knowledge of HTML/CSS/JS is a plus)
Understand, apply and promote our design thinking and design system
Collaborating with stakeholders, such as Product Managers and Developers, to create design concepts and prototypes that align with business goals and technical constraints
Conducting usability testing and gathering feedback from users to refine and iterate on designs based on research
Creating detailed design specifications and documentation for Developers to implement
Continuously iterating on designs and testing new features to improve the user experience
Creating hi-fidelity and low fidelity designs for multiple platforms such as mobile, web
Creating a prototype for user testing and validation.




Qualifications:

6-8 years of experience
Must be proficient in visual design and Figma.
Have experience with enterprise SaaS products.
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Fine Arts, Graphic Design, Product Management, Engineering, or a related field, or the equivalent and 6-8 years of experience. If no bachelors degree, will accept 10+ years of experience
Understand cloud-native app development (DevOps, Agile Methodology, microservices, cloud platforms, containers like Kubernetes and Docker, CI/CD)
Plan own tasks considering collaboration with the team
Willingness to iterate, learn, and improve based on feedback
Share knowledge with other team members and help to improve design maturity.
Support written and verbal communication in order to plan further work, explain and document ideas




Compensation: $53.00 - $71.43 per hour

FedTec Overview:

FedTec is a Woman-Owned Small Business with headquarters in Reston, VA. However, FedTec is more than just a company – we are a dedicated team of visionary individuals who understand the power of transformation. With our unwavering commitment to innovative technology and forward-focused methods, we empower government agencies to fulfill their missions successfully with our capabilities in Digital Transformation, and Cyber Security. Our strategy is rooted in in-depth advising and a unique shoulder-to-shoulder mission experience, all geared towards enabling our clients, their agencies, and every American to thrive. We use the same approach as our employees, building meaningful and lasting relationships to meet their evolving needs and help them grow. We are excited to welcome you to our family.

About the Opportunity:

FedTec is looking for a UI/UX Design Engineer to assess and evaluate behaviors of targeted groups of people using human centered design methodology to explore all aspects of a stakeholder’s experience, and then translate that knowledge into meaningful and actionable information and system designs to inform and improve programs, products, and services. Leverage a variety of technologies, tools, and techniques, including market and ethnographic research. Apply advanced consulting skills, extensive technical expertise, and full industry knowledge.

Position: UI/UX Design Engineer

Work Location: Remote

Client: Internal Revenue Services

Primary Responsibilities


Utilize a human-centered approach and incorporate use cases and usability to gathering requirements and designing enhancement to the software platform.
Design and conduct usability testing to verify the usability of the new processes, using the Pega platform
Ensure a consistent and coherent user journey through the conversion funnel, connecting landing pages and other elements to create a holistic experience
Conduct insightful field interviews and observations
Collaborate with project team to synthesize data into meaningful findings
Develop models that ground the team in a common language and purpose
Translate findings into task flows, personas, usage scenarios, stakeholder maps, journey maps etc.


Basic Qualifications


5+ years of experience with developing and facilitating design strategy sessions for gathering requirements, collecting data, analyzing results, and deriving insights and recommendations
5+ years of experience with using collaboration and design tools, including Figma, Justinmind, MURAL, and Adobe Creative Suite
Experience creating prototypes, customer journey maps, mock screens, UX solutions on Pega platform
Knowledge of User Experience research methods, including facilitating interviews and focus groups
Experience with presenting and interacting with senior level clients
5+ years of experience with creating personas, process flows, journey maps, service design blueprints, and other experience maps in a client-ready deliverable format
Knowledge of Enterprise IT Transformation
Ability to think creatively and synthesize information
Excellent verbal and written communication skills


Education / Certifications:


Bachelor’s degree in information technology or related field


Clearance:


Ability to obtain public trust clearance


When You Join FedTec, You Are Joining a Family! We take pride in our work and the true and transparent relationships we build with our employees and partners. We believe that positive energy attracts like-minded individuals, which is why we have such exceptional people on our team.

Just as you'd do for your own family, we prioritize your safety, health, and happiness. That's why we've created the FedTec Total Well-Being program, offering benefits like:


Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision plans. These plans encompass a range of beneficial features, such as Telehealth virtual care programs, and access to resources to support your physical and mental well-being.
Generous paid time off for relaxation and rejuvenation.
Financial security through 401k, company-paid short and long-term disability, life insurance, and additional voluntary coverage.
Support for your life and family with access to an Employee Assistance Program, Pet Insurance, and Prepaid Legal services.
Recognition and growth opportunities through our Rewards & Recognition and Learning & Development programs.
Our newest addition, the FedTec Fit Program, features an on-staff Fitness Coach who provides personal and group sessions, company fitness challenges, and ongoing support for your fitness goals.


At FedTec we embrace the power of diversity, fostering a culture where varied thoughts, ideas, and perspectives empower our employees and partners to thrive. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran and we maintain a drug-free workplace to ensure a safe and healthy environment for all.

Our UX Research team is designing for the global diversity of human needs, which requires us to deeply understand the behaviors of the people behind them. Our researchers tackle some of the most complex challenges to gain deeper insights into how people interact with each other and the world around them, and work collaboratively to contribute new ideas to products that impact the experiences of billions of people on a global scale.We are looking for an experienced individual contributor who will help elevate the practice of research with creative but rigorous qualitative, quantitative, and/or design research methods. The right candidate will be an effective communicator, passionate about understanding people, curious about the relationship between data, technology and society, comfortable in a flat, fast-moving organization, and a great collaborator.This job description represents different UX Research opportunities for full-time new graduate roles across Meta’s family of apps and services.

Quantitative UX Researcher, University Grad Responsibilities:


Design and execute end-to-end custom primary research using a wide variety of methods
Work closely with product teams, as well as other researchers, to identify important research questions
Act as a thought leader in research, while advocating for people who use our products
Generate insights that shape how product teams think about medium and long-term product strategy
Communicate results and illustrate suggestions in compelling and creative ways
Work cross-functionally with design, product management, data science, content strategy, engineering, and marketing


Minimum Qualifications:


Currently has or in the process of obtaining MA/MS in a human behavior-related field, such as Human-Computer Interaction, Psychology, Sociology, Communication, Anthropology, Information Science, Computer Science, or Political Science
Knowledge of research methods in at least one subset of methods (e.g., survey design and quantitative data analysis, ethnography) - qualitative and/or quantitative research
Experience conveying research findings and implications to audiences
Analytical, project management, and problem-solving experience
Experience with autonomy and independent decision making to weigh tradeoffs and balance demands
Experience mentoring other researchers and maintain our team's standard of work
Must obtain work authorization in country of employment at the time of hire, and maintain ongoing work authorization during employment


Preferred Qualifications:


Experience with consumer products, consumer insights, or product research
Currently has or in the process of obtaining PhD in a human behavior-related field, such as Human-Computer Interaction, Psychology, Sociology, Communication, Anthropology, Information Science, Computer Science, or Political Science

As a UX Researcher, your primary responsibility will be to gather and analyze user insights to inform the design and development of digital products and services. You will conduct various research methods to understand user behaviors, needs, and preferences, and collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure the creation of intuitive and user-centered experiences. Your work will directly contribute to enhancing user satisfaction, engagement, and overall product success.




Responsibilities:

Conduct user research: Plan, design, and execute user research studies, including user interviews, usability testing, surveys, and other qualitative and quantitative research methods.
User behavior analysis: Analyze user data and derive meaningful insights to identify patterns, trends, and opportunities for improving user experiences.
Persona development: Create user personas based on research findings to facilitate the understanding and empathy towards target users.
Usability testing: Plan and conduct usability testing sessions to evaluate prototypes or existing products, identify usability issues, and provide actionable recommendations.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams: Work closely with designers, product managers, developers, and other stakeholders to integrate user research findings into the product development process.
User journey mapping: Develop user journey maps to visualize and communicate the user's end-to-end experience across different touchpoints.
Stakeholder communication: Effectively communicate research findings, insights, and recommendations to stakeholders in a clear and compelling manner.
Industry and competitor analysis: Stay up to date with industry trends, competitor offerings, and best practices in UX research to contribute to the continuous improvement of products and processes.
Research planning and documentation: Plan research activities, create research plans, and document research findings, insights, and recommendations in a structured manner.
User testing tools and platforms: Utilize various user testing tools and platforms to conduct remote or in-person research studies efficiently.




Requirements:

Education: Bachelor's or Master's degree in Human-Computer Interaction (HCI), Psychology, Cognitive Science, User Experience, or a related field.
Proven experience: 3+ years of professional experience in UX research or a similar role, preferably in a digital product development environment.
Research methods: Proficiency in a wide range of qualitative and quantitative research methods, including user interviews, usability testing, surveys, card sorting, and data analysis.
Data analysis: Strong analytical skills to derive insights from user data and research findings.
Empathy and communication: Ability to empathize with users and effectively communicate research findings and recommendations to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Collaboration: Experience working collaboratively in cross-functional teams, including designers, developers, and product managers.
UX tools: Familiarity with UX design and research tools, such as prototyping tools (e.g., Sketch, Figma, Adobe XD), user testing platforms (e.g., UserTesting.com, UserZoom), and data analysis tools (e.g., Excel, SPSS, R).
Adaptability: Flexibility to adapt to changing project requirements and work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
Attention to detail: Strong attention to detail to ensure accurate and reliable research data collection and analysis.
Portfolio: A portfolio showcasing past UX research projects and methodologies is highly desirable.
Industries: Staffing and Recruiting, Information Services, and Technology, Information and Media

Details JD Provide guidance to project teams on UX design projects ensuring the delivery of high-quality solutions that meet client objects and exceed expectations.  Develop UX standards and best practices for the Design Thinking practice and the broader Process Optimization group to integrate into its operations and delivery.  Conduct and facilitate research activities to understand end users, their needs, pain points and requirements to optimize the end user experience and shape the design of solutions.  Facilitate workshops to generate innovative solutions to end-user challenges and pain points.  Translate low-Client requirements and wireframes into high-Client prototypes to drive alignment on features and functionality among key stakeholders.  Create designs for multiple contexts and devices (e.g. desktop, mobile, tablet) with special attention to info architecture (e.g. content grouping, hierarchies, system/process flow and user flows).  Plan and conduct usability tests and provide reports with actionable recommendations  Plan and conduct concept reviews, task walkthroughs and other evaluations to support the iterative design process.  Provide input on dashboard design, help set standards.  Interface with users to understand dashboard requirements and help translate to design.  Establish best practices for effectively designing a dashboard/communicating to end users.  3 - 5 years of experience designing digital products.  Proven track record in leading and delivering successful UX design projects Should you be chosen for an interview you will be asked to present samples from your portfolio.  Proven track record in leading user research through several methods (e.g. user interviews, surveys, etc.) analyzing user research data, identifying end-user pain points, developing innovative user-centered solutions, and conducting usability studies.  Experience in producing wireframes, prototypes, process maps, journey maps, personas, service blueprints and other visual methods for presenting insights to stakeholders  Experience in planning and leading concept ideation workshops, analyzing, synthesizing outputs and delivering visual product designs.  Expertise in at least 2 core user experience competencies (e.g. research, information architecture, interaction design, interface design, front-end development and/ or content strategy).  Excellent written and verbal skills with demonstrated ability to present to and influence senior leaders.  Command of design basics including readability, accessibility, iconography, use of color and spatial relationships.  Proficient in wireframing and prototyping tools (e.g. Figma and Axure). Experience with web, SaaS-based interfaces and/or dashboard design.Ideal Additional ExperienceExperience with Design Thinking and Service Design and workshop facilitation.Graphic Design.Experience working in an Agile (Kanban) environment.Certifications in UX and UI design good to have

Here at Spellbrush, we're passionate about making a good anime game.

We also happen to be the world's leading generative AI studio — we're the team behind niji・journey.

We are currently investigating how AI can be used to help human artists perform masterpieces in the most complex medium of our times: videogames.

Our games are characterized by a no-compromise approach to well-balanced gameplay married to a truthful love of visual arts.

If you love turn-based tactics games, please consider applying!

The Role:

Spellbrush, the world’s leading generative AI studio behind niji・journey, is looking for a UI/UX Designer to bring our mobile turn-based tactics game to life with distinctive flair! If you love games like Fire Emblem and Final Fantasy Tactics and are eager to help waifus and husbandos look their sharpest, hit us up!

What you’ll do:


Design and mock up the user interfaces of our games in your favorite design tool (figma, photoshop, origami studio, etc.), ensuring that they are visually appealing and easy to use.
Collaborate with game designers, artists, and developers to define and refine the game's user interface and user experience
Develop reusable UI components and libraries for use across multiple games and projects.


You might be a great fit if:


You love the art of user interfaces. We’re looking for someone with ideally 3+ years of mobile game UI / UX experience, who is as comfortable with designing high-tech futuristic interfaces as they are minimalistic app designs.Our games boast unique gameplay mechanics with varying graphic / VFX assets, so the ability to envision and implement cohesive experiences is a must.
Your user empathy blossoms in both the stylistic and the functional. If your goal as a designer is to create one of the most iconic but intuitive menu experiences in the mobile game industry, then Spellbrush is the right company to join! We pride our exploration of aesthetics while maintaining a high standard for usability.
The anime aesthetic resonates with you. It's no secret – we're huge anime enthusiasts. A deep understanding of audiences who enjoy anime, mobile gacha games, and turn-based tactics games is critical to build the optimal designs for our audiences.
You're comfortable working on small, fast-paced, on-site teams Working here will feel very much like a small indie studio: close-knit, with high ownership and flexibility. We’re also an in-person studio. Our games team is at our office in downtown San Francisco, CA, 3-4x a week!
And you're excited about the potential of Generative AI. You'll also be working closely with some of the best AI researchers in the world: we develop all our own in-house models. You won’t be using Generative AI simply as a vehicle for producing cheap assets. (We simply don’t believe that is an effective workflow). You’ll be working with the research team to explore the frontier of what is possible at the intersection of machine learning, art, and games.


The base salary range for this position is $60,000 - $140,000. The final base salary is dependent upon location, experience, fit, and other factors. In addition, we offer a generous compensation package that includes equity, top-tier employer-sponsored health, dental, and vision insurance, and additional perks!

At Spellbrush, we value creativity, collaboration, and innovation. If you're excited about working with cutting-edge technology and passionate about anime, gaming, and design, we'd love to hear from you. Apply now to join our team as a Game UI / UX Designer!

To apply - please share your previous work experience/resume, portfolio, and any links to previous relevant works and the name of the best waifu or husbando in your message!

Must haves: 1. User Research: User experience designers should have a strong foundation in user research methodologies. They should be able to conduct interviews, surveys, usability testing, and other research techniques to gain insights into user behaviors, needs, and preferences. By understanding users' goals and motivations, designers can create intuitive and user-centered designs. 2. Interaction Design: Interaction design focuses on designing the behavior and response of digital products or services. UX designers need to be skilled in creating effective user interfaces, designing user flows, and mapping out user journeys. They should have a deep understanding of information architecture, navigation design, and interaction patterns to ensure seamless and intuitive user experiences. 3. Visual Design: While UX design primarily focuses on the overall user experience, a basic understanding of visual design principles is also crucial. UX designers should have a good eye for aesthetics, color theory, typography, and layout. They should be able to create visually appealing designs that align with the brand identity and effectively communicate information to users.

Junior Graphic and UI/UX Designer - US Only

Experience: 1+ years

Employment Type: Full-time, hybrid

Base Salary: $60K-$70K

Phoenix Recruitment offers a variety of recruiting services to assist both employers and employees. They are specialized in marketing open positions, recruiting, and helping employers to find qualified candidates across various industries. Phoenix Recruitment has expertise in streamlining the hiring process. They can help ensure that the process is efficient, well organized, and compliant with relevant regulations.

About The Role

As a Junior Graphic and UI/UX Designer working in our Design team, youll play a crucial role in creating visually appealing and user-centric designs for various digital platforms. You will collaborate with senior designers, and cross-functional teams, and contribute to the overall visual and interactive aspects of our projects.

Key Responsibilities


Graphic Design
Assist in the creation of visually captivating marketing materials, presentations, and other graphic design collateral.
Support the design of social media content, email campaigns, and digital marketing assets.
UI/UX Design
Collaborate with senior designers and product teams to produce wireframes, mockups, and prototypes for websites and mobile apps.
Help create user-centered designs that align with project goals and user requirements.
Contribute to the development of intuitive user experiences by participating in design discussions and ideation sessions.
Design Support
Assist in maintaining design guidelines and standards to ensure consistency across various projects.
Stay updated with design trends, tools, and best practices to enhance your design skills and contribute innovative ideas.

Qualifications


Bachelors degree or equivalent in Graphic Design, UI/UX Design, or a related field.
A portfolio showcasing your graphic design and UI/UX skills, including projects and examples.
Proficiency in design tools such as Figma, Adobe Creative Suite (Illustrator, Photoshop, XD), or similar software.
Basic understanding of UI/UX principles and a strong desire to learn and grow in this field.
Attention to detail and effective communication of design concepts.
Ability to work collaboratively in a team, adapt to feedback, and incorporate changes into designs.
Strong attention to detail. Organized and reliable. Able and willing to present designs to groups of stakeholders.


Preferred Skills


Basic knowledge of HTML/CSS and responsive design principles


Why Phoenix Recruitment LLC?

Phoenix Recruitment often has an extensive network of employers and candidates. This network allows them to tap into a pool of qualified candidates and connect them with suitable job opportunities. They can also leverage their connections to help employers find the right talent efficiently. Outsourcing the recruitment process to a specialized agency can save you time and resources, avoid delays, reduce administrative burdens, and increase the chances of finding the right fit for your organization.

Job_description:
About The Role

We are looking for a Principal User Researcher who can help to shape the product direction by building a deep understanding of users, competition, and markets. You'll work with designers, product managers, and developers to strategize together on ambiguous and ambitious challenges. You'll apply a broad set of research techniques to create empathy and gather insights that influence the product roadmap. You'll use your storytelling skills to inspire change at all stages of product development by delivering engaging, insightful, and action-oriented recommendations that are easy to digest and act upon.

Your primary job as an advocate for our users is to turn their needs into reality by helping the product team understand what would make a user's experience more useful, valuable, and delightful. You'll be joining Microsoft's larger community of researchers across the globe where we share best practices and celebrate our learning in an annual conference, publications, mentorship programs, and more. Our team is dedicated to creating an inclusive culture to build the most diverse and talented group of employees possible. If you embrace a growth mindset, have a record of accomplishment and of delivering results, and find energy in collaborating with others, this is a team and role for you.

Responsibilities


Proactively identifies research needs and potential problem areas that need to be researched while balancing reactive research requests by PM and design teams
Work closely with cross-functional product teams to develop a research strategy that includes generative and evaluative research studies, and ensure the right data is being collected to positively impact the product direction
Conduct a mixture of qualitative and quantitative research activities to inform product design, including but not limited to: usability studies, heuristic evaluations, interviews, surveys, user journey maps, benchmarks, telemetry analyses, and personas
Communicate your findings in a clear and concise manner to our key stakeholders on the product and design teams, and drive meaningful action based on those findings
Help foster a diverse and inclusive team environment that empowers our team members to do their best work



Qualifications


A minimum of MA/MS in Experimental Psychology, Cognitive Psychology, Human Factors, Human-Computer Interaction or a related field, OR significant industry experience
7+ years' experience in user experience research, design research, product research or equivalent
Proven track record of collaborating across many disciplines - data science, marketing, design, program management, and engineering - to influence product strategy and roadmap
In-depth understanding and demonstrated experience with using and appropriately selecting a wide variety of design research methodologies including but not limited to: usability studies, prototype testing, concept value testing, field/remote studies, in-depth interviews, heuristic evaluations, user journey mapping, personas, competitive reviews, benchmark studies, and surveys
Ability to quickly and effectively analyze research data and present rich findings simply and clearly to influence product design and direction
Strong leadership skills to deliver projects and customer insights within and across product teams that result in strong product impact
Experience in emerging technologies such as mixed reality applications and/or computer vision
Proven ability to develop and communicate a research plan that balances strategic and tactical needs
Passion for learning new technologies and understanding the needs of users across a wide range of technical abilities
Excellent communication, presentation, interpersonal, and analytical skills
Comfortable and effective at working with ambiguity and fast-paced environments
Industries: Non-profit Organizations and Primary and Secondary Education
