UX Designer

Fully Remote




SUMMARY:

Seeking a UX/UI Designer who can create high fidelity wireframes, develop prototypes, and use Figma proficiently to make low to mid-fidelity designs for usability testing and transform designs into high fidelity prototypes.




RESPONSIBILITIES:

Elevate design concepts to HiFi interfaces using Fluent UI design system in Figma, ready for testing.
Create and manage a reusable component library in Figma for design consistency.
Align design efforts with project requirements for user-centric solutions.
Build Figma prototypes for usability testing, incorporating interaction design.
Update designs responsively and quickly based on feedback from UX test sessions, team reviews, and other feedback forums.
Efficiently prioritize tasks in a fast-paced environment to meet tight deadlines.

Typical Day in the Role:

Purpose of the Team: The purpose of this team is to support marketing within the org.
Key projects: This role will contribute to creating high fidelity wireframes, develop prototypes, and use Figma proficiently to make low to mid-fidelity designs for usability testing and transform designs into high fidelity prototypes.
Typical task breakdown and operating rhythm: The role will consist of about 10% meetings (1-2 hours per day) and the remaining 90% will be heads down work.




REQUIREMENTS:

Advanced Figma skills with experience in Fluent UI and complex component construction.
Experience in building and maintaining a Figma component library for future designs.
Nice to have experience using Microsoft's Fluent UI standards / Fluent UI design system.
Solid UX/UI design foundation for intuitive and visually appealing design creation.
Proven ability to create responsive, accessible designs across web and mobile.
Exceptional technical precision and attention to detail in design execution.
Ability to manage multiple projects under tight deadlines.
Excellent communication for seamless collaboration with teams.




ADDITIONAL INFORMATION:

Candidate Requirements:

6 or more overall years of experience in the field.
Degrees or Certifications Required: No degree is required to be eligible for this role.
Disqualifiers: Candidates with no Figma experience in the last year, or those who are unable to create high fidelity wireframes, or profiles submitted without a portfolio will not be eligible for the role.
Best vs. Average: The ideal resume would contain experience with developing prototypes and using Figma proficiently to make low to mid-fidelity designs for usability testing and transform designs into high fidelity prototypes. It will also have expert level Figma experience, 7 or more years of experience with corporate/business graphic design, their portfolio will include a variety of their experience with graphic design, and has heavy experience with Fluent UI, and Microsoft systems and tooling.
Performance Indicators: Performance will be assessed based on quality of work and deadlines.

Top 3 Hard Skills Required + Years of Experience

Minimum 6 years’ experience with Figma [Must have been used within the last year].
Minimum 6 years’ experience with Design Library Components [Fluent UI preferred, but other design systems will be acceptable].
Minimum 4 years’ experience with creating prototypes in Figma.




This role is essential for integrating design concepts into functional prototypes, ensuring readiness for user testing and future scalability.




We are an equal opportunity employer, and we are an organization that values diversity. We welcome applications from all qualified candidates, including minorities and persons with disabilities.




req18525-1

Summary: The Learning Experience Designer will be responsible for developing and designing engaging learning activities and course content from information provided by subject matter experts. You will develop instructional material, design courses, and play an integral role in the implementation, application, and revision of courses. The ideal candidate will have experience with a variety of training creation methods including video editing skills, simulation building, and virtual classroom training design.




Duties/Responsibilities

Consult with subject matter experts to determine efficiencies and requirements for the development and design of eLearning courses.
Create instructional material including courses, facilitator guides, and consumables using a variety of software including Articulate Storyline and Rise, Vyond, Photoshop, Canva, and Camtasia.
Assist in video production, including cleaning video and audio and creating overlays.
Proofread, test, and edit courses.
Review course modules, and evaluate the design from a learner’s perspective.
Edit with attention to detail.
Perform other duties as assigned.




Required Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in Instructional Design or related field
Knowledge of instructional design principles and theories to maximize learning
Strong communication skills
Ability to work remotely, with a team, and independently on projects
Ability to learn quickly
Knowledge and/or experience with a variety of Instructional Design authoring tools and platforms (i.e., Camtasia, Captivate, Articulate360, Audacity, PowerPoint, Adobe Creative Suite, etc.).
Excellent written, verbal, and visual communication skills with meticulous attention to detail
Passion for helping people learn




Preferred Qualifications

Experience with Articulate Storyline, Vyond, Adobe design suite, and Zoom
Video editing or production experience or the willingness and eagerness to learn the above programs




Normal Working Hours and Conditions: Core business hours are generally 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. Monday through Friday. However, this position will require work to be performed outside of normal business hours based on company operations.




Physical Requirements: Primary functions require sufficient physical ability and mobility to work in an office setting, including verbally communicating, seeing and hearing to exchange information, and fine coordination including the use of a computer keyboard. Daily physical functions include standing, sitting, and walking for prolonged periods of time and occasionally stooping, bending, kneeling, crouching, reaching, and twisting. The employee may engage in lifting, carrying, pushing, and pulling light to moderate amounts of weight up to 25 pounds. The position also requires the operation of office equipment requiring repetitive hand movement.

I release all persons who disclose such information from any liability or damages to me or anyone acting in my name. If hired, my employment with Navigate360, LLC is at-will. This means that I may terminate my employment at any time.




Similarly, the company may terminate my employment at any time, with or without cause.

Why you should work with us




This person will uncover insights into what users currently experience, and what they truly need. This person will guide product teams in applying the most effective approach for achieving research goals and will help them work together to arrive at actionable user insights.




The product that this role will support offers a combination of crypto services and cloud infrastructure aspects.




Qualifications

• Proven track record of planning and running research, collaborating with other teams to uncover insights

• Experience in qualitative research methods (e.g. in-depth interviews, heuristic evaluations, lab & remote usability testing)

• Some experience with quantitative research methodologies (e.g. surveys)

• Experience in enterprise applications is a plus




Responsibilities:

• Collaborating with product teams to define research goals and identify target users

• Developing a research approach and detailed study plan

• Creating research materials including screeners, guides, and scripts

• Facilitating research sessions and analyzing/synthesizing study data, involving product partners




Pay Range: $65-90




The specific compensation for this position will be determined by a number of factors, including the scope, complexity and location of the role as well as the cost of labor in the market; the skills, education, training, credentials and experience of the candidate; and other conditions of employment. Our full-time consultants have access to benefits including medical, dental, vision and 401K contributions as well as any other PTO, sick leave, and other benefits mandated by appliable state or localities where you reside or work.

okay with non-local candidates who are willing to relocate at own cost

Hybrid schedule; M, W, and Fridays in office (Subject to change).




2 interview rounds - zoom/onsite if local




Skills/Must have:

- min 5 years of relevant UX experience - NOT UI.

**Need someone specifically data presentation and management experience**

Requirements and skills

• Proven work experience as a UI/UX Designer or similar role

• Portfolio of design projects

• Knowledge of wireframe tools (e.g. Wireframe.cc and InVision)

• Up-to-date knowledge of design software like Adobe Illustrator and Photoshop

• Team spirit; strong communication skills to collaborate with various stakeholders

Job Summary:The Salesforce UX Designer is responsible for creating intuitive, visually appealing, and user-centric designs for Salesforce applications and platforms. Working closely with stakeholders, product managers, and developers, the Salesforce UX Designer translates business requirements into engaging user experiences that enhance productivity, efficiency, and customer satisfaction. This role requires a deep understanding of Salesforce's capabilities, industry best practices, and user-centered design principles.

Job Summary:The Salesforce UX Designer is responsible for creating intuitive, visually appealing, and user-centric designs for Salesforce applications and platforms. Working closely with stakeholders, product managers, and developers, the Salesforce UX Designer translates business requirements into engaging user experiences that enhance productivity, efficiency, and customer satisfaction. This role requires a deep understanding of Salesforce's capabilities, industry best practices, and user-centered design principles.

What We Are Looking For:

We are seeking an innovative and experienced UX Designer to join our talented and passionate team working on the Unannounced Project. This is a unique opportunity to work on an exciting and upcoming project, shaping the user experience for our highly acclaimed video games. As a UX Designer, you will contribute to creating immersive and engaging gameplay experiences that resonate with our global player community.

Requirements

What We Will Do Together:


Work closely with game designers, artists, and engineers to achieve the best possible presentation of game mechanics
Support high-level design in intuitive UX flows and wireframes
Create and express design decisions with a data-informed vision, design rationale and solutions to team members
Benchmark competition and extract key insights that apply to your game’s UI/UX
Produce prototypes for new features and flows and iterate on them fast based on collected feedback
Build game progressions, flows, journey maps and communicate them with rationale


What You Will Bring:


2+ years of mobile game development experience as a UX Designer
Experience using industry-standard engines such as Unity and UE5
Shipped at least 2 games or worked on a live service game for 2 years
Prioritize our players when making design decisions considering their diversity, limitations to their cognitive and physical abilities
Proficient in user experience design tools (e.g. Figma, Adobe Creative Suite, Adobe XD, etc)
Create clear and informative documentation
Have a strong sense for when the game’s graphic design supports or undermines the usability needs of a feature


Bonus if you are:


Experienced with developing UX/UI on AAA games
Comfortable with prototyping in game engine
Understand the differences and similarities of experience design on console, PC, and Mobile


Benefits

Interested … a bit about Escape Velocity:

Escape Velocity is a team of passionate, talented developers working at a studio that offers excellent benefits and what we believe is a fantastic project. But that doesn’t make us unique. What does make us special? We value the time, energy, and talent of our players and our colleagues. We want every hour spent developing and playing our games to be an incredibly rewarding and worthwhile use of your time. To that end, we are fully remote and support team members nearly anywhere in the world. We prioritize honesty, even when that means sharing bad news. We strive to give everyone autonomy so they can determine how best to work and play; and we care more about what you bring to the game and studio than how many hours you’re clocking. We believe in constant improvement across all areas – from the game itself to our production design – and are constantly re-evaluating how we spend our time to ensure that we’re not wasting yours and we’re all always working on the most important things. Finally (and perhaps most importantly) we’re dedicated to building a culture of play, which not only makes us better game makers, but also strengthens the bonds between us all.

How To Apply

Click apply and complete an application along with a Resume / CV, along with a Resume / CV. If we would like to move forward with your application, a member of the Recruiting Team will reach out to you and guide you through our process.

Escape Velocity is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, we are committed to hiring, promoting, and compensating employees based on their qualifications and demonstrated ability to perform job responsibilities.

Applications will be considered regardless of age, disability, gender identity, sexual orientation, religion, belief, race, or any other protected category.

Description

Title: UI Designer

Location: Hybrid

Terms: Full-time

Clearance: Qualified candidates must be US citizens and able to obtain a minimum of a Public Trust clearance

RESULTS. INNOVATION. VALUES. ACCOUNTABILITY.

That’s RIVA.  Our employee-first approach has manifested a culture that attracts the best and brightest.  By investing in people first, and providing a flexible work environment, our employees have higher morale, higher productivity rates, and lower turnover. At RIVA, people are our #1 priority.

Description

RIVA Solutions Inc. is seeking a UI Designer to support the Nuclear Regulatory Commission (NRC) website migration project.  The ideal candidate has experience designing user journeys, mockups, and prototypes optimized for a wide rand of devises and interfaces. Expectations include supporting the efficient migration and digital experience throughout the project's lifecycle.

Responsibilities:


Identify solutions to customer problems based on validated insights from the User Research team
Manage the planning, design, and implementation of multiple sites and applications across multiple clients simultaneously in a fast-paced environment
Collaborate with team of developers, engineers customer to define, design, and implement innovative, beautiful, intuitive digital solutions for use by our federal customer and their stakeholders
Collaborate with UX and design research specialists in the analysis of user research to inform the design of highly usable web pages, application interfaces, and other dynamic solutions
Create wireframes, storyboards, and site maps to effectively communicate interaction and design ideas for websites, applications, and other digital solutions
Create scalable design resources to aid in project collaboration and the expansion of creative services



Requirements:

 


Minimum Education: BS/BA degree (Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent)  
Minimum Experience: 6-8 years’ experience in related field



Desired Qualifications:


5+ years combined professional design experience (UI Design, Graphic Design, CX/UX, Design Research)
Strong online portfolio that showcases the candidate’s ability to make research-driven decisions in the design of responsive web and mobile applications
Results-oriented problem solver with high standards for quality, accuracy, attention to detail, and overall excellence
Strong understanding of the life cycle process of website development (discovery, planning, design, requirements, coding, testing, and user testing and evaluation)
Strong understanding of user interface design standards
Experience designing web and mobile applications that are compliant with 508 and US Web Design System (USWDS) standards
Experience prioritizing features while accounting for user goals and business requirements
Experience carrying designs from start to finish, from wireframes to delivery of final high-fidelity UI mockups
Experience establishing and maintaining rapid customer feedback loops to inform design at critical stages
Self-starter, motivated, confident, and can work independently as well as in a team environment
Success on projects designed from scratch as well as redesigns for established platforms or products
Advanced proficiency in Adobe XD, InDesign, Illustrator, and Photoshop
Excellent interpersonal and client-focused skills—interacts well with all levels of staff and partners with a positive and enthusiastic attitude
Advanced coding knowledge (HTML, CSS, and JS)
Experience using Agile methodology to manage projects
Experience creating and modifying data visualizations
Experience evaluating existing systems and processes to identify UI issues and develop UI recommendations
Understanding of user research methodologies, user-centered design principles, and frameworks
Understanding of user personas, user flows, affinity mapping, and other research tools
Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite



RIVA Solutions is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any protected class. If you need a reasonable accommodation to search for a job opening or to submit an online application, please email [email protected]. Only messages left for this purpose will be returned.

Join us at RIVA Solutions, where your talents are valued, and your growth is our priority.

What You'll Do

The role of the Talent Acquisition Manager (TAM) is to drive the full spectrum of the recruiting efforts and to fulfill the consulting staff people needs for the Los Angeles office, including event planning and execution, candidate pipeline development, marketing and branding related activities, planning and participating in the interview process, candidate communication and relationship building, and all conversion activities. This role will work with the Recruiting Managing Director and Partner (RMDP), Recruiting Directors (RDs), Regional Talent Acquisition Manager, Business Management Director, recruiting directors at core schools, and regional recruiting teams to lead and execute the annual recruiting pipeline, entry-level core business consulting (Associates and Consultants) and experienced hire pools, as well as support Experienced Hire, Digital, and Analytics recruiting efforts for the office.

This individual reports directly to the Talent Acquisition Manager (TAM), but also works closely with the Recruiting Managing Director and Partner (RMDP), Recruiting Director (RD), and regional Talent Acquisition leadership.

YOU'RE GOOD AT


Driving the Los Angeles office recruiting strategy development (jointly with TAM, RMDP, RDs)
Overseeing office-specific recruiting efforts in support of annual Consultant and Associate hiring targets:
Candidate pipeline development
Sourcing, screening, interviewing, and converting candidates from managed schools/programs, formal channels (e.g., online applications, referrals), and candidates from "alternate" / industry sources
Decision-round interviewing
Offeree conversion
Responsible for developing processes and driving change for new initiatives (e.g., short lead time recruiting, ADC recruiting, going deeper at core schools, strengthen presence at other schools)
Manage, lead, and develop the Los Angeles office recruiting team (currently scoped as 2 direct reports)
Ensuring diversity, equity, and inclusion strategies and principles are incorporated throughout the steps in the hiring process, from pipeline development to conversion; recommend creative and results-oriented ideas to cultivate a diverse pipeline
Managing the recruiting commitments process - e.g., select interview cadres, staff events, ensuring the right mix of consulting staff (tenure, gender, school background), making sure commitments are upheld, managing swaps process
Managing the annual budget for Los Angeles office recruiting and internship activities
Collecting and analyzing information and data to evaluate the effectiveness of recruiting efforts
Acting as an initial contact for candidates for the Los Angeles office; responding and following up with all candidate inquiries; establishing and building relationships with top priority candidates
Scheduling, planning, and executing office-specific recruiting events
Liaising with HR for "on-boarding" of new hires (offer letters, signing bonuses, etc.)
Preparing analysis and required reports, utilizing the regional analytics team as necessary
Planning and executing welcome weekends
Ensuring communication with staff around events (confirmations, logistics, feedback from the event)
Managing summer internship programs, including coordination and execution of orientation, training, case staffing, performance evaluation, and affiliation events
Helping to lead and drive continuous improvement efforts in office recruiting; Working with other offices to improve recruiting efforts
Managing short lead time recruiting efforts for the office in close coordination with the region; working with the regional Experienced Hire recruiting team and executive recruiters to fill office Project Leader, Principal, or Expert positions
Ensuring recruiting records, global database, and metrics are up to date and accurate
Understanding and enforcing company and function policies, and managing risk
Building networks and liaising with peers in other offices as well as regional recruiting to ensure alignment on all initiatives; actively participate in the Talent Acquisition Office Leads team calls, meetings, and joint work
Select specific responsibilities to deliver on above including:
Specialist training and engagement
Decision round candidate selection
Candidate coaching and feedback, relationship support
Conversion strategy and Offeree Captain coordination
Offeree weekend and summer program strategy
Conversion tracking
Special analysis / project coordination
Partner and Principal meeting, and staff meeting support
Supporting other office initiatives, such as affiliation and engagement
Leading and executing strategic projects as needed



You Bring (experience & Qualifications)

Education and experience:


Bachelor's Degree or equivalent required, MBA or other graduate degree strongly preferred
8-10 or more years of previous recruiting, HR or other related experience. Prior professional services recruiting experience is a plus
Supervisory/management experience required
Consulting experience or exposure a plus
Experience working successfully within a complex matrix structured organization
Flexibility and some travel required, particularly around peak recruiting season and planning weeks. Attendance at key evening and weekend events required


Functional and soft skills:


Strong organizational skills with strong attention to detail, accuracy and thoroughness
Ability to set priorities, plan workflow and take initiative
Analytical proficiency; facility with numbers
Ability to work effectively with all levels of the organization and work well under pressure
Ability to understand and manage complex reporting relationships and incorporate multiple labor laws and cultures
Strong interpersonal and communication skills, positive personal and professional image, high standards of professional behavior and ethics
Demonstrated leadership ability; works well as team player
Excellent oral and written communication skills; able to effectively persuade, influence, and negotiate
Comfortable in resolving conflict and people related issues
Ability to perform successfully in a fast-paced, intellectually intense, service- oriented environment and to interpret rules and guidelines flexibly to enhance the business and in keeping with BCG's values and culture
Display a high degree of flexibility in a demanding, fast-paced, and frequently changing environment
Balance competing priorities while keeping constant sight of overall objectives
Display strong service orientation in responding to internal and external customer needs
Recognize and maintain confidentiality
Display self-starting attitude and be proactive; work as a team player; seek and act on feedback as appropriate
Self-motivated, takes initiative, possesses creative problem-solving skills and willingness to offer suggestions for improvement; builds relationships to leverage resource


Technical skills:


Exceptional PowerPoint and Excel skills; general computer and database proficiency
Industries: Non-profit Organizations and Primary and Secondary Education

Job_description:
Do you like creating beautiful websites and great user experiences? Do you have a passion for user experience, web design and front-end development using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and the latest modern frameworks? An innate curiosity for learning new technology? A desire to be productive with it from Day One? Then this job opportunity is what you are looking for.




This role will support our Protiviti Applications team. Robert Half is a cloud-first organization and wants you to jump right into a variety of projects involving designing websites using tools such as Adobe Photoshop, Sketch, Figma, or Adobe XD. Get experience working in an agile environment where your contributions matter.




Highlights:




Design and deliver wireframes, user stories, user journeys, mockups optimized for a wide range of devices and interfaces.
Identify design problems and devise elegant solutions.
Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders to understand detailed requirements and design complete user experiences that meet client needs and vision.
Conduct user research to gather insights into how users interact with the company's applications, identify pain points, and understand their needs.




What You Need:




BA or equivalent
2+ years of experience in User Experience Design (not limited to visual/graphic, interactive, product, user experience, user research)
Experience in using UX design best practices to design solutions, a deep understanding of mobile-first and responsive design.
Ability to iterate designs and solutions efficiently based on user feedback. Strong knowledge of creating personas through user research and data.
Experience in leveraging complex workflows into intuitive UIs specifically for enterprise-level applications.
Proven UX/UI experience with a strong portfolio demonstrating past work experience creating usable, aesthetically pleasing apps focused on usability.
This position requires someone who can combine aesthetics with functionality while considering the complexities typically associated with enterprise-level applications.
A great candidate will understand how business users interact with software at a large scale in order to create efficient systems that improve productivity for these users.
Demonstrated skills in task modeling, wire frame and user flow diagramming, usability testing, information architecture, interaction design, user centered design, usability methodologies, industry standards and trends Highly proficient in Adobe XD, Sketch, Figma, Photoshop, and Illustrator
Basic understanding of Html, CSS, and Javascript
Solid understanding on each phase of the UX process and have participated in end-to-end projects.
Excellent oral/written communication skills.
All applicants must have an online portfolio accompanying their resume/cv.

Main Responsibilities & Additional Requirements

Capable of designing simple and elegant for typical end users

Capable of accommodating important edge use cases to assure an awesome experience

Able to understand and compliment the work of the technical and engineering development and operational staff they work with to deliver results

Able to proactively stay in touch with their end user community to assure they understand and deliver on their needs

Willing to collaborate in a larger design community to strengthen the results of their specific program commitments

Preferred Qualifications

Experience defining and maintaining design patterns and UX standards

Excellent communication, presentation, interpersonal and analytical skills including the ability to communicate complex, interactive design concepts clearly and persuasively across different audiences and varying levels of the organization

Experience driving user research/usability tests and interpreting usability test data

Familiarity with the technical considerations involved in designing for complex systems

Customer-obsessed, detail-oriented and comfortable working on highly technical teams.

An unfailing passion and capacity to advocate on behalf of our users.

Experienced Adobe XD / Figma / Sketch user

Employment Type: Full Time, Mid-level

Department: Developer

CGS is seeking a talented, driven UI Designer to join our team helping our national security customers achieve deeper stakeholder engagement through the iterative, research-driven, user-centered design of their core applications and websites. In this role, you will lead efforts to design mission-critical applications and websites that provide seamless user experiences driven by modern, innovative interfaces. The ideal candidate possesses experience leading the iterative prototyping and design of modern, responsive web pages, applications, and other digital solutions that exceed the expectations of both clients and end users.

CGS brings motivated, highly skilled, and creative people together to solve the government’s most dynamic problems with cutting-edge technology. To carry out our mission, we are seeking candidates who are excited to contribute to government innovation, appreciate collaboration, and can anticipate the needs of others. Here at CGS, we offer an environment in which our employees feel supported, and we encourage professional growth through various learning opportunities.

Skills and attributes for success:


Ability to identify solutions to customer problems based on validated insights from the User Research team
Ability to manage the planning, design, and implementation of multiple sites and applications across multiple clients simultaneously in a fast-paced environment
Ability to collaborate with ECS engineers and federal clients to define, design, and implement innovative, beautiful, intuitive digital solutions for use by our federal customer and their stakeholders
Ability to collaborate with ECS UX and design research specialists in the analysis of user research to inform the design of highly usable web pages, application interfaces, and other dynamic solutions
Ability to create wireframes, storyboards, and site maps to effectively communicate interaction and design ideas for websites, applications, and other digital solutions
Ability to create scalable design resources to aid in project collaboration and the expansion of ECS creative services



Qualifications:


Must be a US Citizen
Must be able to obtain a Public Trust
Bachelor's Degree or equivalent experience
5+ years combined professional design experience (UI Design, Graphic Design, CX/UX, Design Research)
Strong online portfolio that showcases the candidate’s ability to make research-driven decisions in the design of responsive web and mobile applications
Results-oriented problem solver with high standards for quality, accuracy, attention to detail, and overall excellence
Strong understanding of the life cycle process of website development (discovery, planning, design, requirements, coding, testing, and user testing and evaluation)
Strong understanding of user interface design standards
Experience designing web and mobile applications that are compliant with 508 and US Web Design System (USWDS) standards
Experience prioritizing features while accounting for user goals and business requirements
Experience carrying designs from start to finish, from wireframes to delivery of final high-fidelity UI mockups
Experience establishing and maintaining rapid customer feedback loops to inform design at critical stages
Self-starter, motivated, confident, and can work independently as well as in a team environment
Success on projects designed from scratch as well as redesigns for established platforms or products
Advanced proficiency in Adobe XD, InDesign, Illustrator, and Photoshop



Ideally, you will also have:


Excellent interpersonal and client-focused skills—interacts well with all levels of staff and partners with a positive and enthusiastic attitude
Advanced coding knowledge (HTML, CSS, and JS)
Experience using Agile methodology to manage projects
Experience creating and modifying data visualizations
Experience evaluating existing systems and processes to identify UI issues and develop UI recommendations
Understanding of user research methodologies, user-centered design principles, and frameworks
Understanding of user personas, user flows, affinity mapping, and other research tools
Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite



Our Commitment

Contact Government Services (CGS) strives to simplify and enhance government bureaucracy through the optimization of human, technical, and financial resources. We combine cutting-edge technology with world-class personnel to deliver customized solutions that fit our client’s specific needs. We are committed to solving the most challenging and dynamic problems.

For the past seven years, we’ve been growing our government contracting portfolio, and along the way, we’ve created valuable partnerships by demonstrating a commitment to honesty, professionalism, and quality work.

We care about our employees. Therefore, we offer a comprehensive benefits package:


Health, Dental, and Vision
Life Insurance
401k
Flexible Spending Account (Health, Dependent Care, and Commuter)
Paid Time Off and Observance of State/Federal Holidays



Contact Government Services, LLC is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Applicants will be considered without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

Join our team and become part of government innovation!

Explore additional job opportunities with CGS on our Job Board:

https://cgsfederal.com/join-our-team/

For more information about CGS please visit: https://www.cgsfederal.com or contact:

Email: info@cgsfederal.com

Join a team of professionals who are passionate about their work, love cross-training and the adoption of cutting-edge technologies. We care about our developers by fostering an environment in which they can thrive by providing them the tools and training necessary to get the job done. We are looking for serious UI/UX Designers to ensure that all elements of the online user experience are optimized for improved usability, usefulness, and exceptional visual design. You will be working in a highly open and collaborative environment following a Scrum methodology. Our team is a place where we encourage self-starters, and everyone’s ideas are heard and valued!




What you’ll be doing is working on various client-facing and internal-facing projects. Every client has different needs that often require the adoption of new technologies and methods. Job duties include:




Delivering the best online user experience
Creating wireframes and prototypes
Illustrating design ideas using storyboards, process flows and sitemaps
Research, discovery, and usability testing
Designing graphic user interface elements, like menus, tabs and widgets
Building interfaces using HTML5 / CSS3
Modifying existing Angular apps
Providing recommendations and evaluations for new designs and architecture
Staying current on new technologies and best practices
Working in technologies in which you are unfamiliar and learning it as you go




Requirements




What we’re looking for is someone who is open to new ideas and willing to learn. This position focuses on designing and developing solutions for our new and existing projects. A candidate can be successful in this position if they exhibit:




Passion for the work they do
5+ years of UI/UX design experience
Experience creating Wireframes and Protoypes
A portfolio that demonstrates a range and depth of skill designing beautiful and effective software experiences
Current knowledge of latest UI/UX trends, techniques, and technologies
Experience with various design tools like Adobe XD, Adobe CC Suite (Illustrator, Photoshop, etc..), Visual Studio Code, Git, Azure DevOps
HTML5 and CSS3 skills with the ability to translate designs to developers
Ability to solve complex problems without assistance
A personality and work style that fits with an agile mindset and culture
Desire and willingness to work on new skills and technologies
Strong verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills
Preferred:




Bachelor's degree
UI development experience
Some JavaScript knowledge




LOCATION AND OTHER REQUIREMENTS




Must be located within commuting distance of Tampa, the role is remote but an occasional visit to the office may be requested
Candidates must be authorized to work in the US without sponsorship (no subcontracts or visa sponsorship)




Benefits




ABOUT THE COMPANY




ClearlyAgile is one of the fastest growing Agile companies in the Tampa Bay area. We foster career growth and are focused on having fun while delivering quality products and services to our clients. With Unlimited Paid Time Off; 10 Paid Holidays; Medical, Vision, and Dental benefits; Employee Ownership; 401(k); paid training certifications; and very competitive compensation plans, ClearlyAgile strives to listen to and invest in its most important asset…its people.




Our Mission: Transform our customer’s businesses using Agile methodologies and principles to help them succeed in a flexible, collaborative, self-organizing and fast-paced environment.




Our Values: We hire and reward based on our core values.




Show Your Passion - Have passion for what you do. Be an active learner with a commitment to grow. Attend and participate in events!
Be a Champion of Agile - Spread the word. Back it up with examples, case studies, and data points. Lead by example
Teamwork - Be cooperative and collaborative while maintaining a team-first mindset
Customer-centric - Always focus on the client and their customers. See the world from their perspectives
Quality - Maintain a sense of pride in the quality of your work and the collective work of the team
Be a Leader - Empower yourself to make decisions and don’t be paralyzed by fear of failure




We are an equal opportunity employer and committed to a diverse workforce.




To learn more about us, visit our website at www.clearlyagile.com.

Contract (12+ Months)- Hybrid

Location: Alpharetta, GA

Our client a large financial services organization is looking for a strong UX designer to join their design language group. They are a close-knit group of designers and front-end engineers who work across all business verticals to maintain and advocate for our design system. They are seeking a UI Engineer to evolve and mature the design system for their web and mobile platforms. You will work as an advocate for the design system across the design team, as well as with business and technology partners. You will be an advocate for best code practices as well as be a collaborator with technology partners to ensure our Design Language library continues to be a framework that is easily implemented in projects. You should be familiar with implementing a design system.

Responsibilities


Build and document new patterns for our established design system
Work closely with our front-end development teams to ensure coding best practices are met
Maintain Design Language frameworks including our CSS framework and React component libraries
Create functioning prototypes of experiences or components
Contribute beyond the design system itself by helping to build out projects when needed
Establish requirements for new components and component enhancements


Requirements


5+ years relevant work experience
Experience working with design systems
Experience documenting code contributions to a shared framework
Proficient knowledge of modern web frameworks including
React Proficient knowledge of best practices in HTML/CSS
Good understanding of CSS pre-processing platforms such as Sass
Experience applying accessibility best practices (WCAG)
Familiarity with the AGILE process


Additional Skills Needed


Great eye for visual details
Excellent communication skills
Pride in the work delivered and tremendous attention to detail
Go the extra mile to deliver on time and to high quality standards
Curiosity about problem solving and learning about finance
Self-disciplined, self-motivating, and self-improving
Effectively communicate and present complex conceptual thinking visually and verbally

BE PART OF BUILDING THE FUTURE.

What do NASA and emerging space companies have in common with COVID vaccine R&D teams or with Roblox and the Metaverse?

The answer is data, -- all fast moving, fast growing industries rely on data for a competitive edge in their industries. And the most advanced companies are realizing the full data advantage by partnering with Pure Storage. Pure’s vision is to redefine the storage experience and empower innovators by simplifying how people consume and interact with data. With 11,000+ customers including 58% of the Fortune 500, we’ve only scratched the surface of our ambitions .

Pure Is Blazing Trails And Setting Records


For ten straight years, Gartner has named Pure a leader in the Magic Quadrant
Our customer-first culture and unwavering commitment to innovation have earned us a certified Net Promoter Score in the top 1% of B2B companies globally
Industry analysts and press applaud Pure’s leadership across these dimensions
And, our 5,000+ employees are emboldened to make Pure a faster, stronger, smarter company as we go


If you, like us, say “bring it on” to exciting challenges that change the world, we have endless opportunities where you can make your mark.

SHOULD YOU ACCEPT THIS CHALLENGE...

We are seeking a talented and experienced Sr. UX Designer to join our team of Puritans in the Digital Demand Center (DDC) in Pure Storage’s Marketing Organization. As the Sr. UX Designer, you will work closely with Pure’s UX and Web Marketing professionals and will play a crucial role in maintaining and evolving our design system, and continuously improving the efficiency and quality of the user experience across our digital and web products. Your expertise in Figma, component design, high-quality production, and UX optimization will be pivotal in shaping the way we approach design, development and production now and in the future. You love this stuff, you have no/low ego, and an uncanny ability to solve problems and be a connector for our people and create work we can all be proud of and stand behind… a high Pureformer.

Primary Responsibilities


Design, deliver and manage dynamic components within Figma that adhere to our digital design system goals.
Work collaboratively with Web Producers to build an ever evolving strategy for our digital and web products, and support a high-volume of production and publishing requests.
Write detailed hand-off specifications for the development team, including assets, interactions, and animations.
Maintain and update Pure’s digital design system, ensuring that all components are up to date, versioned, and optimized for maximum efficiency.
Work closely with UX/UI designers to ensure that design system components align with overall design principles and user-centered design practices.
Illustrate design ideas by producing high-quality solutions including customer journey maps, flow diagrams, storyboards, wireframes, site maps
Conduct regular audits of the design system and leverage UX research insights to identify areas for improvement, updates, and refinements.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather feedback, answer questions, and provide necessary support for the development of design system components, and assets for web publishing.
Stay up to date with industry trends, design tools, and emerging technologies to continually enhance our digital and web products.
Create, distribute and maintain page and pattern templates, as needed.


Additional Qualifications

WHAT YOU’LL NEED TO BRING TO THIS ROLE...


10+ years of experience in UX Web Design and Research.
Experience design and documentation for components on Adobe Experience Manager Platform.
Proficiency in Figma, including advanced skills in creating and managing components, libraries, and design systems.
Strong understanding of UX principles and user-centered design practices.
Ability to understand business objectives and translate company goals into digital experiences
Excellent communication skills, including the ability to write clear and detailed hand-off specifications and documentation.
Experience working with development teams and a deep understanding of the development process.
Solid knowledge and working experience of front-end technologies, HTML, JS, CSS, and the capabilities and limitations of web technologies.
Proven track record of successfully managing and maintaining design systems.
Ability to work effectively as a team member, managing your time and tasks independently as well as collaboratively.
Strong organizational skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks and manage multiple projects simultaneously.
Experience building Figma widgets/plugins and/or motion graphic animation is a strong plus.
A portfolio demonstrating your expertise in design system management, Figma component design, and web or application design and processes.


If you're a passionate design professional with a knack for managing design systems, optimizing user experiences, and collaborating effectively with cross-functional teams, we invite you to apply for this exciting opportunity. Join our team and help shape the future of our Pure Storage web properties.

You will be based in Santa Clara, CA. As this is an office-centric role, you are expected to be present in the office for 3 days a week. As outlined in Pure's Hybrid Work Policy, there will be variations over periods of time, depending on business need.

The annual base salary range is: $158,000 – $238,000. Salary ranges are determined based on role, level and location. For positions open to candidates in multiple geographical locations, the base salary range is reflective of the labor market across the applicable locations.

This role may be eligible for incentive pay and/or equity.

And because we understand the value of bringing your full and best self to work, we offer a variety of perks to manage a healthy balance, including flexible time off, wellness resources, and company-sponsored team events - check out purebenefits.com for more information.

Through our Pure Equality program, which supports a flourishing field of employee resource groups, we nourish the personal and professional lives of our team members. And our Pure Good Foundation gives back to local and global communities through volunteering and grants.

Job_title: Senior UX Designer- Future Opportunity, Freelance
Job_description:
We anticipate hiring a freelance Senior UX Designer this year who enjoys collaborating with strategists, creatives and technologists to shape great brand experiences. You understand the user-centered design process and are able to both conduct research and to design experiences with clients, customers and team members. You are confident and inspiring. Your key role is to collaborate across disciplines to define, document, and create innovative and memorable experiences. This is not a current opening, but if your background aligns to what we are looking for, we will reach out to you directly.

What You’ll Do


Facilitate and collaborate with multi-disciplinary project teams
Work closely with cross-functional teams to define project objectives, user needs, content requirements, and technical specifications
Conduct stakeholder interviews, user research, usability studies and competitive audits, and convert findings into insights that impact design
Conduct assessments of existing properties, and synthesize findings into best practices for usability, content, and experience design
Create and document compelling interaction design solutions via findings, personas, journeys, mental models, site maps, prototypes and detailed annotated wireframes that illustrate user needs, experience structure, process flow, layout, and informational relationships
Create low-, medium-, and /or high-fidelity prototypes that inform the design process
Present concepts and deliverables to internal stakeholders and clients


What We’re Looking For


Portfolio that includes examples of the complete User Experience design process within project case studies including setting strategy, defining scope, exploring structure, and creating wireframes
Proven experience as a senior-level UX contributor on executions including digital products, e-commerce platforms, websites, mobile applications, and interactive and immersive experiences
Proficiency in design tools such as Adobe XD, Figma, and Sketch
Excellent analytical and process-oriented skills
Excellent presentation, verbal and written skills
A multi-tasker who enjoys working collaboratively on multiple projects with interdisciplinary teams
7+ years of experience in the user experience field
A bachelor’s degree in Interaction Design, Information Science, Library Science, Human Factors or related subject, or equivalent experience


POP is an Equal Opportunity Employer that is committed to an inclusive and diverse workplace. All qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment. POP will not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, physical or mental disability, age, or other legally protected status. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request to careers@wearepop.com.

The Environmental Working Group (EWG), a leading environmental health research and advocacy organization, seeks a senior UX/UI designer for its Washington, D.C., office.

Since 1993, EWG has shined a spotlight on outdated legislation, harmful agricultural practices and industry loopholes that pose a risk to our health and the health of the environment.

Whether it’s on Capitol Hill or in communities across America, we make our voices heard, changing the debate over environmental health and putting the most important people – you and your family – at the center of the conversation.

As a senior UX/UI designer, you will play a key role in our innovative team shaping the user experience of our digital products, ensuring they align with our mission to protect health and the environment.

We are looking for a unicorn, capable of jumping in along every phase of the UX design process from user research to front-end development, having the greatest impact for our cross-disciplined team of designers and developers.

What you will do:


Lead the design and development of intuitive and visually appealing digital products.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define design requirements and user stories.
Create wireframes, prototypes, and high-fidelity designs for various digital platforms.
Conduct user research and usability testing to gather feedback and iterate on designs.
Ensure consistent brand representation and user experience across all digital products.
Collaborate with developers to implement and refine designs.
Stay informed about industry trends, emerging technologies, and design best practices.
Translate design mockups into pixel-perfect HTML, CSS, JavaScript templates.


Qualifications:


5+ years of experience in product design, with a focus on digital platforms.
Proven track record of successfully bringing digital products from concept to launch.
Proficiency in design tools such as Sketch, Figma, or Adobe Creative Suite.
Strong portfolio showcasing UX/UI projects and design thinking.
Experience with user research and usability testing methodologies.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
Detail-oriented with a keen eye for aesthetics and user experience.
Comfortable managing multiple projects with varying complexities.
Experience with native app design for both iOS and Android
Basic knowledge of front-end development (HTML, CSS, JavaScript, etc.)


Preferred qualifications:


Experience in a nonprofit or advocacy organization is a plus.
Experience with Drupal is also a plus.
Experience with Ruby on Rails, React, MVC, etc. is ideal.


Location: Washington, D.C., office.

Benefits: Salary is commensurate with experience. EWG offers fully paid, excellent health care, paid parental leave and a tax-deferred 403(b) plan, including matched contributions. It’s a casual, growing office with more than 70 engaging co-workers.

EWG’s commitment to diversity and inclusion:

EWG celebrates diversity and is committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We are proud to foster a work environment that supports, inspires and respects all individuals.

EWG does not discriminate against any employee or applicant on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, citizenship, ancestry, marital status, family responsibilities, physical or mental disability, military or veteran status, medical condition, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, matriculation or political affiliation, or any other protected class recognized in any of the jurisdictions where EWG has offices or employees working.

We adhere to these principles in all aspects of employment, including recruitment, hiring, training, and compensation and promotion.

In this role you will:


Participate in concept sessions leveraging ethnographic research and design thinking
Introduce trends and exemplars across a variety of emerging technologies
Balance customer frictions and needs with our client's business goals, market viability, and technical feasibility
Deliver concepts, personas, user journeys, storyboards, system maps, user flows, wireframes, visual design comps, and prototypes with Figma, Adobe CS, InVision, and other tools
Incorporate user research and usability testing to iterate on product solutions
Collaborate effectively with multi-disciplinary teams including management consultants, product managers, engineers, marketers, and corporate executives
Communicate the product's vision and articulate design decisions and trade-offs to partners and clients, both verbally and visually
Partner with engineering to ensure designs are properly implemented
Develop brand guidelines, online advertising, and websites
Contribute to the design cohort through knowledge sharing and presentations with other designers


You should have:


5+ years of professional experience as an Experience Designer building, prototyping, and continually evolving digital products from ideation to implementation
Strong ability to convey concepts through storyboards, user flows, user journeys, wireframes, prototypes, etc
Expertise in visual design and prototyping tools such as Figma, Adobe CS, and Zeplin
Ability to communicate the process, approach, and impact of your design in verbal and visual presentation
Excellent people management skills to collaborate with colleagues and cross-functional teams
Ability to excel in a dynamic, ever-changing environment
Ability to travel up to 20-25% of the time
A ready, online portfolio
Industries: Non-profit Organizations and Primary and Secondary Education

The International Mission Board, a nonprofit religious organization in Richmond, VA, is hiring for an UI/UX Designer!

Location: Richmond, VA Headquarters

Rate: Commensurate with experience + great benefits

The UI/UX Designer will work with web developers, Creative, Customer Experience, and stakeholders to create best-in-class digital products and experiences that are easy to use and understand, aesthetically pleasing with clear call to actions, and promote better user interaction and engagement. Effectively utilizing industry tools and best practices, the UI/UX Designer will understand IMB current and target audiences, coupled with the goals and vision of the organization, to produce compelling user experiences that drive completion of call to actions and high customer satisfaction.

Responsibilities:


Produce high-quality solutions through flow diagrams, graphic designs, storyboards, site maps and wireframes to enhance the customer experience on IMB digital properties, including IMB websites, mobile apps, and other digital experiences.
Identify target user groups based on research and analysis of internal and external data, conduct interviews or other types of inquiries, and document research findings and recommendations.
Perform tests on user interface elements such as CTAs, layouts, target links, landing pages and banners. Understand product specifications and user psychology and predict what might work for both.
Conduct research and analysis of competitor digital properties. Maintain a competitive edge against competitor products and industry trends. Report on findings. Provide recommendations for improvements.
Create and distribute reports on website user experience progress including insights into key findings. Report on wins and make recommendations for improvements when applicable.


Requirements:


Bachelor's Degree in UI/UX Design, Marketing, Digital Marketing or Communications, preferred.
At least one year UI/UX, digital marketing or similar experience
Working knowledge of the following technologies and software: Figma, Sketch, InVision, Visio, HTML, CSS (SCSS), iOS, Android, Design Systems, and Adobe Creative Suite
Ability to assess a situation, seek multiple perspectives, gather more information, come to best case conclusions and/or solutions.
Proven experience with managing multiple projects with competing deadlines and priorities in a timely manner.
Ability to generate, interpret and analyze reporting and data
Effective written and verbal communication


Benefits and Perks:


Medical, dental, vision, HSA and FSA benefit plans (and more!)
403(b) Retirement plan with employer match up to 8%!
21 days of accrued PTO + 11 holidays + the week between Christmas and New Year’s paid off
See our complete Benefits Package for Full Time Regular employees here


Worker Type:

Employee

Regular

Time Type:

Full time

UX Researcher       Location: Dearborn MI/Hybrid/Remote  Duration: 12 months       Description:  Seeking an innovative, strategic, and expansive thinker to provide both expertise and inspiration as a User Experience Researcher for our financial suite of products.  You’re at the forefront of setting strategic direction for our products and championing the voice of the user throughout our organization.  We dive deep with our customers to understand what they really want and need and help our product teams turn those insights into actionable steps.  We are an empathetic, inclusive, and curiosity-driven team who serve as close partners with our product team members and fierce advocates for our users.       Skills Required:  Leading high level, strategic research initiatives utilizing innovative research methods and experiments to help drive product direction for the organization.  Partnering with Product Managers, UX Designers, and other product team members to understand customer needs and opportunities.  Owning the user research process for your products throughout the product lifecycle, from problem definition and research planning to synthesis and stakeholder buy-in.  Planning, conducting, and facilitating user research sessions such as user interviews, contextual inquiry, co-creation workshops, data analysis, lean experimentation, etc.  Championing user experience research and design to departments across the company.       Skills Preferred:  High level strategic thinking and analysis for both early stage concepts and established products.  Ability to thrive in and make sense of highly ambiguous problem spaces.  Ability to think outside the box and be creative to find the best and most suitable ways to get the answers needed for product direction.  Listening, being thoughtful, and having deep compassion and advocacy for the users of your products.  Owning your own work, processes, and direction for the research on your products.  Taking a highly collaborative approach with your partners in the product organization.  Helping coach and guide product teams on the value of user research and design.       Experience Required:  4+ years of experience as a User Researcher.  4+ years of experience leading user research initiatives for highly collaborative, multidisciplinary teams.       Experience Preferred: 6+ years of experience as a User Researcher.    Education Required: Bachelor’s degree    Education Preferred: Master’s, or PhD in user experience, human-computer interaction, sociology, anthropology, psychology, design, or related degree

Bright Vision Technologies has an immediate opportunity for UX Researcher at Lansing MI. with 5 years experience of UX research experience.

Candidate must work on our W2. Third party/employer candidates are not eligible for this role.

Job Title: UX Researcher

Job Location: Lansing MI

Job Type: Hybrid

Job Description:

As a UX researcher, you will be responsible for helping define and drive the design of state services or applications. You will reveal what our users need from our services by conducting research, working with cross-functional teams, and performing usability studies. These responsibilities also include inspiring change, delivering oral and written presentations, evaluating qualitative and quantitative data, and helping the UX team better understand what would make a user’s experience more intuitive and seamless.

Responsibilities:


Lead and co-lead primary and secondary user research by facilitating workshops, interviews, focus groups, and usability testing.
Plan and implement user research strategies and methodologies.
Organize and evaluate quantitative and qualitative research.
Conduct market and ethnographic research.
Work with cross-functional teams to identify and evaluate research topics and approaches.
Challenge the “status quo” and propose innovative solutions to complex business problems.
Present and promote research findings to program owners and business stakeholders.
Ask questions, gather data, and analyze data.
Use a diverse set of UX research tools.


Skills/Requirements:


Five or more years of UX research experience.
Strong understanding of UI Design.
Experience with:
Creating wireframes and prototypes and using various tools (Figma, Sketch, or equivalent).
Creating user personas and user journey maps.
Empathy mapping development.
Leading user workshops and facilitating sessions.
Generating insights from data and effectively sharing research results.
Planning and conducting usability testing.
Research-related tasks including research, planning, evaluating, and iteration.

About BLKBOX

BLKBOX is at the forefront of revolutionizing the marketing industry with its AI-powered omni-channel marketing platform. By identifying top-performing ad creatives for target audiences, our platform stands out, particularly with our acclaimed Video Production Platform. This platform allows for the production of hundreds of video iterations within minutes, drastically cutting down the cost of creative production. Our innovative solutions are designed to empower businesses to achieve unparalleled marketing success, ensuring they stay ahead in the competitive landscape.




Job Description

We are on the hunt for a Senior UX Designer who is not just adept in UI/UX but is also hands-on, ready to take on the challenge of revamping our existing solutions to make them world-class. This role is pivotal in shaping the future of our platform, ensuring that our interface and user experience are unrivaled. The ideal candidate will be instrumental in driving our platform’s design to new heights, ensuring that our innovative solutions are matched with an equally innovative user experience.




Key Responsibilities

Lead the redesign of our existing solutions, focusing on enhancing user experience and interface to meet and exceed world-class standards.
Employ a customer-first approach to design, prioritizing the creation of intuitive, user-friendly interfaces that enhance user engagement and satisfaction.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams including product management, engineering, and marketing to conceptualize and implement design solutions.
Utilize data-driven insights to inform design decisions, ensuring that the user experience is optimized for our target audience.
Create and iterate on wireframes, prototypes, user flow diagrams, and other design documents to effectively communicate design strategies and detailed interaction behaviors.
Stay abreast of the latest UI/UX trends, techniques, and technologies, applying them as appropriate to keep our platform at the cutting edge of design innovation.




Requirements

A portfolio that demonstrates excellence in both UI and UX, with a proven track record of leading significant design projects to successful completion.
Strong hands-on experience in UI/UX design, particularly within fast-paced startup environments.
Exceptional empathy for customers, with a keen ability to understand and anticipate user needs and preferences.
Proficiency in design tools (e.g., Sketch, Adobe Creative Suite, Figma) and a strong understanding of the latest web technologies and their impact on the feasibility of design solutions.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with a proven ability to work effectively across different teams and stakeholders.
A minimum of 5 years of experience in UI/UX design, with at least 2 years in a senior or lead design role.




What We Offer

A chance to be part of a rapidly growing startup that’s at the forefront of marketing technology.
An opportunity to work on a platform that’s changing the game in creative production, with a significant impact on the marketing industry.
A dynamic, fast-paced work environment where your work will directly influence the direction and success of our company.
Competitive compensation, health benefits, and a flexible work schedule to balance your work and personal life.




At BLKBOX, we believe in fostering a culture of innovation, where every team member is empowered to contribute to our shared vision. If you are a passionate UI/UX designer with a customer-first mindset and ready to make a significant impact at a fast-paced startup, we would love to hear from you.

Title: UI/UX Prototype Designer (Figma/Azure) (727253)Location: 1305 East Walnut StreetInterview: INTERVIEW DATES: Interviews will be conducted on [January 24, 25, 26] only to submit candidates available for interviews on the date(s) provided.This position will bring in expertise in interaction, user interface, and visual design (including illustration) to their collaborative UX environment and by working with UI/UX lead to create polished, well documented visual experiences.The perfect candidate will be an important voice in creating different UI components and creating UI designs that are best suited for mobile and web.In this role, you’ll be joining the product group in their UX sub-team. This team creates the core experiences and building blocks that make up their platform-wide user experience and are the stewards for development of shared standards and components. This includes their design system, dashboards and reporting, graph visualization and case management, global navigation, and UI extensibility.Responsibilities Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including product managers and developers, to understand project goals and user requirements. Design and iterate on user interface and experience prototypes, ensuring a seamless and intuitive user journey. Create wireframes, mockups, and interactive prototypes that effectively communicate design concepts and functionality. Transform wireframes and concepts into visually appealing and user-friendly interfaces. Conduct user research to gather insights and validate design decisions, incorporating feedback into iterative design processes. Stay updated on industry trends, design principles, and emerging technologies to enhance the overall user experience. Job Summary

We are seeking an experienced Lead UX Researcher to head our clients UX research team. This role is pivotal in understanding our users' needs, behaviors, and motivations through methodical investigation, to inform the development of innovative, user-friendly products. If you're passionate about making a tangible impact and leading a team to new heights, we'd love to hear from you.




Key Responsibilities

Lead and mentor a team of UX researchers, fostering a collaborative, productive, and innovative research environment.
Design and conduct user research studies, including surveys, interviews, usability testing, and field studies, across multiple platforms and devices.
Collaborate closely with UX/UI designers, product managers, and developers to integrate user research at every stage of the product development cycle.
Translate research findings into actionable insights and design recommendations, effectively communicating these to stakeholders at all levels.
Establish and oversee the user research roadmap, ensuring alignment with the company’s goals and product strategy.
Continuously evaluate and improve research methods and tools, staying abreast of industry trends and best practices.
Advocate for the user, embedding a user-centered design culture within the organization.




Qualifications

Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Human-Computer Interaction, Psychology, Social Science, or a related field.
A minimum of 5 years of experience in UX research, with at least 2 years in a leadership role.
Strong understanding of a wide range of qualitative and quantitative research methodologies.
Excellent analytical skills, with the ability to distill complex information into clear, actionable insights.
Proven track record of influencing product strategy and design decisions through research.
Exceptional communication and collaboration skills, with experience working in cross-functional teams.
Familiarity with UX design tools and software (e.g., Sketch, Adobe XD, Figma, Qualtrics, UserTesting.com).

Design. Disrupt. Repeat.




Be an agent of change on a team committed to achieving client-focused, mission-driven excellence. Steampunk is looking for an experienced UI/UX Designer with an appetite for taking on new challenges.




Responsibilities




Facilitate discovery and innovation workshops for a range of government audiences, from senior leaders to front-line implementers, utilizing human-centered methods, tools, and best practices
Collaborate with clients and stakeholders to co-design workshop agendas and exercises that help achieve strategic and tactical objectives
Synthesize research, insights, and data to help drive solutions for organizational challenges
Craft compelling stories and visual models to communicate insights and discoveries that will shape service innovations
Understand the relevance of and how to articulate journey maps, service blueprints, personas, ecosystem and experience maps
Understand how user research should be integrated into developing technology
Ensure all deliverables across a variety of projects are produced at the highest quality
Works with technical team members on the implementation of UX research techniques and usability testing activities.




Qualifications




4+ years of experience in human centered design, service design, and/or customer experience design
4+ years of experience delivering interface design solutions for various clients, including highly detailed annotated wireframes and user flows within complex web or mobile applications
Experience developing rapid prototypes and producing wireframes for user interfaces
Thorough knowledge and demonstrated experience applying design thinking methods and tools to solve end to end challenges
Experience in workshop facilitation and co-creation, including with groups of senior organizational leaders
Experience working in multi-disciplinary groups including UX and UI designers, technologists, and engineers
A natural curiosity for solving problems coupled with strong analytical skills
A collaborative nature with excellent written communication and presentation skills
Experience working in a project-based environment
Strong client communication skills
Degree or equivalent experience in HCD, HCI, service design, and/or experience design
Ability to obtain a U.S. government public trust




Steampunk is a Change Agent in the Federal contracting industry, bringing new thinking to clients in the Homeland, Federal Civilian, Health and DoD sectors. Through our Human-Centered delivery methodology, we are fundamentally changing the expectations our Federal clients have for true shared accountability in solving their toughest mission challenges. As an employee owned company, we focus on investing in our employees to enable them to do the greatest work of their careers – and rewarding them for outstanding contributions to our growth. If you want to learn more about our story, visit http//www.steampunk.com.




We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Steampunk participates in the E-Verify program.

Job Description *

One of Insight Global's largest Chemical Manufacture's is seeking to hire a UX Design Manager/Researcher to help improve the user experience for their customer facing digital platform. This person will be managing an offshore team of UX/UI Designers, executing user testing, ab testing, usability testing, and garnering qualitative results from both internal and external users to improve the user's experience. The testing could be executed either before release or after release to test users. The research being executed is not quantitative but qualitative. A self starter, someone who knows how to drive process will be a great fit for this role. Someone who is a high character professional who has excellent interpersonal skills would also be a perfect fit for the role.




We seek a User Experience (UX) Design Manager/Researcher to lead a team of designers working on innovative digital experiences. The ideal candidate will analyze customer behaviors, set up and lead research with internal and external users, identify opportunities to solve problems and create cohesive, best-in-class experiences for our customers. You and your team will define early concepts, collect VOB and VOC, articulate end-to-end experiences, and craft elegant design solutions to create a coherent user experience vision across customer journeys.

What You Will Do:

* Lead the entire design process of our digital products & services, from initial research, ideation, conceptualization, and design, to testing and validation.

* Plan and conduct primary and secondary research. Synthesize research, build insights, reframe problems, and provide recommendations that enable our teams to generate and iterate on new solutions.

* Develop and articulate best practices for UX research within product development activities with product teams, stakeholders, and external partners

* Be an integral member leading user research activities for our digital products and services, involved in initial discovery, ideation, conceptualization, and design, to testing and validation.

* Apply Human-Centered Design and Service Design Thinking approaches to guide the discovery and production of low-fidelity and high-fidelity deliverables.

* Plan and co-facilitate workshops internally and externally. Manage approaches that identify and solve complex problems.

* Create project deliverables such as low and high-fidelity UI prototypes, design using a Design System, discussion guides for research, insights reports, and presentations, among other materials relevant to the client challenge.

* Coordinate work activities with your digital team, business teams, and other IT services as required.










Required Skills and Experience *

- 8+ Years of UX Researcher Experience

- Experience Managing an offshore team of UI/UX Designers

- Experience with different Usability Tools

- Experience with Persona Mapping and Journey Mapping

- Experience with Usability Testing and AB Testing

- Experience with Running Design Thinking Workshops

- Experience with creation of wireframe and frameworks

- Local to Chicago IL/Naperville IL

- Bachelor's Degree










Nice to Have Skills and Experience

- Experience in an agile Methodology

- Experience with SAFe Methodology
Industries: Air, Water, and Waste Program Management
