Description

About VORTO

We are building software which enables businesses to be more economically and environmentally sustainable by digitally transforming the supply chain.

About The Role

We are looking for our first dedicated design hire to help Vorto bring AI to supply chains in the world’s largest companies. You’ll work with our product and engineering team to design interfaces that simplify complex business problems to a degree where adoption is effortless. Our product is sui generis, and as such requires our users to adopt new ways of thinking about procurement and logistics due to the level of automation we are bringing to the space.

Responsibilities


Partner with our CPO to define and solve the highest impact problems for our customers
Immerse yourself in the business & company strategy to understand our biggest opportunities for growth
Deeply understand a complex problem space and find simple, powerful solutions that use AI to minimize user interaction
Combine user experience with strategic, operational, and engineering concerns to design holistic solutions


Requirements


You value being part of an extremely fast paced team and use your role to constantly accelerate team velocity
You have 5+ years designing software at a product-driven company
You have designed customer facing, enterprise products
You have a portfolio showing your work, passions, process, and impact
You have strong analytical reasoning abilities, and can quickly decompose a problem to its fundamentals
You like solving complex, multi-faceted problems and enjoy exploring the ambiguity inherent to defining a new product category
You like shipping, and are willing to make hard tradeoffs in order to get features in the hands of customers
You’re a self-starter, who can proactively identify strategic opportunities for impact even when they’re not assigned to you
You enjoy collaboration, feedback, and iteration. You can explain the reasoning behind your design decisions and opinions
You’re comfortable in a high-growth startup, can balance many simultaneous projects, and thrive in fast-paced environments


Compensation: $125-155k

Benefits

At VORTO we are committed to developing our employees and providing them exciting opportunities to grow and prosper in their careers. We encourage you to visit our careers page and read this blog post to learn more about our culture.

We offer a competitive benefits package as well as numerous additional perks, including:


Competitive compensation package
Paid Time Off and Holidays
Health, Dental and Vision Insurance
401(k) retirement plan with company match
Flex and Health Savings Plans
Company-paid life and short-term disability insurance
Company-paid parking or RTD pass
Voluntary income protection benefits including Life, AD&D, Critical Illness, Hospital Indemnity, and Accident Protection Insurance
Tuition Assistance
Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
Free or discounted legal program
Product & Services Discount Program
Modern office space in downtown Denver with daily coffee, tea, drinks & snacks
We supply the industry's best hardware and productivity software


Vorto is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Planned Parenthood is the nation’s leading provider and advocate of high-quality, affordable sexual and reproductive health care for all people, as well as the nation’s largest provider of sex education. With more than 600 health centers across the country, Planned Parenthood organizations serve all patients with care and compassion, with respect, and without judgment, striving to create equitable access to health care. Through health centers, programs in schools and communities, and online resources, Planned Parenthood is a trusted source of reliable education and information that allows people to make informed health decisions. We do all this because we care passionately about helping people lead healthier lives.

Planned Parenthood Federation of America (PPFA) is a 501(c)(3) charitable organization that supports the independently incorporated Planned Parenthood affiliates operating health centers across the U.S. Planned Parenthood Action Fund is an independent, nonpartisan, not-for-profit membership organization formed as the advocacy and political arm of Planned Parenthood Federation of America. The Action Fund engages in educational, advocacy, and electoral activity, including grassroots organizing, legislative advocacy, and voter education.

Planned Parenthood Federation of America (PPFA) and Planned Parenthood Action Fund (PPAF) seek a UX Researcher. This job reports to the Associate Director of UX Research in the Digital Products department of PPFA. The Planned Parenthood Digital Products team provides reliable and scalable applications and technology programs and services in support of health care delivery, sex education, advocacy, fundraising, and internal operations. Digital Products is part of the Global Strategy and Innovation (GSI) division at PPFA.

Purpose:

The UX Researcher will conduct end-to-end user research projects to investigate our digital user’s knowledge, attitudes, behaviors, and intentions to help the Digital Products team evolve our products in ways that better serve our users and to share learnings broadly across the organization. The UX Researcher will report to the Associate Director of User Research.

Delivery:


Identify the most effective research methodologies and write detailed research plans including clear goals, objectives, and questions to guide your research efforts while collaborating with multiple stakeholders to understand business goals, user needs, and project requirements while developing empathy for end-users.
Create and conduct user interviews, surveys, focus groups, and co-design sessions to gather qualitative data and gain valuable insights.
Analyze and synthesize quantitative and qualitative research data sets into actionable insights and recommendations for Product and User Experience that directly influence product improvements and identify areas of opportunity that address the needs of the users while balancing the needs of the stakeholders.
Use specialized software such as Figma and Adobe to create custom deliverables (personas, timelines, service maps, empathy maps, user flows, wireframes, concept maps, competitive analysis, and charts) to help stakeholders understand and empathize with users.
Use Figma to build low to mid-fidelity, interactive prototypes for testing and validation, allowing stakeholders to experience the product firsthand.
Present research insights to Product leads, UX leads, stakeholders, and executive sponsors in a clear and visually engaging manner, making the data more accessible and understandable by using a variety of specialized research tools such as Google Slides, Figjam, and other research repository software such as Dovetail.


Engagement:


Collaborator and contributor to the PPFA’s digital strategy, while supporting four unique Digital Products teams: PP.org , Patient Access, Affiliate Engagement, and Chat/Text.
Strategic thought partner among interdisciplinary peers on scrum teams.
Manage research-related workflows that can be deployed across Digital Products teams at scale.


Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities (KSAs):


3+ years of experience designing, conducting, and synthesizing mixed-method user research across a range of complex products and tools and user demographics
Extensive experience with specialized research repository toolkits such as Dovetail and Google Sheets.
High proficiency in Google Jamboard, Google Forms, Looker, Figma, etc.
Demonstrated knowledge of planning and executing complicated research for complex technology systems
Experience with developing hypotheses for integrated A/B testing and interpreting the results of experiments from tests run in a production environment
Proven track record of generating actionable insights for a product or program strategy
Strong attention to detail and ability to anticipate needs and prepare accordingly.
Comfort with presenting in-progress work to stakeholders and executive sponsors early and frequently, demonstrating a willingness to seek continual feedback and constructive criticism in a supportive team-oriented environment.
Ability to work collaboratively and flexibly with a dynamic, fast-moving team, completing multiple tasks with poise, accuracy, and confidence.
Strong organizational, analytical, and problem-solving skills
Strong oral and written communication skills.
Flexibility and ability to adapt to quickly changing priorities and ambiguous situations.
Ability to approach work from an empathetic, trauma-informed perspective.
Commitment to PPFA’s mission and diversity, equity, and inclusion, particularly surrounding race equity.
A deep commitment to Planned Parenthood’s mission of promoting Sexual and Reproductive Health


Travel: (0-25% Domestic Travel

$94,000 - $101,000 a year

Total offer package to include generous vacation + sick leave + paid holidays, individual/family provided medical, dental and vision benefits effective day 1, life insurance, short/long term disability, paid family leave and 401k. We also offer voluntary opt-in for Flexible Spending Account (FSA) and Transportation/Commuter accounts.

We value a truly diverse workforce and a culture of inclusivity and belonging. Our goal is to attract qualified candidates and encourage applications from all individuals without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. We're committed to creating a dynamic work environment that values diversity and inclusion, respect and integrity, customer focus, and innovation.

PPFA participates in the E-Verify program and is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Job_description:
Senior UI/UX Designer:

Gullview Technologies is an exciting and rapidly growing technology company focused on taking on the most vital and challenging business and technical challenges our clients face in our highly connected business world today. We have an exceptional focus at Gullview on developing deep and long-lasting relationships (several years and counting) with our clients. This focus enables us to deliver an ongoing continuum of projects and solutions to them with high value, meaningful impact, and predictable performance.

We have a great opportunity for a senior UI/UX Designer to help us define and design high value, user-centric products and digital experiences for our client's customers as part of their Enterprise Digital Transformation journey. The ideal candidate is naturally curious, cares about how people interact with technology, and is data-driven in designing solutions, who is comfortable at working backward from the customer and balancing UX, technology, and business to tackle complex ambiguous problems. This is a fantastic opportunity to join our firm, and work with our client in the foundational stages of a transformation effort, with significant opportunities to lead efforts to introduce new capabilities into the client's organization and drive significant business differentiation in the marketplace.

As a Senior UI/UX Designer, you will use research and strategy to guide digital product design for our clients. You will regularly interact with our client's customers and end users to gather feedback through prototypes, and use research to discover, define, inspire, and prioritize improvements. You will work with a Digital Product Manager at our client to define roadmaps for digital products and work to align the business vision, user needs, and technical capabilities on solving problems for users of these products.

Essential Job Functions


Lead UX Design of our client's smart home digital experience and continue to evolve it
Lead the Digital Product Manager in best UX for our client's customers - from VUI, app controls, integrations with smart home hubs and integrators, as well as support services
Conduct user research, usability testing, and create flows and wires for various experiences
Collaborate with a Visual/UI Designer and Digital Product Manager to shape and improve the UX through careful consideration of research learnings, usability heuristics and best practices
Challenge the status quo when necessary and follow-through to ensure steps are taken to make change
Collaborate with multidisciplinary teams to launch new products, services and experiences



Requirements

Domain knowledge:


Domain knowledge: You possess a fundamental understanding of end-to-end customer experience research, strategy and design
User-centered perspective: You put users at the center of end-to-end experiences. You have the ability to integrate core UX/UI principles with existing and future customer needs and apply them to achieve business objectives. Solution-oriented and innovative thinking abilities
Prototyping skills: You are ready to learn from failure, embrace an iterative process and you understand that success comes sooner with trial and error
Collaborative skills: You work best in a participatory, team-based environment. Your support and inspire teams through collaboration as well as direction, vision, and planning of all aspects of digital deliverables
Managing Work: You have a talent for getting things done and excellent organizational and time management skills. You have the ability to manage multiple responsibilities simultaneously
Communication skills: You have strong verbal and visual presentation skills. You demonstrate a clear "point‐of‐view" relating to user experience design
Values-oriented: It is critical that we hire people and hold them accountable to a standard of excellence demonstrated by our Purpose and Values. You conduct your work with a high level of ethical standards, integrity, and professionalism
Comfort in ambiguity: You are self-directed toward excellent work outcomes and are comfortable working in ambiguous, non-rules based environments



Education / Experience


7+ years of experience designing and creating optimal digital experiences and interactions for target users with a demonstrated portfolio of compelling, engaging digital solutions and an ability to define what makes them successful
Smart home, VUI, and/or IoT experience preferred
Experience practicing human-centered design and skills in all phases including research, framing, ideation, and prototyping
A rigorous process of user research followed by uncompromising design
Experience with a variety of graphic design and interactive tools (such as Sketch, Figma, Adobe XD and Invision), however, we are agnostic in terms of tool choice
Portfolio of example projects highlighting design for digital experiences (including mobile applications) that demonstrate a strong understanding of digital interactions: patterns, best practices, common challenges, and solutions to those challenges
A strong desire to work on purpose-driven work and are excited by the mission to be part of high impact solutions to transform how work is done, and create new ways to positively impact people's lives
Industries: Non-profit Organizations and Primary and Secondary Education

We are seeking a Senior UI/UX Designer to support our client located in Fort Lauderdale, FL.

**US BASED CANDIDATES ONLY**

*No third parties.*

This is a work from home position however you must be available to travel to the South Florida for occasional meetings.

Who We Are

TECKpert, founded in 2009 and headquartered in Miami, FL, is a leading tech consulting and staff augmentation firm. We specialize in providing contingent workforces for digital transformation projects, offering expertise in design, development, IT, analytics, and marketing. Our mission is to deliver innovative digital solutions across various industries, including healthcare, government, finance, legal, real estate, and startups.

The opportunity

We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Senior UI/UX Designer for a contract position to lead the redesign of the platform. The ideal candidate will be responsible for delivering a user-centric design for our Case Management, Data Analytics, and Connect Telehealth main platforms, along with secondary modules with a focus on ease of use, accessibility, and modern design principles.

The existing design has been in place for close to six years and a new design is needed as the business and technology has evolved. A user-centered design approach to streamline the application and promote ease of use is the objective of this project. The new design will present a curated experience to the different user roles in the business, facilitate less clicks and quicker access to data.

Job duties include, but are not limited to:


Conduct user research and evaluate user feedback across business functions (healthcare CFO, physician, office manager, biller, payor, etc.) to gather insights for design improvements.
Collaborate with company stakeholders (CEO, CTO) and partners as part of research study.
Create user personas, user journey maps, and conduct usability testing.
Collaborate with product managers and engineers to define and implement innovative solutions for product direction, visuals, and experience.
Develop wireframes, prototypes, and high-fidelity designs for the Primavera platform.
Execute all visual design stages from concept to final hand-off to engineering.
Present and defend designs and key milestone deliverables to peers and executive-level stakeholders.
Establish and promote design guidelines, best practices, and standards.


Compensation and Term

This opportunity is for a 3 month contract position with deliverables including research assets and documentation, wireframes, and high fidelity designs. Pay is commensurate with experience.

Qualifications You Need

A successful candidate Recruiter possesses the following:


Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Design, Human-Computer Interaction, Interaction Design, or related field is preferred.
5+ years of UI/UX design experience in a senior role, with a portfolio showcasing previous work.
Past experience designing applications for business users in Healthcare.
Past experience with designing interactive charts and graphs using complex data sets.
Proficiency in a variety of design tools such as Sketch, Adobe Creative Suite, InVision, and Figma.
Experience with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript for rapid prototyping.
Excellent visual design skills with sensitivity to user-system interaction.
Ability to solve problems creatively and effectively.
Up-to-date with the latest UI trends, techniques, and technologies.
Experience working in an Agile/Scrum development process.
Strong communication skills to collaborate with various stakeholders.
Ability to work independently and prioritize and manage workload to meet project deadlines.


Working with Us

At TECKpert, we offer flexibility and a wide variety of roles. Many of our TECKperts enjoy coworking and skills training while benefiting from the stability of full-time employment. We believe TECKpert offers digital professionals an agile path to start and advance their careers.

Next Steps

Thank you for applying. If selected, we will reach out for a skills assessment and to schedule a short prescreen video call to get to know you better. We will also keep your profile in mind for future roles that match your qualifications.

TECKpert is committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment, prohibiting discrimination and harassment of any type based on race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws.

Company Summary

As the leading global provider of enterprise software and information solutions for project-based businesses, Deltek helps organizations of all sizes maximize productivity and revenue. Our market leadership stems from the work of our diverse employees who are united by a passion for learning, growing and making a difference. At Deltek, we take immense pride in creating a balanced, values-driven environment, where every employee feels included and empowered to do their best work. Our employees put our core values into action daily, creating a one-of-a-kind culture that has been recognized globally. Thanks to our incredible team, Deltek has been named one of America’s Best Midsize Employers by Forbes, a Top Workplace by The Washington Post and a Best Place to Work in Asia by World HRD Congress. www.deltek.com

Business Summary

The Deltek Engineering and Technology team builds best-in-class solutions to delight customers and meet their business needs. We are laser-focused on software design, development, innovation and quality. Our team of experts has the talent, skills and values to deliver products and services that are easy to use, reliable, sustainable and competitive. If you're looking for a safe environment where ideas are welcome, growth is supported and questions are encouraged – consider joining us as we explore the limitless opportunities of the software industry.

Position Responsibilities

We are seeking a talented and motivated Generative AI UX/UI Design Intern to join our team. As a UX/UI Design Intern, you will support our UX/UI designers in creating wireframes, mockups, and prototypes for AI-powered applications, while also gaining hands-on experience in user research, usability testing, and design thinking methodologies.

Responsibilities:


Assist in creating wireframes, mockups, and prototypes for AI-powered applications, ensuring alignment with user needs and product goals.
Support UX/UI designers in conducting user research and usability testing to gather feedback and insights from users.
Contribute to designing user interfaces and interactions that optimize user experience and enhance usability.
Collaborate with product managers and engineers to ensure alignment with product goals and technical feasibility.
Learn about user-centered design principles, prototyping tools, and design thinking methodologies, and apply them to your work.
Participate in team meetings, brainstorming sessions, and design reviews to share ideas and insights with colleagues.
Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and best practices in UX/UI design and AI-powered applications.



Qualifications


Pursuing or recently completed a bachelor's degree in computer sciences/engineering, Compter Interaction, Interaction Design, Graphic Design, or a related field.
Strong interest in UX/UI design, with some knowledge or coursework in user-centered design principles and methodologies.
Proficiency in design tools such as Sketch, Adobe XD, Figma, or similar tools for creating wireframes, mockups, and prototypes.
Excellent visual design skills and attention to detail, with the ability to create intuitive and visually appealing user interfaces.
Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a cross-functional team environment.
Enthusiasm for learning and willingness to take on new challenges and responsibilities.
Previous internship or project experience in UX/UI design or related field is a plus but not required.



Travel Requirements

No

At Accenture Federal Services, nothing matters more than helping the US federal government make the nation stronger and safer and life better for people. Our 13,000+ people are united in a shared purpose to pursue the limitless potential of technology and ingenuity for clients across defense, national security, public safety, civilian, and military health organizations.

Join Accenture Federal Services to do the work you love in an inclusive, collaborative, and caring community, where you can be empowered to grow, learn and thrive through hands-on experience, certifications, industry training and more.

Join us to drive positive, lasting change that moves missions and the government forward!

The Work:

Responsibilities include:


Responsible for conceiving and conducting user research, interviews and surveys, and translating them into sitemaps, user flows, customer journey maps, wireframes, mockups, and prototypes.
Translate concepts into user flows, wireframes, mockups, and prototypes that lead to intuitive user experiences.
Coordinate with graphic designers as needed to establish requirements and integrate the resulting efforts into the user interface
User experience researcher for human centered design focused research methodology, discovery, and designer.


Basic Requirements:


User experience researcher with human centered design focused research methodology, discovery, and designer.
Candidate should be experienced in research methods, or prototyping, or wireframing, and user acceptance testing.
Proficiency in Adobe XD, Figma, or Sketch (or similar products).
US Citizen


Bonus points:


Knowledge of SaaS platforms such as Salesforce, ServiceNow, Appian, or Pega is appreciated but not required.


What We Believe

We have an unwavering commitment to diversity with the aim that every one of our people has a full sense of belonging within our organization. As a business imperative, every person at Accenture Federal Services has the responsibility to create and sustain an inclusive environment.

Inclusion and diversity are fundamental to our culture and core values. Our rich diversity makes us more innovative and more creative, which helps us better serve our clients and our communities. Read more here

Equal Employment Opportunity Statement

Accenture Federal Services is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We believe that no one should be discriminated against because of their differences, such as age, disability, ethnicity, gender, gender identity and expression, religion or sexual orientation.

All employment decisions shall be made without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, citizenship status or any other basis as protected by federal, state, or local law.

Accenture is committed to providing veteran employment opportunities to our service men and women.

For details, view a copy of the Accenture Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Policy Statement.

Requesting An Accommodation

Accenture Federal Services is committed to providing equal employment opportunities for persons with disabilities or religious observances, including reasonable accommodation when needed. If you are hired by Accenture Federal Services and require accommodation to perform the essential functions of your role, you will be asked to participate in our reasonable accommodation process. Accommodations made to facilitate the recruiting process are not a guarantee of future or continued accommodations once hired.

If you are being considered for employment opportunities with Accenture Federal Services and need an accommodation for a disability or religious observance during the interview process or for the job you are interviewing for, please speak with your recruiter.

Other Employment Statements

Applicants for employment in the US must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the United States.

Candidates who are currently employed by a client of Accenture Federal Services or an affiliated Accenture business may not be eligible for consideration.

Job candidates will not be obligated to disclose sealed or expunged records of conviction or arrest as part of the hiring process.

The Company will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. Additionally, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the Company's legal duty to furnish information.

Overview: We're seeking a User Experience Researcher to conduct user research and provide insights that inform the design and development of user-centered products and experiences. You'll be responsible for planning and executing research studies, analyzing data, and presenting actionable recommendations.

Key Responsibilities


Plan and execute user research studies, including interviews, surveys, and usability tests.
Analyze qualitative and quantitative data to uncover user needs, behaviors, and preferences.
Synthesize research findings into actionable insights and recommendations for product teams.
Collaborate with designers, product managers, and engineers to integrate user feedback into product development processes.
Stay updated with UX research methodologies and best practices.


Qualifications


Bachelor's or Master's degree in Human-Computer Interaction, Psychology, Sociology, or related field.
Experience conducting user research studies in a professional setting.
Proficiency in research methods and tools (e.g., user interviews, usability testing, survey design).
Strong analytical and critical thinking skills.
Excellent communication and collaboration abilities.


Benefits


Competitive salary and benefits package.
Opportunities to make a meaningful impact on product development.
Collaboration with cross-functional teams on innovative projects.
Contribution to creating user-centered products and experiences.
Flexible work arrangements and a supportive work environment.

Title:  Senior UX DesignerLocation: Role is 100% onsite in NYC  Duration: 12-month contract Job DiscriptionMajor Fortune 500 company in financial services is looking for a Senior UX Designer with recent experience in financial services and/or fintech and 5+ years of experience in the financial services industry and/or fintech overall.Role Description/dutiesUnder the guidance of the Lead UX Designer, strategize and execute the product vision by being heavily involved in the end-to-end product design processSurface the underlying needs and motivation of our users to ensure we achieve business goals and provide valueDesign an intuitive and elegant experience that empowers our clients to make confident financial decisionsWork closely with our research team to synthesize qualitative and quantitative data and make value-driven design decisions which then translate into clear, simple UIsCreate and present a variety of design deliverables (sketches, wireframes, user flows and prototypes) in a way that engenders confidence in you and your solutions within the team and the greater organizationDesign holistic solutions that integrate seamlessly into our Wealth Management product ecosystemDesign and deliver responsive/adaptive solutions that are optimized for web and mobile interfaces and partner with engineers to translate designs into successful products

Blink is the user experience firm for the world’s leading companies. We use evidence-driven design to create products that people use, love and remember. With studios in Austin, Boston, San Diego, San Francisco, and Seattle, Blink brings two decades of experience to research, design, and strategy for clients such as Amazon, Facebook, Microsoft, NASA, Starbucks, and USAA.

This opportunity is a part of Blink's Embedded practice which supports long-term opportunities with some of Blink’s largest client partners.

Duration: 6-12 months

Location: WA, Bay Area or Los Angeles

What You'll Do


Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand stakeholder requirements and develop solutions that meet their needs.
Conduct research on emerging technologies, including generative AI, and incorporate them into human-centered solutions designed for legal services.
Apply design thinking methodologies to create intuitive, user-friendly interfaces for our internal legal professional clients, as well as our external legal and business professional clients.
Research requirements to develop generative AI solutions in cloud-based platforms, such as Azure and AWS.
Collaborate with external vendor with low code development platform (Outsystems).
Develop and iterate upon generative AI models for a variety of use cases in the legal services space.
Work with the team to create high-fidelity wireframes from business requirements following good design and architecture principles.
Apply design thinking methodologies to create intuitive, user-friendly interfaces for our internal legal professional clients, as well as our external legal and business professional clients.


Your background


Highly professional with a strong customer service orientation, commitment to meeting deadlines, and ability to multitask in a fast-paced and dynamic environment
Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, draw conclusions.
Proficiency in current design and prototyping tools and ability to learn new ones as projects require
Strong understanding of user-centered design methods
Strong project management skills, attention to detail, and communication skills
Knack for creative problem solving and innovative solutions
Understanding of visual design and UI design principles for web applications
Skilled at designing using Figma
MUST HAVE: Experience in AI, LLMs or NLP
Bachelor's degree in engineering, human-computer interaction (HCI), or equivalent professional experience
3-5 years of experience


$100,000 - $135,000 a year

DOE

Description

Position at Everyday Health - Consumer

Lose It! is on a mission to change the way people view weight loss. Through the proven approach of calorie counting, Lose It! empowers our members by providing support, motivation, and the tools they need for success on their journey to a healthy weight. We mobilize the world to achieve their health goals by developing best-in-class mobile apps on the iOS and Android platforms.

We have the energy of a start-up culture with the stability of a profitable business within a publicly traded company. It’s never been a more exciting time to work in tech - come share in our success. Lose It! offers incredible benefits, flexible hours, and a balanced approach to work and life.

Lose It! is part of the Everyday Health Group (EHG), a recognized leader in patient and provider education and services attracting an engaged audience of over 74 million health consumers and over 890,000 U.S. practicing physicians and clinicians. Our mission is to drive better clinical and health outcomes through decision-making informed by highly relevant information, data, and analytics. We empower healthcare providers, consumers and payers with trusted content and services delivered through Everyday Health Group’s world-class brands.

The Opportunity

Lose It! is looking for a UX Designer to help drive the look and feel of our top-rated iOS and Android apps. We’re looking for a self-starter that loves trying new ideas and iterating until the design is just right. An ideal candidate is empathetic, resourceful, and has a strong point of view. This person is a problem solver that loves exploring a variety of solutions. This role will report to the SVP of Product of Lose It! and work directly with product managers and engineers to deliver effective, easy-to-use experiences to our members. Come join an exciting environment where you can design a product that helps millions of users live healthier lives.

Key Responsibilities


Create designs for new features of our iOS and Android apps while working closely with product managers and engineers
Understand the value behind product decisions and design for usability
Evaluate our mobile apps for design defects and ensure engineering deliveries meet design specifications
Identify design gaps and inconsistencies in our iOS and Android apps and become an advocate for design quality


Job Qualiﬁcations


1+ years of experience designing mobile or web apps
A basic grasp of mobile design standards and conventions
Demonstrable ﬂuency with Figma
Strong knowledge of interaction design in addition to aesthetics
Strong collaborative skills and the ability to justify design decisions to stakeholders
A positive attitude and the ability to resolve issues with best practices
Previous experience working with consumer-facing apps is a plus
Passion for health and wellness is a plus


Our Culture and Values

We created our values together to guide our collective purpose and pursuits. We are collaborators and problem solvers. We empower one another to make informed decisions and to be enabled towards action. We embrace success. We recognize that innovation can spark and be born from any of us no matter our individual role or background. We encourage open mindedness and sensitivity to each other and our environment. Our personal and professional passions get ignited, nurtured and supported. We value that doing is greater than talking as the most measurable means of impact. Our collective purpose to deliver enlightened audience experiences with trusted brands is what drives the success of our business and our professional satisfaction.

Life at Everyday Health

At Everyday Health Group, a division of Ziff Davis, we work in a culture of collaboration and welcome those who desire to join our growing global community. We believe in careers versus jobs and people versus employees. We seek enthusiastic individuals with an entrepreneurial spirit looking for an environment that rewards your best work.

Everyday Health offers competitive salaries in addition to robust health and wellness benefits including medical, dental, vision, life and disability benefits, Flexible Spending accounts, 401(k) with company match, an Employee Stock Purchase Plan, Pregnancy and Parental leave, Family Planning Support via Maven, Flexible Time Off, Volunteer Time Off, Fitness Reimbursement as well as employee-focused engagement and education programs, including Employee Resource Groups and company-sponsored events. If you’re seeking a dynamic, flexible work environment where you can see the direct impact of your performance, then Everyday Health is the place for you. Everyday Health Group has employees located in 40+ states as well as offices in NYC, Boston, Asheville, London, and Mumbai. This position may be performed anywhere in the Eastern United States except within the City of New York.

Everyday Health Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive and equitable environment for all employees.

This full-time position is remote with a requirement to come into our Boston, MA office once a quarter.

#LoseIt

ABOUT CREATORCORE

CreatorCore is a rapidly growing creator economy software startup focused on creating a suite of tools for talent managers, influencer marketing agencies, and record labels. Our product replaces messy spreadsheets, manual reporting, and other headaches of influencer marketing. 




We are looking for a bold, organized, driven, and fun-loving person to join our team. Our culture is at the center of everything, we are scrappy, innovative, and fresh. Humans make companies, not credentials.




ROLE OVERVIEW

The Product Designer (UI/UX) will play a key role in designing a clean interface and seamless experience. We pride ourselves on our ability to make complex data & operations issues be easy to digest & navigate. Looking for someone with an understanding of the creator economy, in tune with current design trends and has experience in working within a similar startup. 




RESPONSIBILITIES:

Collaborate closely with internal teams to ensure smooth scoping & design of features
Design wireframes, prototypes, and mockups to illustrate design concepts and user flows
Ensure consistency across the application, prioritizing platform usability standards
Contribute to the development and maintenance of a design system that ensures consistency and scalability across the platform
Work with development team for smooth implementation




QUALIFICATIONS:

2+ years of relevant experience
Proven experience in UI/UX design, preferably within a SaaS or tech startup environment
Worked within the creator economy 
Knowledge of current design trends, tools, and technologies.
Fun, positive, and motivated to grow with a small, yet rapidly growing company
Proficiency in design tools such as Figma, Sketch, Adobe Creative Suite, or similar.

ABOUT CREATORCORECreatorCore is a rapidly growing creator economy software startup focused on creating a suite of tools for talent managers, influencer marketing agencies, and record labels. Our product replaces messy spreadsheets, manual reporting, and other headaches of influencer marketing. We are looking for a bold, organized, driven, and fun-loving person to join our team. Our culture is at the center of everything, we are scrappy, innovative, and fresh. Humans make companies, not credentials. ROLE OVERVIEWThe Product Designer (UI/UX) will play a key role in designing a clean interface and seamless experience. We pride ourselves on our ability to make complex data & operations issues be easy to digest & navigate. Looking for someone with an understanding of the creator economy, in tune with current design trends and has experience in working within a similar startup. RESPONSIBILITIES:Collaborate closely with internal teams to ensure smooth scoping & design of featuresDesign wireframes, prototypes, and mockups to illustrate design concepts and user flowsEnsure consistency across the application, prioritizing platform usability standardsContribute to the development and maintenance of a design system that ensures consistency and scalability across the platformWork with development team for smooth implementationQUALIFICATIONS:2+ years of relevant experienceProven experience in UI/UX design, preferably within a SaaS or tech startup environmentWorked within the creator economy Knowledge of current design trends, tools, and technologies.Fun, positive, and motivated to grow with a small, yet rapidly growing companyProficiency in design tools such as Figma, Sketch, Adobe Creative Suite, or similar.

Description

Want to help build cutting edge immersive shopping experiences? The Visual Innovation Team is at the center of all advanced visual and immersive content at Amazon. We're pioneering VR and AR shopping, CGI, and GenAI. We are looking for a UX Designer who will help drive innovation in this space who understands UX problems the team may face from an artistic perspective and provide creative technical solutions.

The ideal candidate is someone with a passion for customers, strong communication skills, and the ability to focus on big experience initiatives at the same time as crucial details. They are comfortable presenting and articulating design reasoning with data to directors and stakeholder teams, and working through implementation details with tech teams.

Key job responsibilities

We are looking for a UX Designer who can deliver pragmatic creative UX solutions to the technical problems related to Amazon visuals. The right person will bring an implicit understanding of the balance needed between artistry, communication, and partnership—help scale 3D content creation within Amazon by enabling our customers with -- to work smarter, not harder. This person will partner with our PM, Engineering, Design, and business team partners, to help drive creative customer experiences for Amazon.

UX Designer In This Role Will


Own medium to large UX Design initiatives in Amazon’s fast-paced, results-oriented environment to define, assess and optimize the performance of new and existing features.
Understand the end to end customer journey, the friction points within, and how your proposed CX solution impacts that path and others
Partner with other UX designers, UX research, visual design, business partners, and engineering to understand customer and business need and drive great customer experiences.
Responsibly and effectively advocate for customers and impart day-to-day strategic user experience leadership.
Ensure that all User Experience activities are executed at high quality levels, manage team initiatives, set priorities, and manage scoping.
Review with and gather feedback on work from your managers, business partners, engineering, and peer design teams as well as executive leadership.


We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations:

Los Angeles, CA, USA | New York City, NY, USA | Seattle, WA, USA | Simi Valley, CA, USA

Basic Qualifications


3+ years of design experience
3+ years of delivering design solutions as a UX designer or interaction designer experience
Experience prototyping (HTML, XHTML, JavaScript, CSS, Flash or Flash Catalyst, or Axure)


Preferred Qualifications


Experience working in a collaborative team and working directly with developers for implementation of designs
Have an available online portfolio
Broad knowledge of a computer-graphics related field (VFX, Games, Film, Motion Graphics)
Experience with working with 3D workflows and DCCs (Maya, Unreal, Houdini)
Experience with working with 3D artists

S/he will drive the design to create intuitive solutions, bettering the design and usability of our clients digital solutions and guiding user-centered methodologies from strategy, research, design and user testing.Job responsibilities:The UX/UI Designer role is an independent contributor who will be playing a well-rounded product designer role as per industry standards. Illustrate design ideas using collaboration design tool such as Figma.Connect design strategy to business results.Experience with an iterative design process, and a recognition that the first design is rarely the final design (i.e., MVP mindset)Experience in the full a Telecommunications and Media company of UX/UI design activities, which includes UX research, wireframing, high-fidelity UI design, user testing/validation and UI development handoff. Especially the person has a good understanding of the design implementation as opposed to just delivering a proof of concept (POC) design.Ability to facilitate design feedback/review sessions with business leads, developers and other non-designers.   Strong communication skills, with the confidence to explain design approaches or technical details to diverse groups of peopleProficient in collaborative design tools such as Figma, Miro, etc.Experience with responsive design and UI handoff Ability and willingness to learn Agile ways of workingBackground in designing mobile and web applications OR Masters/Bachelors/Associates degree in graphic design, computer science, design, fine arts, or equivalent combination of education and demonstrated UI/UX experience  Experience:   5 + years of UX/UI or product design experience.

Title:  Senior UX DesignerLocation: Role is 100% onsite in NYC  Duration: 12-month contract Job DiscriptionMajor Fortune 500 company in financial services is looking for a Senior UX Designer with recent experience in financial services and/or fintech and 5+ years of experience in the financial services industry and/or fintech overall.Role Description/dutiesUnder the guidance of the Lead UX Designer, strategize and execute the product vision by being heavily involved in the end-to-end product design processSurface the underlying needs and motivation of our users to ensure we achieve business goals and provide valueDesign an intuitive and elegant experience that empowers our clients to make confident financial decisionsWork closely with our research team to synthesize qualitative and quantitative data and make value-driven design decisions which then translate into clear, simple UIsCreate and present a variety of design deliverables (sketches, wireframes, user flows and prototypes) in a way that engenders confidence in you and your solutions within the team and the greater organizationDesign holistic solutions that integrate seamlessly into our Wealth Management product ecosystemDesign and deliver responsive/adaptive solutions that are optimized for web and mobile interfaces and partner with engineers to translate designs into successful products

Location: Remote.

Who We Are

We are an Experience design and trusted creative technology partner to some of the world’s most ambitious brands such as Google, Amazon, Meta and Uber. We believe in the power of storytelling, human-centric design, and the intersection of creativity with code to further humanity's relationship with technology. We operate fully remote, and our team members enjoy the flexibility of working from anywhere within the U.S. and Canada time zones while keeping a balanced relationship with their personal life.

At Left Field Labs, our curiosity drives us to seek out uncommon solutions to our shared challenges. Our purpose is to positively impact the human experience with everything we invent. We’re looking for those who can craft unique solutions through empathy.

Interested in joining a culture that celebrates diversity, encourages curiosity, and creates with purpose? Are you the kind of person who obsesses over details, thrives in a collaborative environment, and jumps at the opportunity to take on new challenges? Confident that you’re at the top of your game and ready to invent with others who are at the top of theirs? Check out our open position and let’s talk.

Who We Are Seeking

We’re looking for someone with an extensive background crafting UX strategy, shaping UX design and research processes, confidently presenting creative ideas to clients, mentoring more junior UX-ers, and with the ability to do hands-on UX work in a pinch. You will be working closely with a large, cross-disciplinary team of creatives, production experts, and engineers.

You will work closely with your project team to satisfy client requirements that produce high-quality deliverables. A positive attitude and outlook are a necessity, as well excellent, clear communication and professionalism. Organization and thoughtfulness will be the key qualities in everything you do, while focusing on a sense of timeliness and ownership. Every step of the way, you’ll have the opportunity to provide digital expertise and experience.

What You’ll Do


Lead and oversee UX project work for one of LFL’s major verticals with ownership over the process, scope, and deliverables for the user experience research and design
Manage, mentor, and provide oversight for UX designer(s) and UX researcher(s) and ensure a high quality and UX deliverables
Translate client requirements and objectives into actionable product/experience requirements, user stories, user journeys, site/system maps and wireframes
Persuasively present UX thinking and logical solutions to peers and clients, with an open mind for collaboration and respect for diverse perspectives
Participate and lead early stage ideation sessions and UX workshops and work closely with visual and engineering teams to translate larger problems and conceptual approaches into actionable, implementable design solutions
Assist the sales teams on new business opportunities and strategy for pitches and proposals
Work with production and accounts teams to ensure that user experience design deadlines and client expectations are met and exceeded
Provide guidance and perspective on the best user research methods for answering open design questions and getting feedback from potential users in order to validate and provide recommendations
Work with production to define internal workflows that enable operational efficiency and quality outputs and help source and manage UX team resources for projects in this vertical (including external UX vendors and freelancers as needed)


What You’ll Need to be Successful


5+ years of professional experience architecting user experience research, strategy and design including hands on implementation work, as well as working with and mentoring other UX designers and researchers
Proven experience leading the UX process - from user research and brief to initial experience concepts to wireframes to technical documentation
Strong understanding of fundamental design principles, typography, visual hierarchy, and usability and accessibility best practices and ability to apply those to execute clean and elegant design and documentation
Specialized knowledge of UX/design software (specifically Figma) with an understanding of and ability to build designs using components and libraries and prototype
UX research experience including planning and conducting user testing and initial audience/positioning research and strategy OR experience working with UX researchers to define test parameters and needs
Top notch communications skills including the ability to articulately present and defend UX ideas and concepts
Strong online portfolio showing UX concepts and strategies you created and working examples of those ideas in execution
Master’s Degree or equivalent work experience


Bonus


A multi-disciplinary background combining design with psychology, computer-science, specialized user-experience focused program or a related field is a major plus
Experience working in an agency setting with global clients
Basic understanding of HTML/CSS, other programming languages, or creative technology tools a plus


The salary range for this role is $60-$90 per hour. This range is only applicable for jobs to be performed in Culver City, California. This is the lowest to highest salary we reasonably and in good faith believe we would pay for this role at the time of this posting. We may ultimately pay more or less than the posted range, and the range may be modified in the future. An employee’s pay position within the salary range will be based on several factors including, but not limited to, relevant education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, geographic location, performance, and business or organizational needs.

About Our Community:

We are an innovative gaming community at the forefront of integrating AI technology into the realm of gaming and film. Utilizing the powerful tools from Evertide.ai, including Text to Speech, Text to Image, and Text to Video, alongside Unreal Engine, we are committed to creating immersive and dynamic virtual worlds.

Job Description:

As an Unreal Engine UI/UX Designer, you will be responsible for designing and implementing user interfaces that enhance player interaction and experience in our gaming and film projects. Your role involves combining creative design skills with technical proficiency in Unreal Engine to create intuitive, engaging, and visually appealing UI elements. Collaborating with developers and artists, you will ensure that the UI/UX design aligns with the overall vision and feel of our projects.

Requirements

Key Responsibilities:


UI/UX Development: Design and implement user interface elements within Unreal Engine, focusing on usability, aesthetics, and player engagement
AI Integration: Utilize Evertide.ai's AI tools to innovate and enhance UI/UX design elements, making them more interactive and immersive
Collaborative Design: Work closely with the development and design teams to ensure a cohesive visual style and user experience across our projects
User Testing and Feedback: Conduct user testing, gather feedback, and iterate on designs to improve usability and player satisfaction
Technical Proficiency: Stay updated with the latest UI/UX trends and technologies in Unreal Engine, ensuring high-quality and innovative designs


Requirements:


Proven experience in UI/UX design, particularly within Unreal Engine
Strong portfolio showcasing UI/UX design skills, with a focus on gaming or interactive media
Knowledge of Evertide.ai's AI tools and their application in enhancing UI/UX design is a plus
Excellent visual design skills, including layout, typography, and color theory
Strong communication skills and the ability to work effectively in a team
A Bachelor's degree in Design, Computer Science, or a related field is preferred, but not essential


Benefits

What We Offer:


A role at the intersection of design and technology in the innovative fields of gaming and film
A collaborative and creative work environment
Competitive salary and benefits package
Access to the latest advancements in AI and game development tools

Company Description

We organize personal information and transform it into actions. We provide a mind-free experience for using computers and saves users the energy of performing mundane tasks like searching for information, organizing data, and facilitating communication. We are based in the San Francisco Bay Area and offer some flexibility for remote work.




Role Description

This is a contract hybrid role as a Human-AI Experience Designer located in the San Francisco Bay Area, with flexibility for some remote work. The HAI Experience Designer will be responsible for conducting user research, use design thinking methodologies to develop and improve our product's usability, create visual design prototypes, and ensure the best user experience (UX) possible.




Qualifications

Design Thinking and User Research skills
Experience in Visual Design and UX
Experience in Prototyping high-fidelity designs for multiple platforms
Strong problem-solving skills and ability to collaborate with a team
Attention to detail and knowledge of best UI/UX practices
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to think creatively and justify design decisions
Bachelor's degree or equivalent in Design, Human-Computer Interaction (HCI), or related field
Experience with Sketch, Figma, Adobe Creative Suite, and Game industry is a plus

Here at Lyft, we’re working to improve people’s lives with the world’s best transportation. To make this lofty goal a reality we start from within—creating an open, inclusive, and diverse organization.

Our support experiences help millions of drivers and riders, working to resolve their issues so they can quickly get back on the road. We design experiences to keep the promises Lyft makes to our customers and make things right when they go wrong. You will have the chance to design and own support experiences across multiple modes of transportation and truly improve outcomes for our riders and drivers.

We’re looking for a product designer to advocate and maintain a customer-centric culture within Lyft, and be happy and comfortable in a fast-paced, ever-changing environment. You'll partner with designers, researchers, marketers, and product managers to define and create top-notch experiences. You’re experienced with every step of product development, from brainstorming broad ideas to ensure design quality through launch. Using your full range of interaction, visual, and product thinking skills, you will lead and own core Safety experiences across our product teams.

The Opportunity:


Create industry-leading, data and AI-driven experiences for riders and drivers on Lyft’s platform
Co-lead with talented, empathetic cross-functional partners on product strategy and process
Influence cross-functional and cross-team efforts to build high value opportunities across our experiences


Responsibilities:


Problem solve, think big, and explore divergent concepts/ideas while understanding how to converge and build iteratively towards your vision.
Plan strategically and think tactically as a partner with product and engineering to define the future of the team.
Influence the shape of the product with research and data while executing design work using high quality wireframes, mockups, user journeys, and cross-platform interactive prototypes.
Advocate for design by sharing your work and presenting cross-functionally, while being able to precisely articulate design rationale.
Inspire the entire team (including your cross-functional) partners by bringing new ideas to the table.
Create a unified, end-to-end experience through close collaboration with team members from across the Product and Marketing Design Teams.


Experience:


3-4 years of experience working in UX, UI, HCI related field with experience working on web and mobile design
Experience working with a lean team of Engineers, Product Managers and Program Managers
Experience taking a holistic approach to designing workflows and reducing friction in experiences
Experience managing cross-functional stakeholder feedback and expectations
Expertise with Figma and other prototyping tools
Excellence in design craft
Experience running user interviews and usability testing designs
Ability to work with a low-ego, highly collaborative, cross-functional team
Bonus: Experience working on customer support experiences


Even if you don't directly have the skills above, please consider applying. We know talent takes many different shapes.

Benefits:


Great medical, dental, and vision insurance options
Mental health benefits
Family building benefits
In addition to 12 observed holidays, salaried team members have unlimited paid time off, hourly team members have 15 days paid time off
401(k) plan to help save for your future
18 weeks of paid parental leave. Biological, adoptive, and foster parents are all eligible
Pre-tax commuter benefits
Lyft Pink - Lyft team members get an exclusive opportunity to test new benefits of our Ridership Program


Lyft is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer committed to an inclusive and diverse workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regards to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other basis prohibited by law. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.

This role will be in-office on a hybrid schedule — Team Members will be expected to work in the office 3 days per week on Mondays, Thursdays and a team-specific third day. Additionally, hybrid roles have the flexibility to work from anywhere for up to 4 weeks per year.

The expected base pay range for this position in the New York City market is $139,500 - $155,000. Salary ranges are dependent on a variety of factors, including qualifications, experience and geographic location. Range is not inclusive of potential equity offering, bonus or benefits. Your recruiter can share more information about the salary range specific to your working location and other factors during the hiring process.

Agile Six is a people-first, remote-work company that serves shoulder-to-shoulder with federal agencies to find innovative, human-centered solutions. We build better by putting people first. We are animated by our core values of Purpose, Wholeness, Trust, Self-Management and Inclusion. We deliver our solutions in autonomous teams of self-managed professionals (no managers here!) who genuinely care about each other and the work. We know that’s our company’s purpose – and that we can only achieve it by supporting a culture where people feel valued, self-managed, and love to come to work.

The role

As a UX Researcher/Designer at Agile Six, you have UX knowledge with technical expertise in user research, including discovery, synthesis, and documentation. You will collaborate with our team to research and design highly complex, cross-disciplinary projects for government agencies and the people they serve. Among your responsibilities will be to partner with teammates to communicate a research and design vision to other team members and key stakeholders at the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA). Our team has an adaptive, empathetic, and collaborative mindset and cares deeply about team dynamics. We are searching for someone who has a passion for working on important problems that have a lasting impact on millions of users and make a difference in our government!

You will be joining a team partnering with VA to build a new, integrated patient portal on VA.gov . The mission of this effort is to integrate VA’s digital patient experiences currently provided by My Healthevet (MHV) with VA’s other digital tools to give Veterans one place to manage their VA health care, community care, disability benefits, and other VA information.

For more context on the project, take a look at the team’s GitHub repository:


https://github.com/department-of-veterans-affairs/va.gov-team/tree/master/products/health-care/digital-health-modernization/mhv-to-va.gov


Responsibilities


Plan and conduct research using a variety of methods such as user interviews, usability testing, surveys and heuristic evaluations. Facilitate user research efforts, including discovery, data analysis and insight synthesis.
Partner within a cross-discipline team of product, engineering and other UX team members and ensure everyone is aligned on research strategy, goals and outcomes.
Keep UX research work in sync with the product roadmap and priorities. Adjust research efforts as needed in an agile environment to provide timely results for quick decision-making.
Clearly articulate your thought processes through verbal and written explanation, whiteboard, sketching, or quick mock-ups to small or large groups.
Communicate and collaborate with stakeholders and team members across a range of disciplines throughout the VA.
As needed, provide content and design guidance to cross-functional teams regarding software design and implementation, capturing all states, edge-cases, and path logic for visual UI design and engineering teams to build out.
Support the practice of research and design within the larger company as needed through activities such as:
Assisting in outreach, recruitment, and hiring efforts
Occasionally participating in or otherwise supporting business development efforts, including code or design challenges, writing or reviewing proposal responses, etc.
Participating in communities of practice
We expect the responsibilities of this position to shift and grow organically over time, in response to considerations such as the unique strengths and interests of the selected candidate and other team members and an evolving understanding of the delivery environment.
Basic qualifications


4+ years of experience working as UX researcher/designer or related position in collaboration with digital product teams (enterprise environment a plus)
Case studies illustrating your process and samples of native product design work driven by quantitative and qualitative user research that resulted in successful outcomes
Understanding of human-centered design, user research methodologies, interaction design fundamentals, and UI design best practices, including accessibility
Proficient in Sketch and Figma
Experience collaborating with cross-functional partners and other designers, seeking and providing feedback in an Agile environment
Adaptive, empathetic, collaborative, and positive
Ability to be autonomous and take initiative


Additional desired qualifications


Familiarity with the US Web Design System
Experience working with government agencies
You are a U.S. Veteran


Salary and Sixer Benefits

To promote equal pay for equal work, we publish salary ranges for each position.

The salary for this position is $117,102-$123,107

Our benefits are designed to reinforce our core values of Wholeness, Self Management and Inclusion. The following benefits are available to all employees. We respect that only you know what balance means for your life and season. While we offer support from coaches, we expect you to own your wholeness, show up for work whole, and go home to your family the same. You will be seen, heard and valued. We expect you to offer the same for your colleagues, be kind (not bossy), be caring (not directive) and ready to participate in a state of flow. We mean it when we say “We build better by putting people first”.

All Sixers Enjoy:


Self-managed work/life balance and flexibility
Competitive and equitable salary (equal pay for equal work)
Employee Stock Ownership (ESOP) for all employees!
401K matching
Medical, dental, and vision insurance
Employer paid short and long term disability insurance
Employer paid life insurance
Self-managed and generous paid time off
Paid federal holidays and Election day off
Paid parental leave
Self-managed professional development spending
Self-managed wellness days


Hiring practices

Agile Six is a people-first, remote-work company that serves shoulder-to-shoulder with federal agencies to find innovative, human-centered solutions. We build better by putting people first. We are animated by our core values of Purpose, Wholeness, Trust, Self-Management and Inclusion. We deliver our solutions in autonomous teams of self-managed professionals (no managers here!) who genuinely care about each other and the work. We know that’s our company’s purpose – and that we can only achieve it by supporting a culture where people feel valued, self-managed, and love to come to work.The roleAs a UX Researcher/Designer at Agile Six, you have UX knowledge with technical expertise in user research, including discovery, synthesis, and documentation. You will collaborate with our team to research and design highly complex, cross-disciplinary projects for government agencies and the people they serve. Among your responsibilities will be to partner with teammates to communicate a research and design vision to other team members and key stakeholders at the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA). Our team has an adaptive, empathetic, and collaborative mindset and cares deeply about team dynamics. We are searching for someone who has a passion for working on important problems that have a lasting impact on millions of users and make a difference in our government!You will be joining a team partnering with VA to build a new, integrated patient portal on VA.gov . The mission of this effort is to integrate VA’s digital patient experiences currently provided by My Healthevet (MHV) with VA’s other digital tools to give Veterans one place to manage their VA health care, community care, disability benefits, and other VA information.For more context on the project, take a look at the team’s GitHub repository: https://github.com/department-of-veterans-affairs/va.gov-team/tree/master/products/health-care/digital-health-modernization/mhv-to-va.gov Responsibilities Plan and conduct research using a variety of methods such as user interviews, usability testing, surveys and heuristic evaluations. Job Title: UX Designer

Location: Chicago, IL Hybrid - Must be willing to travel/fly

Remote & Onsite may be required to work.

Duration: 6 months

Minimum pay: $68/hr




The Senior Designer - UX will help lead the design and definition as a key contributor to Client's Core UX team, Travel MBT, responsible for integrating human-centered practices in unpacking and improving the digital customer experience across all stages of the travel journey. The Core UX team supports defining United’s digital product strategy and providing the leadership to execute on that strategy with the help of a cross-functional mission-based teams. We’re looking for an empathic, passionate curious designer who celebrates delivering high-quality solutions and thrives for innovation in a collaborative environment.




Responsibilities:

PLAN & CONCEPT

Visualize ideas using professional design tools as well as sticky notes, sketch boards, whiteboard markers or whatever tools are necessary to rapidly work through ideation and move to the next stage
Initiate and respond to ideas for innovation/improvements based on research, analysis, and competitive reviews
Identify user needs and business requirements
Substantiate design approach with analysis & projections for improvements

DESIGN & REFINE

Ensure digital customer touch points become and remain consistent with United’s user experience and brand standards
Develop intuitive, usable, and engaging interactions
Drive the design of next generation, navigation schemes, patterns, components and templates across the company’s products, insuring a consistent, appealing, and dynamic customer experience.
Create low and high fidelity interactive prototypes adhering to a rapid, iterative and collaborative process
Work with usability researchers to design test plans and iterate designs throughout user testing. Translate usability research findings into design improvements.

DEFINE & COMMUNICATE

Create final design deliverables through appropriately detailed design specifications including: process flows, wireframes, storyboards, high and low fidelity mockups, red-lines and prototypes
Present design work to the user experience team, product team, and executives for review and feedback
Collaborate with cross-functional teams as well as the larger UX team and business partners throughout the design process
Communicate harmoniously with multiple stakeholders to synthesize, review design project progress, and incorporate feedback appropriately with a user-centered focus
During implementation phase respond to day-to-day questions from developers, product managers & project managers
Work with QA to identify, document, and verify bug fixes
Provide guidance and mentor junior designers

Education/Certification:

BA/BS or equivalent work experience required

Knowledge/Skills:

Solid grasp of web design principles and a good understanding of front-end web technologies required
Excellent understanding of user experience design for the Web, mobile, and touch devices required
Ability to coordinate, prioritize, and accomplish multiple tasks in a fast-paced atmosphere with minimal supervision required
Experience in writing detailed design specifications (IA, work flow, page functionality and layout, etc.), which technology developers use to build the product required
Must be a self-starter that can create schedules and define scope of work even when there are no clear requirements and direction required
Strong ability to communicate your design, defend your design decisions, and respond quickly to business needs required
Proven ability to set the design direction for your projects and to collaborate with other designers working in the space required
A team player who can easily adapt in a rapidly changing environment required
Experience
5+ years professional UX design experience required
8+ years professional UX design experience preferred

Other:

Must be legally authorized to work in the United States for any employer without sponsorship
Successful completion of interview required to meet job qualifications
Reliable, punctual attendance is an essential function of the position

Top 5 Skill sets:

Strong mobile app experience
UX design examples- portfolio must
strong visual design skills
Strong communication skills
Ability to multi-task and lead individual projects.

About Us

Below is the brief introduction of SPECTRAFORCE, the benefits we offer and the disclaimers:

Established in 2004, SPECTRAFORCE is one of the largest and fastest-growing diversity-owned staffing firms in the US. The growth of our company is a direct result of our global client service delivery model that is powered by our state-of-the-art A.I. proprietary talent acquisition platform, robust ISO 9001:2015/ISO 27001 certified processes, and strong and passionate client engaged teams.

We have built our business by providing talent and project-based solutions, including Contingent, Permanent, and Statement of Work (SOW) services to over 130 clients in the US, Canada, Puerto Rico, Costa Rica, and India. Key industries that we service include Technology, Financial Services, Life Sciences, Healthcare, Telecom, Retail, Utilities and Transportation.

SPECTRAFORCE is built on a concept of “human connection,” defined by our branding attitude of NEWJOBPHORIA®, which is the excitement of bringing joy and freedom to the work lifestyle so our people (and clients) can reach their highest potential. Our entire workflow and teams are trained to cultivate the joy of NEWJOBPHORIA® with candidates and employees throughout their engagement with SPECTRAFORCE. http://www.spectraforce.com

SPECTRAFORCE offers unpaid leave as well as paid sick leave when required by law.
