Job_title: UX Researcher: Opportunities For University Graduates
Job_description:
Come build community, explore your passions and do your best work at Microsoft with thousands of University students from every corner of the world. This opportunity will allow you to bring your aspirations, talent, potential—and excitement for the journey ahead.

As a UX Researcher, you will drive human-centered strategy, help set product direction, and contribute directly to ongoing product development by integrating insights about human behaviors, attitudes, practices, and norms. This opportunity will allow you to drive short and long-term research plans to fill in knowledge gaps, prioritize inclusion, identify risks, and inform product decisions; conduct analyses and distill quantitative and qualitative data into actionable insights and actively contribute to achieving product outcomes that delight customers and meet desired organizational goals; contribute to business success across all stages of the product cycle by representing the voice of the customer.

Microsoft’s mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others, and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond.

Responsibilities


Create and drive plans for research studies and/or programs for a component or feature. Define and scope problems for study with clear success criteria relevant for business needs. Plan research design to proactively minimize bias.
Choose the research method(s) best suited to the business objectives and learning needs (e.g., moderated and unmoderated usability studies, interviews, surveys, scorecards, competitive benchmarks, clickstream analytics, A/B testing, ethnographic field research, participatory designs, user modeling). Collect valid, reliable, and unbiased data.
Synthesize and distill data. Review quantitative and/or qualitative signals to draw appropriate and valid conclusions from available data; analyze data to determine the most significant elements, identify common elements and themes in situations and actions, and recognize cause and effect relationships. Translate raw data into insights.
Apply user experience research and design thinking approaches to solution exploration.
Measure user experience improvements over time for a component or feature.
Produce impactful artifacts generated from research findings which bring clarity to the space being studied.
Create communication methods that promote an emotional connection to a customer, and convey real user stories that reveal customer insights.


Qualifications

Required Qualifications


Bachelor's Degree in Human-Computer Interaction, Human Factors Engineering, Computer Science, Technical Communications, Information Science, Information Architecture, User Experience Design, Behavioral Science, Social Sciences, or related field AND 2+ years User Experience Research experience
OR Master's Degree in Human-Computer Interaction, Human Factors Engineering, Computer Science, Technical Communications, Information Science, Information Architecture, User Experience Design, Behavioral Science, Social Sciences, or related field AND 1+ year(s) User Experience Research experience
OR equivalent experience.

Preferred Qualifications


Bachelor's Degree in Human-Computer Interaction, Human Factors Engineering, Computer Science, Technical Communications, Information Science, Information Architecture, User Experience Design, Behavioral Science, Social Sciences, or related field AND 5+ years User Experience Research experience
OR Master's Degree in Human-Computer Interaction, Human Factors Engineering, Computer Science, Technical Communications, Information Science, Information Architecture, User Experience Design, Behavioral Science, Social Sciences, or related field AND 3+ years User Experience Research experience
OR Doctorate in Human-Computer Interaction, Human Factors Engineering, Computer Science, Technical Communications, Information Science, Information Architecture, User Experience Design, Behavioral Science, Social Sciences, or related field AND 2+ years User Experience Research experience
o OR equivalent experience.


UX Research IC3 - The typical base pay range for this role across the U.S. is USD $94,300 - $182,600 per year. There is a different range applicable to specific work locations, within the San Francisco Bay area and New York City metropolitan area, and the base pay range for this role in those locations is USD $120,900 - $198,600 per year.

Certain roles may be eligible for benefits and other compensation. Find additional benefits and pay information here: https://careers.microsoft.com/us/en/us-corporate-pay

Microsoft accepts applications and processes offers for these roles on an ongoing basis throughout the academic calendar (September – April).

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

Overview: We're seeking a User Experience Researcher to conduct user research and provide insights that inform the design and development of user-centered products and experiences. You'll be responsible for planning and executing research studies, analyzing data, and presenting actionable recommendations.

Key Responsibilities


Plan and execute user research studies, including interviews, surveys, and usability tests.
Analyze qualitative and quantitative data to uncover user needs, behaviors, and preferences.
Synthesize research findings into actionable insights and recommendations for product teams.
Collaborate with designers, product managers, and engineers to integrate user feedback into product development processes.
Stay updated with UX research methodologies and best practices.


Qualifications


Bachelor's or Master's degree in Human-Computer Interaction, Psychology, Sociology, or related field.
Experience conducting user research studies in a professional setting.
Proficiency in research methods and tools (e.g., user interviews, usability testing, survey design).
Strong analytical and critical thinking skills.
Excellent communication and collaboration abilities.


Benefits


Competitive salary and benefits package.
Opportunities to make a meaningful impact on product development.
Collaboration with cross-functional teams on innovative projects.
Contribution to creating user-centered products and experiences.
Flexible work arrangements and a supportive work environment.

Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: Kirkland, WA, USA; Seattle, WA, USA.Minimum qualifications:


Bachelor's degree in Human-Computer Interaction, Cognitive Science, Statistics, Psychology, Anthropology, related field, or equivalent practical experience.
4 years of experience in an applied research setting, or similar.
Experience with research design utilizing various methods (e.g., usability studies, contextual inquiry, surveys, etc.).
Relevant product research experience, either in an end-to-end, usability, or generative setting.


Preferred qualifications:


Master's or PhD degree in Human-Computer Interaction, Cognitive Science, Statistics, Psychology, Anthropology, or related field.
2 years of experience conducting UX research on products, managing projects, and working in a large, matrixed organization.
Understanding of the strengths and shortcomings of different research methods, including when and how to apply them during the product development process.
Experience in a variety of product spaces, applied research and/or academic settings.
Proficiency in communicating user research findings with cross-functional partners to drive impact.


About The Job

At Google, we follow a simple but vital premise: "Focus on the user and all else will follow." User Experience Researchers (UXRs) make this possible.

Google User Experience (UX) is made up of multi-disciplinary teams of UX Designers, Researchers, Writers, Content Strategists, Program Managers, and Engineers: we care deeply about the people who use our products. The UX team plays an integral part in gathering insights about the needs, attitudes, emotions, and behaviors of people who use our products to inspire and inform design. We collaborate closely with each other and with engineering and product management to create industry-leading products that deliver value for the people who use them, and for Google’s businesses.

As a User Experience Researcher (UXR), you’ll help your team of UXers, product managers, and engineers understand user needs. You’ll work with stakeholders across functions and levels and have impact at all stages of product development. You’ll play a critical role in creating useful, usable, and delightful products. You’ll explore user behaviors and motivations by conducting primary research such as field studies, interviews, diary studies, participatory workshops, ethnography, surveys, usability testing, and logs analysis.

The UXR community at Google is unique and will help you do your best work. You’ll have the opportunity to work with and learn from UXRs across Google through regular meetups, mentor programs, and access to internal research tools.

Google Cloud accelerates every organization’s ability to digitally transform its business and industry. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology, and tools that help developers build more sustainably. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.

The US base salary range for this full-time position is $118,000-$172,000 + bonus + equity + benefits. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location. The range displayed on each job posting reflects the minimum and maximum target for new hire salaries for the position across all US locations. Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range for your preferred location during the hiring process.

Please note that the compensation details listed in US role postings reflect the base salary only, and do not include bonus, equity, or benefits. Learn more about benefits at Google .

Responsibilities


Conduct independent research on multiple aspects of products and experiences.
Collect and analyze user behavior through lab studies, field visits, ethnography, surveys, benchmark studies, server logs and online experiments (A/B testing).
Work with Designers, Product Managers, Engineers and other UXRs to prioritize research opportunities in a fast-paced, rapidly changing environment.
Understand and incorporate complex technical and business requirements into research.
Advocate research findings to diverse audiences through written reports and in-person presentations.



Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .
Industries: Information Services and Technology, Information and Internet

Job_description:
Our UX Research team is designing for the global diversity of human needs, which requires us to deeply understand the behaviors of the people behind them. Our researchers tackle some of the most complex challenges to gain deeper insights into how people interact with each other and the world around them, and work collaboratively to contribute new ideas to products that impact the experiences of billions of people on a global scale. This job description represents different full-time roles across Meta.We use a variety of qualitative and quantitative methods to accomplish our goals, including surveys, focus groups, field studies, usability tests, and 1:1 interviews. We value a diverse range of perspectives and stem from many different backgrounds.We’re looking for excellent communicators who are knowledgeable about research devoted to understanding people, and curious about the relationship between technology and society. They will also need to be comfortable in a fast-moving organization, open-minded about learning new research methods, committed to high-quality and rigorous research, and focused on influencing the future of Meta.

UX Researcher, Mixed Methods Responsibilities:


Work closely with product and business teams to identify research topics
Act as a thought leader in the domain of research, while advocating for the people who could use our products
Design and execute end-to-end custom primary research using a wide variety of methods
Design studies that address both user behavior and attitudes
Ability to work independently and autonomously
Effectively manage and prioritize research plans through ambiguous and fast-changing environments, align and efficiently execute critical insights and work with a large group of stakeholders
Communicate results and illustrate suggestions in compelling and creative ways
Work cross-functionally with design, product management, content strategy, engineering and marketing
Generate insights that both fuel ideation and evaluate designs


Minimum Qualifications:


Bachelor’s degree with 10+ years’ of relevant experience in user experience, applied research and/or product research and development or a Master’s degree and 8+ years’ relevant experience, or PhD and 5+ year relevant experience
Relevant experience within user experience, applied research setting and/or product research and development
Experience conducting In-Depth Interviews or Focus Groups and Concept Testing or Usability Testing
Experience coding with R, SQL, STATA, SPSS or equivalent
Experience applying statistical analysis methods such as Regressions, ANOVA, and T-Tests
Interest in and experience executing hands-on, primary research
Experience translating research findings into strategic narratives


Preferred Qualifications:


Degrees in a human behavior related field, such as Human-Computer Interaction, Psychology, Sociology, Communication, Information science, Media studies, Computer Science, or Economics


About Meta:

Meta builds technologies that help people connect, find communities, and grow businesses. When Facebook launched in 2004, it changed the way people connect. Apps like Messenger, Instagram and WhatsApp further empowered billions around the world. Now, Meta is moving beyond 2D screens toward immersive experiences like augmented and virtual reality to help build the next evolution in social technology. People who choose to build their careers by building with us at Meta help shape a future that will take us beyond what digital connection makes possible today—beyond the constraints of screens, the limits of distance, and even the rules of physics.

Meta is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Meta participates in the E-Verify program in certain locations, as required by law. Please note that Meta may leverage artificial intelligence and machine learning technologies in connection with applications for employment.

Meta is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at accommodations-ext@fb.com.

Job_title: UX Researcher --- UX Product Design Conultant
Job_description:
ROLE 1 :-

UX PRODUCT DESIGNER CONSULTANT/EXPERT

12 MONTHS CONTRACT

100% REMOTE ROLE

VISA- USC/GC/H4-EAD ONLY

CLIENT- FORD

RATE- $60-62/HR C2C

Position Description

Remote Role

Our Senior UX Interaction Designers are experts in creating beautiful, usable solutions based on unbiased user research. They are at the forefront of setting strategic design direction for our financial suite of products and championing the voice of the user throughout our organization.

Skills Required

Designs lean, iterative, and development-ready solutions that can scale for the future, but understand the technology constraints of the now.

Thinks deeply about the user experience balanced with business goals to inform their designs.

Leads the product team (Product Owner, Project Manager, Software Engineers) through the user-centered design process with collaborative workshops for discovery and ideation.

Applies user research insights to drive product design and strategy, and help your team understand why and how to build better experiences.

Plans and executes user research in collaboration with internal stakeholders, and shares findings broadly across the organization.

Skills Preferred

Craft beautiful and usable designs for digital products by applying your domain expertise, deep research findings, and collaborating with peers across the product organization.

Conduct user research and experiments from planning to synthesis.

Play an active role in advocating for a Human-Centered Design process and creating a collaborative environment.

Engage and inspire the product organization about our customers' experiences through powerful story-telling of the human-centered design process, research insights, and customer journeys.

Lead as a 'player/coach' owning UX design and mentoring less experienced designers.

Experience Required

4+ years of experience as a UX/Interaction/Product Designer working across a breadth of digital media.

2+ years of experience leading the human-centered design process with highly collaborative, multidisciplinary teams.

Experience Preferred

6+ years of experience as a UX or Interaction Designer

Education Required

Bachelor's degree

Education Preferred

Master's in user experience, human-computer interaction, interaction design, service design, graphic design, or digital design related-degree.

Additional Information

Demonstrable experience in UX design and research in all phases across a variety of projects and mediums.

Deep expertise in Interaction & Visual Design, Information Architecture, UX Writing, and UX Research. Advanced knowledge of Sketch, InVision, Adobe Creative Suite, and/or other design and prototyping software.

Visualize and test concepts at varying levels of fidelity napkin sketches, sacrificial concepts, wireframes, interactive & functional prototypes, development-ready assets.

Experience synthesizing research findings into actionable insights that inform strategic decisions and design solutions.

ROLE 2 :-

UX RESEARCHER

12 MONTHS CONTRACT

REDMOND, WA

ONSITE FROM DAY 1

VISA- USC/GC/H4-EAD ONLY

CLIENT- MICROSOFT

RATE- $70-75/HR C2C

Typical Day in the Role

Key projects Design and research

Typical task breakdown and operating rhythm 20% meetings 70% research

What makes this role interesting? The team is very receptive and hungry for research, a good opportunity to have an impact

Unique Selling Points They will get to see their work show up in the products

Candidate Requirements

Years Of Experience Required 5 Plus Years

Degrees or certifications required - A Masters in a wide range of industries like experimental psychology. Cognitive psychology or engineering psychology.

Best vs. Average Knowledge of UX research and approaches

Performance indicators: Quality of work

Top 3 Hard Skills Required

Hard Skills Assessments

UX research (5 years)

Data analysis Techniques (5 years)

Quantitative analysis (5 years)

Summary

Microsoft Teams Research group is currently seeking an experienced, motivated, creative, and customer-focused Design Researcher Vendor.

Our UX Researchers are part of the Teams Calling, Meeting, and Devices multi-discipline Design Team and we partner closely with Program Management and Engineers to bring the Teams experiences to life. We design for a variety of platforms and form factors including desktops, tablets and mobile phones.

Our team has a strong culture of innovation and creativity with much opportunity to influence and grow professionally. The ideal candidate is passionate about creating user experiences that empower our users to be more productive and efficient.

In this role, you will work closely with an interdisciplinary research, design, and engineering team to define, and ultimately deliver the next generation of experiences for Teams.

As a Researcher on our team, you will have the opportunity to employ a wide range of research methodologies including field research, traditional usability tests, prototype testing, survey, and telemetry research.

The ideal candidate will have experience developing and executing proven research methods throughout all phases of software development to make recommendations and solve design problems.

Great oral and written communication skills are essential as you will be working closely with Designers, Engineers, Program Managers, and other Researchers to garner support for research plans and ensure action is taken on results in a highly collaborative work environment.

Skills & Qualifications

A minimum of MA/MS in Experimental Psychology, Cognitive Psychology, Human Factors, Human-Computer Interaction or a related field, OR significant industry experience

5+ years of industry experience conducting user research and driving tangible outcomes with product teams and a proven track record of success

Proven experience designing and conducting a range of formative and iterative research methods applicable to all product stages from conception to release (Enterprise experience a plus)

Thorough knowledge and experience across a range of UX research approaches and methodologies

Develop and maintain research plans and drive data into decisions across the product lifecycle

Demonstrated ability to articulate the implications of research finding in clear and compelling ways; translate research findings into actionable recommendations; ability to translate data into Insights

Strong written and verbal abilities

Experience managing design research knowledge that is leveraged across design and engineering teams

Track record of collaborating across disciplines (design, engineering) to drive change into products; must be able to work independently as well as part of a cohesive team

Proven ability to work within tight timelines and with excellent project management skills

Previous experience as user researcher conducting studies with a technical user base or in the B2B space is a plus

In 2022, we hired over 2,000 U.S.-based employees as consultants, contributing to workforce expansion and client service excellence.

Who We Are

As seen on TechCrunch, Forbes, and Bloomberg, join one of the fastest growing areas in FinTech by taking on the credit system.

Work directly with one of Inc.’s top female founders and learn from some of the most talented people in the industry. Headquartered in San Francisco, Tomo’s mission is to replace the outdated credit system and open access to banking.

We value passionate, down to earth, “can do” people who enjoy fine-tuning small details, without losing sight of the big picture. We are looking for someone who is driven to get things done and views obstacles as an exciting challenge that demands a creative solution. You are a self-starter with a high degree of rigor, organization, and discipline to get things done. Above all else, this role requires someone who takes great pride in their work and is inspired and motivated by their role in improving the way millions of people build their financial future.

The Role

Tomocredit is looking for a UX Designer to build user-facing UI for multiple frontend apps at Tomocredit. As a UX Designer, you’ll rely on user-centered design methods to craft industry-leading user experiences—from concept to execution. You’ll work closely with engineering, product, and management teams to execute on our vision to create a financial system that is open and accessible to everyone.

What You'll Be Doing


Consult with product and management teams to convert ideas to the user experience / frontend app
Design UI for web-based frontend apps
Design UI for the Tomo mobile app (currently React Native - both iOS & Android)
Define detailed styling, such as color and pixel values
Conduct usability testing
Create wireframes, storyboards, sitemaps and screen flows
Create product prototypes
Develop personas and usage scenarios
Analyze user feedback and activity, and iterate to enhance the user experience
Assist with content development
Conduct competitor and customer analysis


What You'll Need


Bachelor's degree in Design or equivalent practical experience.
Experience working with a team of engineers and product managers throughout the design process creating user flows, wireframes, building user interface mockups, and prototypes.
Experience designing consumer-facing experiences - must have worked on a consumer product before.
5+ years experience designing frontend/mobile apps in Figma or equivalent


Preferred Qualifications


Experience working on fintech products
Experience with coding and ability to troubleshoot using HTML, CSS and comparable languages


Why Tomocredit?

Make a huge impact on the future of credit. Be mentored by some of the most seasoned FinTech executives from Square, Lending Club, and American Express, or build your own path. We want people to build their career here because they love the people they work with. Help contribute and build a strong culture because that’s what we care about. That’s why we have generous benefits: Salary, Equity, Insurance, Flexible Vacation Policy and Company-sponsored outings are just a few great things Tomo has to offer. We’re also pet friendly!


Competitive Salary
Insurance: Medical, Dental and Vision benefits.
Equity: We're growing rapidly, and we want to share our future success/ financial upside with you. We offer an above-average ownership stake in Tomocredit for all employees.
Flexible vacation policy. We trust that you know how to manage your time wisely so you can finish your work on time without burnout. Within that trust, we offer a flexible vacation policy.
Company-sponsored outings. This is the best outlet to get to know each other outside work.
Pet-friendly office! Feel free to bring your furry friend to the office anytime:)


At Tomo diversity is important to us so all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regards to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.
Industries: Financial Services, Technology, Information and Internet, and Software Development

Duration: Long Term

Onsite role

Minimum 6+ years' experience designing interfaces

Experience designing for multi-platform products and implementing best practice

2 year of interaction design experience for touch-based mobile interfaces is a plus

Experience working in Agile / Scrum methodologies

Work samples demonstrating interaction design process and thinking.

Experienced with all aspects of a user-centered interaction design process, including user research, developing user flows, creating wireframes, conducting usability tests, and creating annotated design specifications.

Job Summary

Randstad Federal is seeking a UI/UX Designer in support of a Federal program at Department of State.

location: HERNDON, Virginia

job type: Permanent

salary: $150,000 - 160,000 per year

work hours: 8am to 4pm

education: Bachelors

Responsibilities

Responsibilities


Collect and evaluate user requirements, and work with engineers and product engineer to translate them into processes and systems
Use storyboards, process flows, and sitemaps to illustrate design concepts
Design graphic user interface elements
Create UI wireframes, mockups, and prototypes that clearly show how sites work and look
Identify UX problems, propose solutions and recommend implementations
Create pixel-perfect, world-class user interfaces and original, eye-catching visual design
Adhere to and help inform style standards on fonts, colors, and images
Deliver high quality work on tight schedules in a dynamic, agile product environment
Have a broad experience and a deep understanding of users to recommend UI features that solve customer needs
Support, communicate, course-correct, and revise through the development phase
Demonstrate the ability to solve design problems, from both a usability and visual perspective


Qualifications


Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Graphic Design, Visual Communications, or other comparable degree or experience in designing user experiences
Proven work experience as a UI/UX Designer or similar role, across various platforms and devices
Highly skilled in visual design software and wireframe tools
Proficiency in designing with a user-focused approach
Excellent communication skills to collaborate with cross-functional teams and business stakeholders
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and adapt to changing requirements and deadlines
Good time-management skills
A passionate learner who keeps up-to-date with design trends, tools, and techniques
Ability to work independently, prioritize, and solve problems proactively


Required Clearance


Active Secret or higher


Qualifications


Experience level: Experienced
Minimum 7 years of experience
Education: Bachelors


Skills


UI/UX


Equal Opportunity Employer: Race, Color, Religion, Sex, Sexual Orientation, Gender Identity, National Origin, Age, Genetic Information, Disability, Protected Veteran Status, or any other legally protected group status.

At Randstad Digital, we welcome people of all abilities and want to ensure that our hiring and interview process meets the needs of all applicants. If you require a reasonable accommodation to make your application or interview experience a great one, please contact HRsupport@randstadusa.com.

Pay offered to a successful candidate will be based on several factors including the candidate's education, work experience, work location, specific job duties, certifications, etc. In addition, Randstad Digital offers a comprehensive benefits package, including health, an incentive and recognition program, and 401K contribution (all benefits are based on eligibility).

Applications accepted on ongoing basis until filled.

Employment Type: Full Time, Mid-level

Department: Developer

CGS is seeking a talented, driven UI Designer to join our team helping our national security customers achieve deeper stakeholder engagement through the iterative, research-driven, user-centered design of their core applications and websites. In this role, you will lead efforts to design mission-critical applications and websites that provide seamless user experiences driven by modern, innovative interfaces. The ideal candidate possesses experience leading the iterative prototyping and design of modern, responsive web pages, applications, and other digital solutions that exceed the expectations of both clients and end users.

CGS brings motivated, highly skilled, and creative people together to solve the government’s most dynamic problems with cutting-edge technology. To carry out our mission, we are seeking candidates who are excited to contribute to government innovation, appreciate collaboration, and can anticipate the needs of others. Here at CGS, we offer an environment in which our employees feel supported, and we encourage professional growth through various learning opportunities.

Skills and attributes for success:


Ability to identify solutions to customer problems based on validated insights from the User Research team
Ability to manage the planning, design, and implementation of multiple sites and applications across multiple clients simultaneously in a fast-paced environment
Ability to collaborate with ECS engineers and federal clients to define, design, and implement innovative, beautiful, intuitive digital solutions for use by our federal customer and their stakeholders
Ability to collaborate with ECS UX and design research specialists in the analysis of user research to inform the design of highly usable web pages, application interfaces, and other dynamic solutions
Ability to create wireframes, storyboards, and site maps to effectively communicate interaction and design ideas for websites, applications, and other digital solutions
Ability to create scalable design resources to aid in project collaboration and the expansion of ECS creative services



Qualifications:


Must be a US Citizen
Must be able to obtain a Public Trust
Bachelor's Degree or equivalent experience
5+ years combined professional design experience (UI Design, Graphic Design, CX/UX, Design Research)
Strong online portfolio that showcases the candidate’s ability to make research-driven decisions in the design of responsive web and mobile applications
Results-oriented problem solver with high standards for quality, accuracy, attention to detail, and overall excellence
Strong understanding of the life cycle process of website development (discovery, planning, design, requirements, coding, testing, and user testing and evaluation)
Strong understanding of user interface design standards
Experience designing web and mobile applications that are compliant with 508 and US Web Design System (USWDS) standards
Experience prioritizing features while accounting for user goals and business requirements
Experience carrying designs from start to finish, from wireframes to delivery of final high-fidelity UI mockups
Experience establishing and maintaining rapid customer feedback loops to inform design at critical stages
Self-starter, motivated, confident, and can work independently as well as in a team environment
Success on projects designed from scratch as well as redesigns for established platforms or products
Advanced proficiency in Adobe XD, InDesign, Illustrator, and Photoshop



Ideally, you will also have:


Excellent interpersonal and client-focused skills—interacts well with all levels of staff and partners with a positive and enthusiastic attitude
Advanced coding knowledge (HTML, CSS, and JS)
Experience using Agile methodology to manage projects
Experience creating and modifying data visualizations
Experience evaluating existing systems and processes to identify UI issues and develop UI recommendations
Understanding of user research methodologies, user-centered design principles, and frameworks
Understanding of user personas, user flows, affinity mapping, and other research tools
Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite



Our Commitment

Contact Government Services (CGS) strives to simplify and enhance government bureaucracy through the optimization of human, technical, and financial resources. We combine cutting-edge technology with world-class personnel to deliver customized solutions that fit our client’s specific needs. We are committed to solving the most challenging and dynamic problems.

For the past seven years, we’ve been growing our government contracting portfolio, and along the way, we’ve created valuable partnerships by demonstrating a commitment to honesty, professionalism, and quality work.

Health, Dental, and Vision
Life Insurance
401k

Our UX Research team is designing for the global diversity of human needs, which requires us to deeply understand the behaviors of the people behind them. Our researchers tackle some of the most complex challenges to gain deeper insights into how people interact with each other and the world around them, and work collaboratively to contribute new ideas to products that impact the experiences of billions of people on a global scale. This job description represents different full-time roles across Meta.We use a variety of qualitative and quantitative methods to accomplish our goals, including surveys, focus groups, field studies, usability tests, and 1:1 interviews. We value a diverse range of perspectives and stem from many different backgrounds.We’re looking for excellent communicators who are knowledgeable about research devoted to understanding people, and curious about the relationship between technology and society. They will also need to be comfortable in a fast-moving organization, open-minded about learning new research methods, committed to high-quality and rigorous research, and focused on influencing the future of Meta.

UX Researcher, Mixed Methods Responsibilities:


Work closely with product and business teams to identify research topics
Act as a thought leader in the domain of research, while advocating for the people who could use our products
Design and execute end-to-end custom primary research using a wide variety of methods
Design studies that address both user behavior and attitudes
Ability to work independently and autonomously
Effectively manage and prioritize research plans through ambiguous and fast-changing environments, align and efficiently execute critical insights and work with a large group of stakeholders
Communicate results and illustrate suggestions in compelling and creative ways
Work cross-functionally with design, product management, content strategy, engineering and marketing
Generate insights that both fuel ideation and evaluate designs


Minimum Qualifications:


Bachelor’s degree with 7+ years’ of relevant experience in user experience, applied research and/or product research and development or a Master’s degree and 5+ years’ relevant experience, or PhD and 2+ year relevant experience
Relevant experience within user experience, applied research setting and/or product research and development
Experience conducting In-Depth Interviews or Focus Groups and Concept Testing or Usability Testing
Experience coding with R, SQL, STATA, SPSS or equivalent
Experience applying statistical analysis methods such as Regressions, ANOVA, and T-Tests
Interest in and experience executing hands-on, primary research
Experience translating research findings into strategic narratives


Preferred Qualifications:


Experience with consumer products, consumer insights, or product development
Degrees in a human behavior related field, such as Human-Computer Interaction, Psychology, Sociology, Communication, Information science, Media studies, Computer Science, or Economics


About Meta:

Meta builds technologies that help people connect, find communities, and grow businesses. When Facebook launched in 2004, it changed the way people connect. Apps like Messenger, Instagram and WhatsApp further empowered billions around the world. Now, Meta is moving beyond 2D screens toward immersive experiences like augmented and virtual reality to help build the next evolution in social technology. People who choose to build their careers by building with us at Meta help shape a future that will take us beyond what digital connection makes possible today—beyond the constraints of screens, the limits of distance, and even the rules of physics.

Meta is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Meta participates in the E-Verify program in certain locations, as required by law. Please note that Meta may leverage artificial intelligence and machine learning technologies in connection with applications for employment.

Meta is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at accommodations-ext@fb.com.

About C Squared Social

We are a full-service digital marketing agency for businesses of all sizes, offering paid advertising, content marketing, website development, photo/video and graphic design services. Diverse portfolio of B2B and B2C clients in sectors including healthcare, retail, finance, food and beverage, transportation, etc. We have also been included as one of Inc 5000 fastest growing companies in the US.  




Job Overview

The UI/UX Designer, Lead is responsible for designing the overall layout and site architecture for websites and web applications. Their duties include designing web pages or entire websites, meeting with clients to review requirements and specifications or refine their designs, and running tests to preview layouts and website features. The UI/UX Designer, Lead will also perform a lead role for all website projects. 




Responsibilities include 

Coordinating tasks
Defining project milestones
Communicating with clients




Qualifications

Degree in related field or equivalent experience preferred
Understanding of website design
Excellent written and verbal skills
Proficient with wireframing software tools (XD, Figma, etc.)
Experience with typography and layout
Experience with making products and technology usable, enjoyable, and accessible
Experience with performing usability tests on software products or website features to ensure functionality
Understanding of advertising and marketing principles
Ability to understand client specifications and user psychology and predict what might work best for both
A positive, solution-oriented, problem-solving, customer-centric attitude




A Stand-Out Candidate Will Also Have

A link to portfolio of past experience
Introductory Experience with WordPress or similar CMS platform
Graphic Design Experience
Knowledge of SEO (search engine optimization) as it relates to website design




Benefits (effective the first of the month after hire):

Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance
401(k) with Company match
Three (3) weeks of vacation
Flexible 8 hour work day (7:00a-7:00p)
Hybrid – 4 days in/1 day work-from-home
Snack and coffee bar
Corporate gym discount
Complimentary use of bird scooters for in-office or coffee runs

Job Description

Job Description Salary:ABOUT US

321 is a full service marketing agency built on—and fueled by—the uniquely collective strength of our people. We know what it’s like to grind, to create, to dream—we’ve been there before. Our team is built by badass individuals who are all so much more than a job title; leaders who skipped the beaten path and carved their own way. Talent comes from all walks of life and inspiration isn’t born in uniformity.

And we’re

always

searching for talent ready to focus on what matters and create the best work of our lives. You in?

About The Role

A UI/UX Designer at 321 will conceptualize, design, and execute creative solutions that consistently invite the user to move through stages of conversion. These designers consistently put user experience first and effectively communicate our client's brand identity, positioning, and messaging. Designers in this position can clearly communicate the “why” behind their interactive designs and the importance of merging beautiful aesthetics with functional, accessible design solutions. They will work closely with the Brand designers, Content Team, Art Director and Creative Director.

What You’ll Do

UI Design Strategy and Execution

Work within a collaborative team to ideate, conceptualize, design, and produce an array of digital executions according to identified goals and pain points. Solutions include websites, product, and app experiences.Build on a creative brief and direction from the Creative Director in a manner consistent with brand guidelines. Develop a spectrum of directions for each project.Develop strategic rationale around each decision. Apply the latest in UX/UI best practices from the concept to execution phases of a project. Follow trends, yet never lose sight of the historical design shoulders we’re standing on.Expand brand assets and color palettes strategically, based on medium.Hold the Creative team’s bar regarding pixel-perfect output in Figma.Build component-driven UI systems for large scale websites.Understand and apply competitor, positioning, and user research from the Content Team.Create both lo- and hi-fidelity prototypes, incorporating motion as needed.Design intuitive, aesthetically pleasing, interactive elements and interfaces that are consistent and coherent.Possess an eye for detail and a variety of design styles, along with the ability to build out and combine aesthetic styles into moodboards and into the final pixels.

UX Design Strategy and Execution

Identify and solve user problems by mapping out the bare bones of a user journey.Support the pre-design phase by conducting thorough research including competitor and customer analysis, and applying this research to an overarching strategy communicated clearly to our internal team.Develop personas, usage scenarios, storyboards, sitemaps, prototyping, and screen flows as necessary to analyze and support the user story.Create initial concepts, mid to hi-fidelity wireframes, functional design solutions, and UX/UI inspiration and techniques.Design intuitive, aesthetically pleasing, interactive elements and interfaces that are consistent and coherent.Possess an eye for detail and a variety of design styles.

Present & Support Work

Present campaign collateral

in a meaningful way that builds a relationship and confidence with our client partners.Clearly articulate the “why” behind designs and defend design choices to the benefit of the client’s goals.

Stay Current & Reliable

Be a self-starter and quick learner, with the ability to deliver work on time and within scope.Follow and practice the latest design trends, technologies and social media platforms.Demonstrate proficiency in the Figma and prototyping tools, Adobe Creative Suite, specifically Photoshop, Illustrator, AfterEffects & InDesign and any new or emerging technologies

What You Have

4+ years designing for brands in an agency settingA book that represents eye-catching & award-winning designs with a focus on User Interface and User Experience.Strong commitment to meeting deadlines.Proven skill at handling multiple projects simultaneously.Ability to focus on the details, but also see how projects fit into larger company goals.A well developed ability to give constructive design critique and positively guide creative growth in others.Ability to work well in an agile, fast moving team environment.Agency experience is preferred.

Reporting Structure

This position reports directly to the Creative Director.

FIND YOUR MISSION

Missions are accomplished with people, driving towards a greater purpose. At ClearCompany, our mission is to help our 2000+ clients achieve theirs. When talking to our own team of A players, you’ll find that it’s not only the opportunity to drive this mission forward that keeps us thriving. It’s the freedom, flexibility, and support ClearCompany provides back which contributes to our professional development and the pursuit of our personal missions and passions outside of work. Learn more about our state of the art, cloud-based talent platform and why you should consider joining us here.

SENIOR PRODUCT/UX DESIGNER & RESEARCHER

We are looking to complement our Product Design team with someone with a passion for understanding user needs, and the experience to apply that passion to real-world product design problems. We are an organization that cares about its product team, believes team collaboration is a better way to problem-solve, and provides a supportive environment where you can do your best work and grow professionally.

The base compensation for this position is $135,000 to $150,000 annualized depending on experience and qualifications.

Who You Will Work With


As a member of an experienced, three-person design team, you will be partnered with a talented engineering, quality assurance and product management team - all passionate about creating and bringing to market the most innovative, beautiful, and usable products possible
You will work with company leadership and product management in a highly visible and collaborative environment to transform vision and ideas into implementable product
You will partner with product managers to conduct user research to understand our customers’ needs, get feedback on ideas, designs, prototypes
You will collaborate with data scientists to design and integrate analytics and data visualizations into the product
Our team has a diverse set of backgrounds and perspectives, which has helped us build the amazing culture we have today. That culture, along with our core value of “Ideas Over Egos,” has enabled us to create an inclusive environment where everyone’s voice can be heard
This role reports directly to the Director of User Experience, who reports directly to the President and Co-Founder of ClearCompany.


What You’ll Do


To start, you’ll focus on learning the product, our design patterns, and our processes by getting involved in small projects first
To help you get to know our users, you’ll use your expertise in user research to support various project teams answer questions about our users’ needs
After your ramp period, you’ll lead user-centered, business-goals-aware design efforts on product enhancements and new product initiatives


What We’d Like You To Have


5+ years working as a Product/UX Designer and/or UX Researcher for SaaS or equivalent software products
Creativity, especially as it pertains to solving real-world problems through user research and design of software solutions
Embodiment of “ideas over egos,” team-oriented, respectful, humble, and collaborative
Independent/autonomous with the ability to work effectively on your own, sometimes with little direction
A portfolio is not required but would be nice to see if you have one. If you don’t have one, or it’s been a long time since you last updated it, no worries, we’ll figure out the best way for us to review your most recent and past work.


What You’ll Love About Clearcompany


The people! Our employees and customers consistently express the best thing about ClearCompany is our close-knit, exceptionally talented team. Check out our achievements and G2 reviews.
A commitment to diversity & inclusion. Engagement = Inclusion. Your uniqueness powers our vision of a world where organizations perform optimally with empowered managers and engaged employees. Not only will you transform how we do business, but you will be a catalyst to change the world of work for our 2,000+ customers. We have an employee driven DE&I task force, partnership with Change Cadet DEIB Advisory Services, and we support employee engagement channels such as DE&I, LGBTQIA+, Women in Tech, and Women in Leadership.
Outstanding benefits. Flexible vacation, 90% employer paid medical/dental/vision, 401k with match, and even pet insurance. We’ve got your back so you can live your best life. See the full list here.
It’s about ideas over egos. You will have the freedom to explore new ideas and approaches in an entrepreneurial environment, supported by a collaborative team. Learn more about our core values.
Professional growth. We have promoted 24% of our team members annually compared to 11% across the industry and open new roles to our employees first. ClearCompany is an equal opportunity employer. We support and encourage diversity.

Upwork ($UPWK) is the world's work marketplace. We serve everyone from one-person startups to large, Fortune 100 enterprises with a powerful, trust-driven platform that enables companies and talent to work together in new ways that unlock their potential.

Last year, more than $3.8 billion of work was done through Upwork by skilled professionals, who gained more control by finding work they are passionate about and innovating their careers. In the past few years, we have seen tremendous change in the ways we work and an unprecedented acceleration in the adoption of AI. This role is an opportunity to work at the forefront and intersection of the future of work.

We’re seeking a qualitative UX Researcher to become an integral part of an accomplished team. In this role, you'll lead research, collaborating with cross-functional teams of design, content, product, engineering, marketing, and analytics partners to bring the power of insights to Upwork’s design and business decisions. Empowered by a robust design and research culture, you will continuously build a strong understanding of the value our products must deliver to our users and develop insights that bridge the gap between attitudinal and behavioral data. Your work will inform several initiatives, from funnel optimization to creating something from the ground up, helping to shape high-quality experiences for the millions of clients and talent who use our platform daily.

Your responsibilities:


Be a core User Experience (UX) team member, ensuring User Research helps us develop a deep understanding of Upwork’s customers, products, business, and competitive landscape to identify new areas for exploration.
Contribute to our learning objectives and prioritize opportunities in partnership with Design, Product, Analytics, Marketing, and Engineering teams.
Proactively seek guidance to manage competing priorities and help your team focus on the most critical learning opportunities.
Communicate context and project goals as part of the process of sharing your work.
Actively learn to create a culture of great working relationships with cross-functional partners on your team by implementing valued research rituals that bring everyone closer to people's needs.
Build a research method toolkit that includes secondary, primary, generative, and evaluative methods while gaining foundational know-how in working with mixed-method approaches.
Learn how to experiment with and de-risk new methods that bring a more strategic point of view to the work at hand.
Contribute to and execute research plans from recruitment through synthesis and analysis and insight-sharing.
Study our diverse global user base, crafting studies to test designs remotely and in different cultural contexts.
Participate in Design Thinking workshops, ensuring teams ideate with user empathy in always in mind..
Translate customer insights into actionable recommendations. Communicate insights within the product and engineering teams in a format that inspires action.
Advocate research findings to diverse audiences through written reports, in-person presentations, or facilitation of co-synthesis and workshops.



What it takes to catch our eye:


Proven industry experience as a UX Researcher in fast-paced, data-driven companies
Experience with qualitative research and/or product user experience (UX) research, in addition to some mixed-method approaches, including data analysis and survey design
Experience conducting research in marketplaces and understanding marketplace dynamics
Strong ability to learn best practices for quickly immersing yourself in a problem space and knowing where and when to bring perspectives on consumer, tech, industry, societal, and cultural trends into the work to create impact
Experience regularly sharing research work to encourage a continuous learning culture within your teams
Showcase how you’ve led by example and inspired others through your consistent focus, delivery, and impact
Demonstrable experience raising awareness of inclusion and representation in your and your team's approach to research
Demonstrable experience creating actionable, research-backed UXR deliverables
Strong collaboration skills and experience partnering seamlessly with cross-functional stakeholders
Experience telling stories that resonate, using words, visuals, and data as needed
A strong motivation for learning and self-growth within the UXR practice
Proven high bar for quality and attention to detail
***Portfolio is required***



How to really knock our socks off:


Comfortable immersing yourself in business-critical initiatives and partnering with XFN teams and other researchers to support our business strategy
Support multiple work streams and initiatives concurrently while connecting dots across your team’s work
Case studies that demonstrate your research skills with experiences that are core to business success
Strong work ethic with the drive and willingness to focus and commit
A passionate advocate for creating high-quality designs that deliver memorable experiences that users will love



The annual base salary for this position in California and Washington ranges from $116,750 - $137,250. The range displayed reflects the minimum and maximum salary for this position in California and Washington, and individual base pay will depend on your skills, qualifications, experience, and location. Additionally, this position is eligible for the annual bonus plan or sales incentive plan and eligibility to participate in our long term equity incentive program.

Come Change How The World Works.

At Upwork, you’ll shape talent solutions for how the world works today. We are a remote-first organization working together to create exciting remote work opportunities for a global community of professionals. While we have physical offices in San Francisco and Chicago, currently we also support hiring of corporate full-time employees in 19 states in the United States. Please speak with a member of our recruitment team to determine whether you are located in a state in which we are hiring corporate full-time employees.

Our vibrant culture is built on shared values and our mission to create economic opportunities so that people have better lives. We foster amazing teams, put our community first, and have a bias toward action. We encourage everyone to bring their whole selves to work and grow together through development opportunities, mentorship, and employee resource groups. Oh yeah, we’ve also got amazing benefits.

Check out our Life at Upwork page to learn more about the employee experience.

Upwork is proudly committed to recruiting and retaining a diverse and inclusive workforce. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we never discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical condition), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

To learn more about how Upwork processes and protects your personal information as part of the application process, please review our Global Job Applicant Privacy Notice
Industries: Technology, Information and Internet and Human Resources Services

Job_description:
Responsibilities

Kforce's client in Jacksonville, FL is seeking a UI/UX Designer to join their team Responsibilities:


Conduct user research, including user interviews, surveys, and usability testing
Analyze user research findings to identify user needs and pain points
Design user flows, wireframes, and high-fidelity mockups using Figma, ensuring responsive and mobile-friendly design
Prototype interactive interfaces using Figma or other tools
Collaborate with engineers to ensure designs are feasible and meet technical requirements
Build and maintain a robust design system
Advocate for user-centered design principles within the team
Stay up-to-date on the latest UX trends and best practices


Requirements


3+ years of experience as a UX/UI designer
Proven ability to design user-centered experiences across different digital products, with a focus on responsive/mobile-friendly design
Proficiency in Figma and other design tools (e.g., Sketch, Adobe XD), with experience in creating and managing reusable components and design systems
Must be a self-starter and work in a very agile manner, thriving in a fast-paced environment with the ability to handle multiple priorities and meet deadlines
Strong problem-solving skills, able to identify and address design challenges effectively
Excellent communication and collaboration skills, allowing you to effectively communicate design ideas with all stakeholders
Must provide a portfolio of work showcasing your design skills and experience


The pay range is the lowest to highest compensation we reasonably in good faith believe we would pay at posting for this role. We may ultimately pay more or less than this range. Employee pay is based on factors like relevant education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, seniority, location, performance, union contract and business needs. This range may be modified in the future.

We offer comprehensive benefits including medical/dental/vision insurance, HSA, FSA, 401(k), and life, disability & ADD insurance to eligible employees. Salaried personnel receive paid time off. Hourly employees are not eligible for paid time off unless required by law. Hourly employees on a Service Contract Act project are eligible for paid sick leave.

Note: Pay is not considered compensation until it is earned, vested and determinable. The amount and availability of any compensation remains in Kforce's sole discretion unless and until paid and may be modified in its discretion consistent with the law.

This job is not eligible for bonuses, incentives or commissions.

Kforce is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

Salary: $80,000 - $90,000 per year
Industries: Retail Office Equipment, E-Learning Providers, and Professional Training and Coaching

Job_description:
What we��re looking for

A designer proficient in English and Spanish, skilled in UX/UI design, Figma, wireframing, and more. You should excel in creating designs that simplify complex processes, ensuring our SaaS platform is accessible to non-technical managers.

Responsibilities


Holistic UX design
Market research
Prototyping and user testing
Wireframing and flow creation
Visual and interaction design


Requirements


Bachelor’s or Master's degree in Design, Computer Science, or Related Field
Expertise in UI/UX Design, Figma, and wireframing
Proficiency in English and Spanish
Ability to conduct market research


Benefits


A role in building product at a leading SaaS company
Opportunities for substantial professional growth in Design, UX, and Product
Competitive salary and benefits package, including healthcare and unlimited PTO
Flexible remote work options within Americas time zones

Job Summary:

UX Designer with a strong background in UI/UX Design and user research to

Works with the product owner(s), customers and scrum team(s) to enhance our customer experience. In this role, you should be an analytical and creative designer who is able to grasp user needs and solve problems. A strong portfolio of successful UX and other technical projects is essential. Ultimately, you will make our product more user-friendly and intuitive to attract and retain customers.




Have experience in customer research, interviews, survey’s, usability testing, all the way through execution. Facilitate and execute on test throughout lifecycle. How to build customer persona, pressure testing, understand personas.




Building website from scratch, information architecture, best way to map out/lay out, site mapping, have experience building out a website for a future state.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

The essential functions include, but are not limited to:

1. Strong UI/UX design skills showcasing problem solving techniques focused on the customer

2. Expertise in design software such as Figma, Figjam, and Miro.

3. Deep understanding of user-centered design principles and practices.

4. Strong understanding of usability principles, journey mapping techniques, information architecture, and interaction design.

5. Experience in conducting user research and usability testing to support evidence-focused design decisions.

6. Excellent communication skills to articulate design decisions and process.

7. Define and execute a customer centric strategy to focus on the customer experience through user research

8. Strong journey mapping experience.

9. Developing wireframes and task flows based on user needs

10. Collaborating with Designers and Developers to create intuitive, user-friendly software

11. Understand product specifications and user psychology

12. Conduct concept and usability testing and gather feedback

13. Create personas through user research and data

14. Define the right interaction model and evaluate its success

15. Work with existing UI Developer to create wireframes and prototypes around customer needs

16. Find creative ways to solve UX problems (e.g. usability, findability)

17. Ability to lead and manage a team




Basic Qualifications:

1. Bachelor’s degree in Business or other relevant discipline such as UX Design, Human-Computer Interaction, Design Thinking, or a related discipline.

2. 10+ years of proven experience as a UX Designer responsible for Design and UX Research and advocating for customer experience

3. 3 – 5 years of user research and usability testing




Other Qualifications:

1. Strong Interpersonal and consultative skills – Seeks understanding, excellent listener

2. Strong presentation and communication skills

3. Ability to collaborate across product, engineering, marketing and key stakeholders

4. Detail-oriented and able to deliver at an elevated level of accuracy

5. Experience working with agile development methodologies.

6. Strong portfolio showcasing web application projects, detailing your role and process

7. Strong portfolio of design projects

8. Proven expertise in creating designs that work seamlessly across multiple devices and screen sizes

9. Background in project management and research

10. Familiarity with interaction design and information architecture

11. Proficient in design software (e.g. Figma)

12. Some knowledge of HTML/CSS; JavaScript/React is a plus

13. Problem-solving aptitude

14. Analytical mind with a business acumen

15. Effective communication skills and the ability to articulate design decisions and thought processes

Conversational User Experience Designer

Client: Fortune 500 e-commerce Company

Location: Arlington, VA (primarily REMOTE, but must be able to onboard onsite in Arlington, VA)

Duration: 10-month contract

pay rate: $64-$69/hr




This role for a Senior Conversational UX Designer will lead various projects owning the voice interaction model for experiences that span information, entertainment, smart home, and other capabilities. They will also work closely with visual interaction designers on multimodal screened devices to define the end-to-end interaction across modalities and device form factors.




Responsibilities:

- Create world-class user-centered designs through consideration of UX research, market research, business requirements, customer feedback, and usability study findings

- Demonstrate leadership in driving design processes into the organization that help refine strategy

- Translate business requirements into use cases and high-level customer experience requirements

- Design the interface and interaction flow of new voice and multimodal applications

- Develop conceptual diagrams and voice interaction prototypes

- Develop and maintain detailed user-interface specifications

- Present design work to the user experience team, product team, engineering team, our leadership, and external partners for review and feedback

- Develop high-level strategies for interconnected experiences for both near and long-term

- Collaborate and co-own experience, frameworks, process, and best practices with other designers and subject matter experts




Basic Qualifications:




6 years of design experience
Have an available online portfolio
Experience with design tools such as Figma, Photoshop, Illustrator, and prototyping in HTML, JavaScript, CSS
Experience as a Conversation UX Design Specialist
Experience with Voice Flow or similar audio system
Strong communication skills and ability to work independently







Preferred Qualifications:




- Experience applying scrum to visual or UX design processes

- Experience with UX design of complex workflows

- Experience creating guidance and training for design and content production teams

Title: Sr. UX ResearcherWork Location: Onsite/hybrid in Seattle, WAIndustry: Technology, Media & Telecom;TMT - TechnologyClient: XWork Authorization: USC/GCRate: XNeed a VERY strong UX Researcher with strong experience in AI/ML and modeling. It's critical the resource has a thorough understanding of ML models and overall strong ML experience. Requires a very strong UXR in multiple methods and be able to flex between them all as needed when conducting UXR. Experience in qual, quant, mixed methods and applying them into technical/ENG business questions in highly complex and fast moving/emerging spaces is ideal.Role The Resource will plan, execute, and deliver reporting and presentations on UXR and literature reviews for Core ML UX The Resource will consult on past research and with business partners on user perspective The Resource will identify needs for future research and places where research is not needed.

Title: Senior User Experience Researcher

Company: Healthcare Client

Work Model: 100% Remote

Engagement: 6 Month C2H

Compensation: $55-$60/hr. | $110,000-$120,000

Included: W2, Comprehensive Benefits, Paid Holidays, etc.







At [Client], we design apps (desktop, web, mobile) for physicians to help them manage, treat, and improve the lives and the care of their patients. Healthcare IT is notorious for lagging behind consumer products in design, user experience, and customer satisfaction. Our goal is to change the status quo by creating a suite of physician-focused products that delight users and enable clinicians to take better care of their patients.




We are looking for Senior UX candidates that are up for a challenge. Healthcare is rife with complexities and the learning curve is steep. If you have a passion for improving user experiences and the ability to press through adversity, we look forward to meeting you.




Senior UX Researcher

We are looking for a creative and collaborative user researcher who can keep the user at the center of our designs. You will work closely with the UX team and product owners to turn findings into great user experiences.




You would be primarily responsible for user research studies, directly impacting design strategies and applications. You must be able to create & run multiple types of user tests, analyze the collected data, and present the results along with your recommendations and meaningful user insights to all organizational levels with the highest quality.




The ability to support interaction design and prototyping would be a great asset to our team but not required.




Experience 5+ years




Core Requirements

Ability to work in fast-paced agile environment
Take smart risks and champion new ideas
Work with minimal supervision on multiple concurrent projects
Ability to collaborate with others
Be open to receiving feedback and constructive criticism
Be willing to help teammates, share knowledge, and learn from them
Effectively communicate project status to management on a regular basis
Plans own work executing against deadlines
Some travel required

Researcher Requirements

Quantitative research background with knowledge of SQL and the ability to manage and query data
Mixed method researcher
A solid grasp of user-centered design, testing methodologies and usability
Demonstrable user impact and influence on product experience
Research including user personas, surveys & journey maps
Planning and executing research projects, drawing on research from various areas of the business: analytics, customer insight, support, account managers
Identify the proper research methods based upon product phase and timeline
Recruit test participants and manage participant scheduling
Create test criteria and run usability study sessions
Experience in qualitative and quantitative results impacting product strategy
Partner with UX team and product owners to understand detailed requirements
Involve team in your research sessions to ensure its effectiveness
Lead the effort to share user data and insights across the organization to build a culture of user-centered design
Develop research reports with clear and actionable recommendations
Effectively and creatively communicate research and play a key role in stimulating designs for the product
Familiar with testing methods including online remote, phone interview, surveys and focus groups and ability to introduce additional methods into our projects
Be passionate about all things UX
Ability to clearly and effectively communicate design processes, ideas, and solutions to stakeholders, teams, and users




Bonus Skills

Coding/Programming Skills such as R
Mixpanel and Salesforce software experience
Experience in healthcare

Are you passionate about crafting exceptional user experiences in the eCommerce space? We're seeking a talented Senior UX Researcher. We're thrilled to present this exciting opportunity for a skilled individual who thrives in a collaborative environment and possesses a strong background in UX Research.




Requirements:

Minimum of 5 years of experience in UX Research, preferably in a senior role.
Proven track record in conducting various user research activities such as usability testing, user interviews, surveys, persona development, and journey mapping.
Exceptional analytical skills with the ability to derive actionable insights from complex data.
A robust portfolio showcasing past work experience and deliverables.
Background in design for eCommerce, retail, and/or supply chain industries.
Familiarity with Agile/Scrum methodologies is preferred.




Responsibilities:

Plan, execute, and synthesize qualitative and quantitative user research, encompassing usability testing, contextual inquiries, surveys, interviews, and competitive analysis.
Collaborate closely with Product/UX/UI designers, product managers, and engineers to translate research findings into innovative design solutions.
Develop and maintain personas, journey maps, behaviors, and workflow analyses to inform design decisions effectively.
Cultivate a culture of continuous testing and learning, establishing best practices and methodologies for user research within the team.




If you're passionate about shaping user experiences and thrive in a dynamic, collaborative environment, we'd love to hear from you. Join us in revolutionizing the eCommerce landscape through insightful UX research and design innovation.
Industries: Manufacturing and Motor Vehicle Parts Manufacturing
